description:
12:50 on a Wednesday afternoon, party of 4. 
It was a full house but they said it would not be long. We perused the menu outside on the board as we waited. Sensing we were in a hurry, the kind woman at the register took our order so that once we were seated our food would come quickly. Very thoughtful. 
So many great options to suit all needs, but we were able to narrow it down. Food came a few minutes after we were seated and settled. 
Bacon breakfast- basic and good
sausage Benedict- whiskey sausage- unique and delicious, nothing overpowering
korean street tacos- spicy and packed with flavor chicken fried steak- solid (offered with eggs or mashers n veggies) who doesn't love options!
Service was truly 5 stars. Server checked on us several times before bringing the bill. 
We finished quickly and when we paid we noticed a discount on the check - VIP. Having never been here before I was not sure how we got this discount, but I believe it was because in chatting she asked if we were in a hurry to get to a show (theater district). We had just come from an outreach event for the homeless and she seemed touched by it. Very sweet of her to extend the discount to our group. 
Love the compassion. We will be back to try the many other items we wanted. Thank you Sam's Diner!
author: Elaine S.

description:
Went to the diner before seeing Waitress (my hub loves a theme).  The place is cute and has big TVs without hitting you over the head with diner kitsch.  The servers were great... not too pushy and helpful.  We were sitting near the front and could see how rude the hostess was to people coming in... I don't think she smiled at one person.  So it was a Saturday and they are near the Orpheum, so it is not crazy to think they are busy most Saturdays when there is a show at the Orpheum.  There is no way that the hostess should have been that frazzled.  It really bothered me because I had to watch it for my whole meal. 
The food was ok. The onion rings were very greasy.  The burgers were good as well, but my hub's burger was a bit under. 
We are frequent Theatre goers, so we may go back.
author: Dawn R.

description:
We were looking for a place to eat before seeing a show at the Orpheum.  Just yelped some restaurants when we got off BART and Sams came up.  I am sooo glad we chose to eat here.  It is super close to the theater, like across the street, the prices were very fair for SF, the portions were large and the food we had was awesome.  My wife had the veggie Korean tacos, which looked great.  My daughter and I split The Rock burger and onion rings.  Our burger was so good, juicy, flavorful....the onion rings were great too.  We will definitely be eating here again.

Sams is small, so if you don't have reservations expect a wait.  We snuck in without reservations right before the dinner rush.
author: Derrick L.

description:
So, my spouse and I are regulars at seeing musicals. We're always looking for good eats near one or the other of the venues in San Francisco and frustration has often been the bi-word between us.

No longer.

We've discovered Sam's Diner and boy are we happy!

It's no more than half a block from the Orpheum...that should be worth five stars in and of itself. Knowing this, the owners have musical memorabilia decorating the place which makes eating her all the more fun.
Let future diners beware: This place is popular! And, I encountered a line out the door when I arrived. Thankfully, once can make reservations on Yelp to secure a table.

The food isn't bad either: Typical American bill of fare with hints of Korean Bulgogi almost everywhere! On my first venture out I had the fish and chips, my spouse had the French Dip Sandwhich, and my son had the Bulgogi Burrito. That burrito was monstrous in size! Where he found room to put all that is anyone's guess.

Portions here are generous and even as busy as the place is, the timing of food arrival isn't bad either. 

Better still, the price point works!

So why not five stars?  My fish and chips came a little cold. I believe it to be a one off as the place was busy, humming like a jet engine. You don't get that many people by being inconsistent. It's all the more reason I need to come back!
author: Ron C.

description:
My review is mainly on the food - I got the 2 eggs, 3 bacon, sour dough bread with tater tots. I thought it was ok, nothing stood out. If you're hungry, this place is good to stop by. The nice thing about SAM's is that their menu is extensive so if your group of friends are struggling to find a common ground, this place has burgers, brunch, breakfast, and Korean food all here! 

Plenty of seating - modern inside, a nice restaurant away from the busy Civic Center. They have quick service too. We were a group of 7 and got seated right away. Although the place was packed and it was during lunch, we got our food within 10-15 minutes. 

It's a 3 for now but I most likely will be back to try other items

PS they automatically charge you gratuity for bigger groups and can split up to 5 checks per table.
author: Sherluna V.

description:
Great Coffee & Delicious Food! 

The chlaquiles are Mexican approved & they a must at Sam's. 

The Farmers Market Scramble soo good! 

Prices are great for amount & quality of food.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I come here pretty often as I live nearby, and this place definitely hits the spot in numerous ways. I think their burgers are absolutely delicious; I would recommend trying some of their specialty burgers, but another nice alternative is to 'Make your own burger', which already comes with most of the ingredients that you'd want, and you'd simply need to add guac or cheese or something like that. Brings the total cost of the burger to still less than one of their specialty burgers, and it might end up being exactly what you're looking for. I haven't had their salmon salad but my girlfriend always gets it and she loves it, so that's also a good option. A side of sweet potato fries also hits the spot.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Really, really wanted to like this place more because of how chic it is inside (great lighting, nice furniture, cool bar setup with an open diner kitchen) and the great service, but my bulgogi tacos really just weren't that good. They didn't have any flavor, and were soggy because of the sheer volume of condiments poured onto them. 

However, I liked the place enough that I'll probably be back and will update this.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Was visiting SF for the weekend and decided to take out dinner from SAM's on a fine Saturday evening. Took out a Mediterranean Plate and Pesto Chicken with Linguini. I didn't like either. I suppose the Mediterranean Plate doesn't travel well. The pitas were cold and brittle and the hummus was too dilute. The Linguini had little to no salt, and a layer of solid cheese shredded over it. Not cool. 

The person at the front desk was super nice though; good location and pretty interiors too. They earn SAM's three stars.
author: Amit D.

description:
Excellent breakfast spot that, on the weekends, isn't overflowing with techies.

We'll come in before heading over to the great farmers market at Civic center on Sunday mornings.

The food is above average dinner food with great service in a fresh, clean and new feeling dinner. The coffee is about the same as Starbucks. I'd you can I might skip the coffee. Any time they bring coffee with the spoon already in I get worried.

I often get the Loco Moco. The sauce is super good and burger char is perfect. Good quality rice helps too!

$20 per person which is a great price!!

I like this place a lot.
author: Justin S.

description:
Came here solo pre theater and I am pleasantly surprised!  Menu options with the current musical's
themes.  I opted for the really tasty Cobb Salad.  Veggies nice and crisp and very fresh.  Chicken well seasoned and moist.  They do not skimp on portion sizes here at Sam's.  Great service.  Crowded but wait staff was attentive and courteous plus they were able to accommodate this party of one.  Location on Market St. just two doors down from that sketchy Burger King on the corner but that STILL doesn't take away from my experience.  I've finally found my go to dinner spot ore theater and I'm excited to come back and explore other menu options!
author: Laura K.

description:
Went in on a Wednesday night and the place was packed! Always a good sign. 

Based on the yelp pictures posted I decided on the Golden Beet Salad and I added chicken. I also got a side of tater tots. 

Wow! The beets were perfect, not too hard and not too soft. While the chicken added protein, it was the perfect blend of flavors. 

The tater tots were fried to the right crispness and were delicious. This place was awesome!

The couple next to me oohh and awwwed about the food too!
author: Genevieve K.

description: This is a diner with a twist that is deliciously satisfying to the palette and your tum tum! When I here "diner" I usually think of your typical American food, this one has a big hint of Korean influence. We ordered a classic beer batter onion rings, Bulgogi sandwich, Teriyaki Chicken, and Blackened Mahi tacos.
author: P M.

description:
A friend and I were attending a show at the Warfield Theater (Theresa Caputo, aka Long Island Medium) and were fairly early so we decided to walk down the street to see what there was as far as restaurants go, as we wanted to grab a bite to eat.  We stumble across Sam's Diner, looked at their menu outside and immediately thought this was the place to eat.

The restaurant is very popular, all tables were full and there is also "bar" seating that I didn't noticed until we were leaving.  It is small but the food is good and it comes out fast. Some might say it's a hole in the wall because as you walk past it doesn't catch your attention right away like some big fancy restaurant but people do line up inside and outside to get in.  And when we were there everyone who looked at the menu posted outside went inside and ate.  

The food is a mixture of American and Korean. They also have a specialty menu such as The Aladdin Menu which has recipes with names based on the show & characters such as Princess Jasmine's Honey Roasted Brussel Sprouts, A Whole New World of Warm Falafel Appetizers, etc.  And they gluten free, vegan and vegetarian choices. Something for everyone.

We started out with the Bulgogi Loaded Tots. This was tater tots, bulgogi, kimchi, spicy Korean sauce, Chipotle Ailoi and cilantro.  Talk about comfort food whats better then tater tots, kimchi & bulgogi?!!!  I had the Golden Beet Salad which was arugula, spinach, golden beets, feta cheese, jicama, pumpkin seeds and was drizzled with a citrus vinaigrette. Very tasty & refreshing! And my friend order The Giants which had cheddar & jack cheese, avocado, bacon mushroom, lettuce, tomato, pickles,chipotle aioli and she substituted the burger for a chicken breast.  This thing was oozing and dripping everywhere - it was fully loaded! And she said they did not skimp on the bacon, avocado or the 2 cheeses!!   The service was excellent!

It was fun to eat here as the decor fits the area as far as all the theaters, shows, etc. The walls are lined with various show posters, some are even signed. If you're going to catch some sort of show at the Orpheum, the Warfield, etc., I highly recommend arriving early and walking here to enjoy a good & flavorful relaxing meal. You won't be disappointed.
author: Patricia S.

description:
Stopped by this pretty aesthetically pleasing diner recently. Without looking at the pictures on yelp (just peeped the star ratings and decided to go with it because they had lots of reviews) It's interior is great for those foodie pictures. It's a small but relaxing space they even have a little bar area. I noticed a lady next to us had a mimosa (automatic win) 

I ordered the bulgogi beef tacos + a coke. When it came out my plate had 3 large tacos and a side of tortilla chips. The food was great, tasted just as expected. Lots of flavor involved in the bulgogi beef tacos. The service was good for being a full house at around 1pm. Our food came out fast. 

I will definitely come back here next time! The ambiance & food is amazing. I'll definitely be coming back here! Sams is also close to the Orpheum Theater. Just up the block. So if you're watching a show here, stop by sams you'll be impressed.
author: Jade D.

description:
Sam's diner, I feel, is a typical American diner experience.
I highly recommend Sam's for breakfast- the selection of sweet or savory choices is wide enough, from pancakes and French toast to eggs,and breakfast burritos.
I had all of these and would recommend them to anyone.
Service is pleasant and fast enough.
If you want a proper breakfast,look no further.

The place gets more crowded during weekend mornings,so you might have to wait 10-15 minutes for a table.
author: Honza K.

description:
We stopped in during a busy Wednesday night before seeing The Book of Mormon at the Orpheum. The area is hurting for more places to eat that doesn't require a nighttime romp through the Tenderloin, so plan ahead if you're hitting the area well before your show. Outside of a gyro place, a meth-infested Burger King, and a Starbucks across the street, Sam's was our only option. Fortunately, they delivered, but in the future I'd get a reservation and spare us the half-hour of loitering on Market Street. 

The theme is old-school American diner meets secret Korean menu, and we were able to order an enormous bacon-avocado-mushroom burger beast (Giants Burger, $16) alongside Bulgogi Tacos ($15). Both were great, but I'd come back for the burgers. They've got a short-but-sweet draft list, and a good variety of wines at super-reasonable prices (about $6/pint). This would be a great spot to linger for an hour or so, but we made good of cramming food in our faces in the 20 minutes before curtain call. Service is quick and friendly, and obviously deals with this all the time. 

It's a bit of a hole-in-the-wall, but the playbill posters and special "Book of Mormon" themed menu were nice touches. I'd imagine the bulk of their customers are theatergoers like us, and the whole scene evoked a happy nostalgia of grabbing corned beef hash in Times Square after a show. 

It's close to BART, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get here outside of going to the Orpheum. Next time I'm in the area for a show, though, I'll definitely be back!
author: Laura B.

description: The special Vietnamese beef stew (Miss Saigon  theme) was really good. BF liked his meatloaf. I thought it was meh. Service deserves 5 stars! Esp the hostess - awesome. Had to remove a star because of value. $18-$28 for rather small portions for comfort food but will be back next time we have Orpheum tix. Or maybe for loco moco which isn't a dinner option
author: Lena L.

description: I must tell you guys the MAHALO LOCO MOCO is the best! I'm from Oahu so I know when I find a good loco moco! So great right!? The only bad thing and why I only gave them 3 stars counting that the mahalo loco moco is why 3 stars, but customer service was first super bitchy bad, once I opened the door there she was that middle age Asian waitress, we both looked to each other and she asked me "how many"?, I'm here just me! I said, So she  got me a table and I asked for coffee, she took off without a word, 5 min later coffee arrives and she left again, so I had to look for the other waitress who was a very nice young lady so I ordered my loco moco! After I tasted it and started digging into the big plate then all those Bad vibes that middle age mad pist lady gave me disappeared and wow! Great dish! So next time I guess I will order to go as I don't want to tip a person like that at all.
author: Mario H.

description: Nope. Service acceptable. Patty melt tasteless. Sweet Potato fries were cold. Regular fries on my husband's plate were cold too. Overall disappointing.
author: Laura P.

description:
This is my first time  visit here.
We have 4 people in my family. Kids love this place very much for his first impression. Let's see when food comes.
author: Tony L.

description:
Excellent food, service and diner.
Something one wouldn't expect on this location.
Let's be honest: south of market isn't exactly a posh area with many homeless roaming the streets.   
It's unfortunately a known fact SF has huge homeless problems.

This restaurant manages to serve many clientele who are going to the nearby theatre as well as hotel guests from the Whitcomb hotel across the street.

SAM's Diner is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Convenient bar seating available for those who dine by themselves or are pressed for time.

Friendly service.   Food is always good.
Whenever I'm in town and stay across the street I'll have my breakfast here.


Good place
author: Joy S.

description: Great place for dinner before seeing Miss Saigon. We sat at the counter and had one of the "show" specials and a Chicken Cobb Salad. My salad was fresh and tasty, my friend's pork chops (I think) were also well seasoned and cooked just right. The only thing knocking down a star was she had requested just the meat and no sides (she's eating paleo) but the sides came anyway. Not a big deal, but just a sign the kitchen wasn't paying attention. Noise level was loud but not too loud. And it was pretty crowded since it was a Sat. night, but we only waited about 5 minutes since we didn't mind eating at the counter. Service was very good.
author: Debbie J.

description:
Saw this place randomly when I was looking for breakfast on Market St. Ordered a Whiskey Sausage Benedict, it was very tasty. Price is very reasonable, portion is big enough for me, and service is very much on point. 

I absolutely will come back again next time when I visit SF. This restaurant earns a 5 stars review!!
author: Keira R.

description: Such good food, came out fast. The eggs benedict came out in perfection. The mimosa wasn't skimped on in alcohol.  Waitresses were attentive. Such an amazing place.
author: Christi D.

description:
Real food!Not a huge selection,but breakfast ,dinner &supper were all spot on!
   While my politics are left coast,i love "Red State" food. None of that macrobiotic silliness for us!
      Georg-from the Red Zone of our great state.
author: Ximena S.

description: My wife and I had lunch here before going to the theater.  We were seat quickly.  Good breakfast menu.  We had the Eggs Benedict and French Toast.  Both were excellent!  Service was good and attentive.  Arrived before the crowd so we were able to get a table.  When we left, there were people waiting so we knew this was the place to go.    We will come back when we go to the theater again.
author: Steven M.

description: Oh my!!! Every thing we ordered was delicious! We ordered onion rings, chili tots, club sandwich and chocolate decadence dessert and ALL of it was 5 Stars. Service was incredible. Highly recommend!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Place was clean and staff very
Polite. Delicious French toast with strawberries. Pancakes were also delicious!our food was delivered fairly fast and was hot. Would definitely recommend.
author: Stacey C.

description: Always good food and service. Love the specials to tie into the show at the Orpheum. Very clever. Their fried chicken is my favorite
author: Rich B.

description: Oh my goodness! Who would have thought corned beef hash with salsa verde and peppers would good. It wasn't. Amazing is much more accurate! Wow, what an unexpected treat! Next time I'm at Hotel Whitcomb I'm eating every meal here, it was seriously that good!
author: Susan D.

description: First time eating here and it was a delightful experience! We had onion rings, chicken teriyaki, mahi-mahi tacos and Korean bulgogi sandwich. Everything was good! Service was great too!
author: Cresse M.

description: I have had most everything on this menu. My favorite is the coit tower breakfast burrito with the bulgogi burrito coming in second. They have great sweet potato fries and onion rings too. The teriyaki salmon with veggies is also good if im feeling healthier. We come with my work team often and they are always friendly and can accommodate all 8 of us. We have also gotten trays of eggs and bacon takeout for the office.
author: Courtney S.

description: Great food and super friendly staff.  They are able to get you in and out just in time for your show. The menu changes with what's playing at the Orpheum.  We had Vietnamese food when Miss Saigon was playing. Everything on the menu was fabulous. You can't go wrong w anything on the menu.
author: Betty S.

description:
Great spot! Had a Bloody Mary and California omelette and would highly recommend both. Definitely will be back next time I'm in the city. 

Sit at the bar and watch them make the food.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Conveniently located right down the street from Orpheum if you want to grab a bite to eat before catching your show. I was mesmerized by all the signed broadway posters on their walls, mentally checking off the ones I've seen. Don't mind the group of homeless people hanging around the side of the building and ignore that smell. 

It gets pretty busy but we didn't have to wait too long. I love the fact that they offer tater tots with their breakfast entrees. They have an extensive menu and even some "enlightened" ones for those looking to stay on the healthier side. My mom ordered the enlightened scramble which costs about $12-$15. It was not worth that much. It literally looked like a kid's plate. Not sure what their definition of "enlightened" meals, but I assumed it meant cooked healthier, not quantity lighter. On the contrary, I ordered the breakfast sandwich with avo and tater tots. BOMB! The tater tots were crispy and the sandwich wasn't dry, but on the oily side for sure. 

This is the type of place to go to for the convenience but not because it's something you have to try! It isn't bad.
author: Jenna T.

description: What a great place!  Most establishments if you stop in mid afternoon there's no way you're getting hot, fresh fries. But at Sam's they do things better. Great hot thin crispy fries. Plenty of refills on the iced tea. Solid, well prepared burger. Impeccable service.
author: Andy S.

description:
We come here all the time when we are loading in the shows at the Orpheum! Can't believe I have never reviewed!! Yikes. So here it goes. This is the Drivers choice for chow! Sometimes it's just us and sometimes 2 couples. It's always good here breakfast & lunch is our time. Today was the Mamas Korean Omelet with side of Kimchee. We wanted another side of Kimchee but we had the last... so sad. The omelets were fluffy and good melty provolone and the Korean flavored beef was fabulously sweet as it should be. Glad I saw this on the menu. It came with sides of potatoes and bread. Omg it's a lot of food. For the smaller appetites you must try It. Sharing would be in order unless you take some with to go. I have had the eggs bene and corned beef hash before and it's good too and plenty of food always!! So till next time. Oh our Serbian waitress we had last two times is very sweet and attentive! Just had to give a shout out to her service!!

    Came in late tonite 6 of us truckers from the Orpheum!  We all had great meals and we get a discount for working at the theatre.. awesome always. I had the Chicken Cobb salad wow... huge amounts of bacon, avo, chicken, egg, cucs , blue cheese crumbles with ranch sooooo good. Hubby had to finish it for me. He had bulgogi tacos I think. They are equally as great and awesome!!! Soup was had , French dip, salmon all good. Even late at 8ish. Didn't get pix cause we had to eat and get back.
author: Rene D.

description: Great breakfast! We stayed across the street at the Hotel Whitcomb and came here Sunday morning for breakfast with our kids. Coffee is awesome! Strong strong strong, just how I love it... where I have to put like 6 creamers in it! House Benedict was great too! Fresh fruit very good... not quite as sweet as our fruit on the Central Coast, but very good and mixed with different kinds. Sheena was super wonderful... if you get her, you will be in excellent hands!!
author: Ellie C.

description: I'm not sure why I didn't come to SAM's Diner sooner than I did. It was really good! I had the French toast with bananas. It was all around great! Very filling! Wish they had more coffee options, but their coffee was really good. Local coffee from Oakland, CA! It was also very busy, but we were seated pretty quickly and served quickly as well. Great food and great service!
author: Jessica F.

description: Love this Restaurant before a show at the Orpheum! Great service and a wide range of really good food and beverages!
author: Trisha O.

description: What they have going for them is the proximity to the Orpheum.  I went here for lunch before a matinee and I had the Chicken Cobb salad that was very so-so and included mushy, overripe avocado and cold, dry grilled chicken.  Since chicken was the star, this dish was a flop. We also had a side order of sweet potato fries that were not hot.  Meh.
author: Trisha T.

description: Easily the worst service I've ever received. Ever. We walked in around 7:30, toting a baby. We were taken to a booth and left. We weren't offered a high chair. We sat for several minutes and had to flag someone down for drinks. When the drinks (waters) came we asked for a high chair and one was brought, eventually. After sitting for quite some time, noting the empty booths behind us and across from us, we wondered where a server was. We asked a guy who was clearing a table and he motioned to a waiter who was just standing nearby. He had been standing around the whole time and hadn't been to our table at all and we had literally been in the restaurant 10-12mins at this point. We ordered burgers, both to come with fries, and an appetizer. The app and burgers came out together and one was missing fries. We inquired, the waiter said "I don't know why there aren't any fries" and so we asked if he could get some. We immediately packed the food up and left. The food wasn't exceptional. Just a regular burger. Highly displeased.
author: Kimber B.

description: I had the French toast brioche with sausage and country potatoes. The French toast was the perfect texture. They play good music too!
author: Mrs. K.

description:
Casual diner next to the Orpheum theater, serving up so many different fares that it gets sort of overwhelming, SAM's Diner is a good place to get food before or after a show, the library, or even before getting on BART!

My co-workers and I came here on a Wednesday lunch after a forum, and we were seated after about 10 minutes of waiting. It was fine though, because the posters from all the previous shows at the Orpheum were signed so it gave us time to talk about which shows we had or hadn't seen.

When it came time to order, at least three of us had a tough time choosing between one food option or the other- with the menu boasting things from breakfast classics like eggs benedicts, to brunch specials like stuffed french toast, to lunch fare like korean beef bulgogi tacos, to various sliders and sandwiches, and even honey fried chicken- how does one make up their mind?!

All jokes aside, I went for the lunch entree version of the country fried steak. The breakfast version comes with sausage gravy, your choice of potatoes, eggs your way, and choice of bread, while the lunch version comes with brown gravy, mashed potatoes, and sauteed veggies. Being a breakfast girl who loves her mashed potatoes, I went for the lunch version, but asked for sausage gravy on the steak. They were able to accommodate me (bless SAM's), and I can vouch for my co-workers when I say we left the place pretty happy.

I'm totally returning if I'm ever in the area again!
author: Mary F.

description:
Classy diner vibe...when you see the sign from outside doesn't match the vibe inside. Flat screen tv's. Black leather look booths.

The host on Sunday was pleasant and welcoming.  There was a wait. He took my phone number and called when table was ready. Time waited was under 20 minutes. Service at table was confusing; another gentleman came took our order, didn't see him for  about 15 min... no water, no coffee...hmm....then about 5 minutes later a woman comes with one cup of water for two people.  I guess part of water conservation.  Ask for another cup, that came a little later. Finally got the food. It was decent. Garden omelette with rye toast and home fries . The toast was delicious.  I love the toasted with real butter. I would go back and give service another chance because I saw other wait staff going an awesome job
author: Genie M.

description:
5/10/18 - In a big rush, we had about 45 minutes left to get a quick bite.  Unaware of what our offerings would be.  Don't go to the city very much anymore, going to see "The Color Purple" a revival of the original.  Parking is always bad and so is the traffic coming into the city.

We found this hidden gem, the lady at the front counter was very, very helpful.  She supplied us with menus while we waited for a table.  By the time they cleaned and seated us our food was ready.  I ordered the fish & Chips, and my cousin ordered the Mahi-Mahi salad .  My dinner was on point  the fish was piping hot and the cold slaw was fresh.  My cousin wasn't pleased with her salad  said that something was missing, and it was, but we couldn't figure it out.

Anyway, we were on time for our show.  This place is very small, but busy, busy.  They were very attentive.  I would patronize again if ever I am in the area.
author: Danielle J.

description: Great diner. Stayed across the street for business and it was both convenient and good. Had lunch one day and breakfast the next. Portions were great and staff was friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend this place
author: Todd S.

description: Grabbed a quick bite to eat on Saturday night here. Didn't have to wait long for a table to open up. The service was great - they were all very friendly. I loved how this place added a Korean twist. I had their bulgogi beef tacos. It was pretty average in taste (a slight let down), but the price was decent for the amount of food they give you. I'll probably try something else next time.
author: Tammie H.

description: Yummy & excellent service. I got the grilled chicken burrito and my son was able to build his own burger. Dolly was our waitress & she made him a special chocolate milk with ice cream.  The food around us looked great too. We had a great lunch!
author: Lynn F.

description: This spot was awesome! The food was great and our server was super friendly.  I had the dirty harry omelette and my girl had the country fried steak which was one of the best I've ever tried. They sat us down immediately and the food came promptly.  I'll definitely come back.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Great place for dinner if you're trying to catch a show at the Orpheum theatre. It gets pretty crowded so definitely come early to snag a table. They only seat you when the entire party arrives, but you can sit at the bar. 

I enjoyed my golden beet salad, and was surprised by how large the portion was. The beef chilli soup was pretty damn good as well. So was the hot chocolate (yes, I order like a kid) topped with whipped cream. Yum.

Recommended!
author: Christina N.

description:
This is a good spot I enjoyed my burger and my friends seemed to enjoy what they ordered also 
I would recommend this place
SAMS diner is a go to spot I truly enjoy the food here
author: Big A.

description: The food was hot and tasty with very large portions. Low amount of beer selection which was off and staff was a bit on and off but aside from that, it was good. I would definitely come back.
author: Courtney A.

description:
First off, the food I received was good. I got the Korean marinated beef tacos and was satisfied. 

But the real reason for my review is the way we were treated. It could've been an off day for SAM's, but I came here for a meeting during lunch and we were all unimpressed with the service we received. 

Small things kept adding up; they sat guests who arrived after us after being told we were next (and I had come early to put our name down), forgot a part of our order, ignored us mostly. This probably mattered to us more because one of us was a "brittle" diabetic, and the timing of these things for him was crucial. Overall, they didn't really hide they wanted us in and out as fast as possible (they gave us the bill even when we all were still in the middle of our meal)--which is probably why our table wasn't even wiped or clean when we were sat down.
author: Noelle C.

description:
Came here for breakfast because it was across the street from my hotel. I sat at the counter. I ordered the whiskey jalapeño sausage Eggs Benedict and coffee. Wonderful! The sausage is hand-made and mildly spicy (which is what I like). The eggs were perfectly poached and the grilled onions added a nice sweetness. The hollandaise sauce over all of it was the perfect touch and delicious.

The coffee was the way I like mine; hot and strong. The service was friendly and timely. The diner is in a small space (it's SF, what place isn't small!) and very clean. 

After the first breakfast, I came back two more times for breakfast. Sams American Eatery is now on my "must go here when in SF" list!
author: R T.

description: Great food! So good and filling. A good atmosphere and very kind workers! AMAZING!!! A perfect place to have dinner before a show in San Francisco.
author: Debbie M.

description:
This hole in the wall is a hidden gem, honestly. They combine American and Asian dishes nicely and they are a nice casual diner to head to. 

I tried their bulgogi kimchi tater tots and it was delicious. I wasn't going to even rate them until I tried this masterpiece. 

Their burgers and sandwiches are cooked well and their coleslaw and potato salad sides are right on par with good American restaurants. 

Long wait time before and after the food is served is an opportunity for them. 

Check this place out, they also have a bar with tap attached to the diner.
author: Soraya M.

description:
Went here for breakfast, gf had the vegetarian eggs Benedict and I had the eggs and bacon plate
Kindly get better wifi so I can check in and post reviews of your restaurant... Yelp doesn't work on Android data only... and staff should at least know the guest password...
Thought it a bit passe for SF, as if the theme wanted to resurrect Kerouac and Ginsberg with a modern flair... maybe.. but the weird customers tweaking while warriors highlights on ESPN tv above them was too Avant garde for my taste.
Loved our food but staff seemed like they'd rather still be in bed or maybe anywhere else.
Took a while for the food to arrive, too long for me...
And for goodness sake, SMILE once in a while...
Cook and waitress shouldn't argue where customers can hear... food sat while waitress playing on phone (not our food thankfully)...
But did I mention about the food... eggs Benedict were super... my hash browns and bacon cooked to perfection...nummy food earns the 3 stars... maybe I came at a bad time? Iffy whether I'll come again but I really want to give it a second chance
author: Andy B.

description:
Great food and conveniently located to the Orpheum.  They had some specials that lined up with southern cooking in the theme of the Color Purple when I went.  

Pretty busy and has counter service that allows for that diner experience.  (I chose to sit in a booth and appreciated the ambience).

Long wait and no reservations pre-show, so get there early.  Service was very responsive when asked, but a couple of things forgotten brought down the rating by 1 star.  

I will go back and amend the rating if I see improvement.

Go!
author: Paul M.

description:
We saw this place across the street from the hotel we were staying at (Hotel Whitcomb) on Market St. It looks like our was recently remodeled and is very clean on the inside.
The food is amazing! Probably the best pancakes I've had in ages! The food comes out super quick and the wait staff has a great attitude.
Prices see reasonable, and I honestly don't think I have one negative thing to say about the place. Some of our party had the Chilequiles, oatmeal, hash browns, it was all delish!  Check this place out!
author: Joe T.

description: SAM's Diner is the place to go omg the food was amazing clam chowder soup delicious,Burger juicy,the chicken crispy and juicy love love !!!
author: Sandra R.

description: If you are going to a show at the Orpheum Theater this is a great place for dinner.  I ordered the bacon Mac and cheese and my son ordered the fish and chips.  Soup or salad came with dinner.  I ordered the clam chowder and my son got the salad, which he liked mostly because of the house made ranch dressing.  When he tasted my chowder the boy that doesn't like clam chowder asked me if I wanted to trade.  The servers were friendly and in spite of being quite busy provided quick service.  My Mac and cheese was above average but not the best I've ever had.  The pasta was cooked well but on a whole the dish could have used some spice and a touch more creaminess.  My boys fish and chips however was outstanding.  The batter was crisp and flavorful while he described the fish as being like butter.  For desert we ordered the chocolate decadence.   It came with a berry compote, strawberries and vanilla ice cream, it was lushes.
author: Tracy M.

description:
I got the bacon plate for about $12.

It was really good. Bacon slices were thick and yummy. Hash-browns and eggs--similarly, no comments.

If you're looking for a place to grab breakfast, you can't go wrong with this diner.
author: Subrat M.

description: Nice atmosphere, service was good, price okay. Had the French toast it was very good wish I had another piece I'm just a big eater  though
author: Jason G.

description:
The perfect study spot. They have TVs behind the bar if you want to catch a game without dealing with all the hustle and bustle of a sports bar. I got the corned beef hash. It's not exactly traditional corned beef. More like...pulled beef.  It was still delicious.

To say the servings are "generous" is an understatement. They give you so much food. Some homeless man asked for my leftovers and I'm pretty sure he had a feast.
author: Lina W.

description: This diner was right across my hotel while visiting sf. I didn't really have high expectations since I don't really have good experiences when it comes to diners, but to my surprise the breakfast sandwhich was delicious! The eggs were super fluffy and the bread melted in your mouth. I definitely recommend getting the sf breakfast sandwhich. And I forgot to mention they serve fresh orange juice which made the breakfast complete
author: Rose S.

description: I'm so pissed at the guy ( Paul Saccomanno)who took my order I called in at 9:50 and was told that it would take 10 min so when I get there I had to wait an additional 10 min because he was talking to a friend I guess and forgot all about me til a couple worker had to tell him. Then I get to work and my order was wrong I asked for country potatoes
author: Latisa T.

description:
We visited here early Sunday morning before the Pride celebration started and got a seat immediately! Lucky us I guess and I can only imagine that it was to be hugely packed as the day went on. Our waiter immediately asked us what we wanted to drink and then promptly delivered our drinks. Ordered food off the menu and we both had the biscuits and gravy plate. Very delicious and was quick to get that food out to us. 

The only drawback is that you can't get lunch in the morning like some other places we've been to but not going to take any stars away from this, just needed a place to eat dinner before heading out to pride. Would go here again, and would love to try the lunch when we're in the area going shopping or whatever.
author: Jason C.

description: Whenever the squad and I are getting ready to get our rave shenanigans on at Bill Graham Auditorium, we typically get a room at the Holiday Inn. With that being said the best food option for us is SAM's Diner. They have a huge selection of different diner staples. Their menu is quite extensive and have everything from breakfast to burgers and even some Korean inspired dishes. I typically go for something basic like their chicken tenders with fries, but when I'm feeling really brave, I go with the tater tots. Service is typically quick and it is super easy to order from the hotel and just walk over to pick it up. Overall, if you're in the area and aren't feeling the fast food options then definitely make a stop into this diner.
author: Cristal C.

description: Small restaurant a lot nicer on the inside then the outside seems. Good menu choice. Tator tots offered for breakfast which is simply amazing. A lot of staff but they were not real quick on water refills etc. Would return if we were in the area.
author: Tiffany S.

description: A great hometown feel with quick bites before a show at the Civic center. Burgers won't disappoint!
author: Kelly H.

description: Visiting from Southern California stopped here for breakfast. Best choice ever! Didn't even check reviews before coming. Excellent food with reasonable prices.
author: Elena S.

description:
We walked into this restaurant for a quick bite before CRUSH SF down the street, so we didn't have many expectations. However, we left pleasantly surprised with basically every aspect of our experience. 

We ordered a custom burger, medium rare and a side of onion rings. The burger was really good, albeit more on the medium well side than medium rare. The onion rings were AMAZING, perfectly crispy and had an incredible unique taste to them. 

The real deciding factor for this establishment being a good 4-stars is the staff. It seemed like this place, although marketed on the outside as an American restaurant, it was run by, I presume, Korean folx and the menu definitely exemplified that with the All-American style fused with Korean elements (i.e. Bulgogi Tater Tots, Korean Tacos, etc.). They were incredibly accommodating to us throughout the meal, making small talk with us, getting us whatever we asked for promptly. They definitely made the night very enjoyable.

All in all, this is a place everyone should check out whenever y'all are in SF. With the unique Asian-American inspired menu, quality food to back it up, and likable staff, you will have just as good of a time as I did.
author: Dylan B.

description:
This place isn't really a diner, but rather is more of an eclectic dining experience.  I am surprised the ratings are somewhat low because the food here, for a place that caters to a busy revolving theater crowd was really great.  My burger was outstanding, cooked perfectly and juicy with a delicious aioli and wonderful ripe avocado, and a soft warm brioche bun, SO yummy.  The fries were also delicious, fresh potatoes, perfectly crisped.  My dinner companions were also quite happy with their food.  The wine list is short but with good local choices.  The service was prompt but felt unrushed even with a crowd waiting for tables.  Price was very reasonable for the quality and amount of food.  
In a neighborhood that is low on good dining options, this is a very good choice.  I will be back for another one of those burgers .
author: Kay N.

description: We ate here before seeing our show at the Orpheum (School of Rock). We arrived two hours before the show (which you don't need to do because it's right across the corner from the Orpheum Theater) and got a seat right away. However, the line did start to grow the closer it got to 7PM, so take heed. But this is a perfect pre-show spot to grab dinner - convenient, friendly, with good food and a decently varied menu (drinks too).
author: Chris S.

description: Came here for breakfast with family. This restaurant did not disappoint. The food was delicious, good size portions. Everyone was happy!
author: Cynthia A.

description:
I ordered the Giants burger and it wholly exceeded my expectations (5/5). It was a lot bigger, juicer, and more amazing than the my picture suggests -- poor angle on my part but my hands were too messy to retake once I got into it! 

It comes with two types of cheese, avo, mushrooms, bacon, lettuce / tomato, and a chipotle aioli; plus the bun was A+. I also asked for it cooked medium and it came out as such :) The fries were fresh and thin cut, probably a 4/5. The onion rings were also decent, probably a 3.5/5. I agree with other Yelp reviews that this place is on the pricy side ($17 for the burger, $7 for a plate of onion rings), but it makes sense considering it's right by the BART station and the Orpheum theater. 

The place is clean and waiting staff was also really friendly, always a plus. Drop by if you want to meet a friend near the BART station! It's literally right outside the exit.
author: Selena S.

description: This is a great local diner just near 8th and Market Streets. The menu has great choices, there's a nice selection of specials, good cold beer, friendly staff. Prices are reasonable. It's s great spot for dinner if you're going to the nearby theatre to catch a show or if you're staying at a nearby hotel and want to venture away from the hotel restaurants. Highly recommended. I'll be back for sure.
author: Kerrod T.

description: Great dinner after a trip to the orphiem theatre. Pasta dishes, fried chicken we're all great. Hood local beer on tap, friendly service and dealt with our group of 10 easily...
author: Patrick D.

description:
Wow, so happy with our pre-theatre dinner. We arrived at Sam's at 7.25, and made it for our show at 8 (Orpheum). The service and atmosphere were calm and relaxing, the perfect antidote for late babysitter/heavy traffic stress. 

I had the mahi mahi from the Book of Mormon menu. The fish was perfectly cooked with a sumptuous beurre blanc. Hubby had the crab melt which he enjoyed. 

Thanks SAM's!!!  You saved us from a depressing fast food meal on our big night out.
author: Allison D.

description:
Food is good and reasonably priced. Across Market Street from ACT's Strand Theater

We let our very capable server know of our curtain time and she had our food for us in more than enough time to make it very comfortable for us to be seated when the play began.
author: Jim Bryant B.

description: This bar was across the street from our hotel so we decided to go have breakfast there. I was a Sunday morning and Mexico was playing against Germany in the World Cup. They had the game on and I had a great time. I enjoyed my coffee with the delicious breakfast they served there. I had the chilaquiles. Big portions, nice and clean setting, and very great service.
author: Marlene E.

description: Great classic breakfast fare. House made whiskey sausage was tasty. Reasonable prices.  Good atmosphere
author: Matt C.

description: Came here on SF Pride Sunday during the parade. My group and I were were starving looking for a place that served breakfast. We happened to see SAM's diner from across the street so we trekked our way over. 20 minute wait. We got a table in less than 20 minutes and the food was DELICIOUS. Service was great and quick. It hit the spot and gave the energy we needed for the rest of the day
author: Blair B.

description: A classic diner spot right next to the Orpheum! It gets a bit crowded before a show, but their service was still pretty quick and the food was great!! The Giants burger had all the toppings I love on a burger (bacon, 2 kinds of cheese, avocado, mushrooms, and a chipotle aioli) and was grilled perfectly to medium rare as requested. The fries were also tasty and the burger and fries portions were quite big. The prices were reasonable considering the location and the quality and amount of food. I definitely plan to come back and try more of the menu!!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Good food. Large portions. Fast service even with the place being full on a Thursday. 

We came with a party of 9 and all of the food came out with a very short wait. Everyone enjoyed their meal. We had pie and chocolate cake for dessert, also tasty.
author: Laura K.

description:
This was the first time eating at Sam's since they remodeled the interior. The place looks more current now but still retains the overall feel of a diner. Don't be misled by the grungy Market Street exterior. The interior is welcoming and comfortable. 

We had a great meal. The food was fresh, well-prepared, and the portions were generous. The asiago cheese that comes with the Caesar was excellent. I had the salmon terriyaki, and my wife had an artichoke salad and we will order them again when we return.

Decent beer selection. We split the chocolate decadence for dessert and it was a nice end to the experience.

The service was outstanding. Our server went out of her way, as did the chef, to accomodate my wife's request for some creative additions to her salad. Everyone on the staff that we encountered was pleasant and enthusiastic.

Lastly, this place offers very good value. Well done food, generous portions, first class service and a reasonable price. 

If there was a category just for Diners I'd easily give it five stars.
author: Joe G.

description: Great breakfast. Got one of their healthy choices, scrambled eggs with spinach mushrooms and provolone cheese. It was reported to be served with a fruit cup and I expected canned. It was all fresh! Strawberries, honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapple, blackberries, grapes - yum. Excellent organic coffee also. Place was clean and updated. Inside was decorated in a movie theme.
author: Brian P.

description: My group endednup here after the restuarant we were at was unable to serve us food for ocer an hour. So glad that happened because YES to those vegetarian korean tacos. The service was very nice and hot our food pretty fast for delivery. I will definately nakenit a point yo come for a sit down visit.
author: Brandi W.

description: Amazing food, we came with 3 kids and they loved it. The Korean tacos are to die for I want to bring this back to Ventura with me. Yum
author: Angie B.

description:
A great pre-show place. It gets BUSY, so arrive early. Consistently excellent "diner food." Great club sandwiches and bacon cheeseburgers, but the standout we discovered tonight, is the Korean Bulgogi Beef Sandwich. A seriously excellent sandwich. (The Bulgogi Beef Tacos also sound good)

I've learned that if we arrive by 6:50 PM on a Thursday, we're seated by 7:00 and will be out the door by 7:30 or so.
author: Mark K.

description: Sam's diner is a nice new diner,very clean and the food is really good and totally worth the price.
author: Milena M.

description:
This place deserves 5 stars! I came across Sam's Diner when looking for places to eat around Orpheum Theater and would have to say I was not disappointed with this find. 

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by who I assume was the manager. She checked on our table, and others several times throughout our meal. 

Our waitress was very attentive and provided great service. 

One extra plus I would have to comment on was that the Chef himself came out to hand customers their meal, check in, and or ask their opinion. You don't see that often and that topped the experience here. He even asked our opinions on what dessert we liked better (the honey pistachio cheesecake & chocolate decadence). 

All of our appetizers, entrees and desserts were delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone before a show and to get there before 6!
author: Taylor L.

description: The food was good!!! It didn't take long after ordering to receive our food.... the hostess was extremely nice and accommodating!!
author: La Tanya W.

description:
The staff was very friendly and my lunch, the Golden Beat Salad, was out of this world!

Roasted Golden Beets With Arugula, Spinach, Feta Cheese, Jicama, & Pepitas
Drizzled With Citrus Vinaigrette - I highly recommend this salad. 

$5 wine seemed like a bargain, too.
author: Scott N.

description: Great spot near the Orpheum theater! Small but, quick service, large portions, specials themed to match the current running show. Daughter had the bacon mac and cheese, loved it. I had the crab melt, delish! Each came with soup or salad too. We couldn't eat it all! We packaged our leftovers with utensils and gave them to a worthy homeless person.
author: Teresa B.

description: Excellent, creative menu, warm, friendly, fast service and a great place to eat before going to the theater. Extra points for their Hamilton themed dishes! It is obviously a very popular place - they were totally packed and had folks lined up outside the door, but they squeezed in our party of two and got us to the theater in time.
author: Mary C.

description: Great location, delicious food, friendly staff!! 5 stars forsure!!
author: Dina H.

description:
If you need time to kill and have a great meal Sam's is the best place. Being a fan of musical arts my family decided to spontaneously visit the Orpheum theatre. We ended up scoring tickets to Wicked for $40. Which was great but we had so much time to kill.

We diverted from the appalling Burger King on Market St and walked further more. We stumbled onto Sam's and it was bustling with patrons. The menu is clearly posted in the front window. It is a tiny diner with so much to offer.


We decided to stick to diner type food like the patty melt and a few burgers. It was delicious and really hit the spot! After dealing with SF traffic you get so hungry! This is a great place and service is so-so but hey it's pretty delicious.
author: Charlie L.

description: Looks sketchy from the outside, but nice inside. The breakfast food was awesome. 10/10
author: Deirdre M.

description:
We wanted to find a place to have dinner near the SF Orpheum Theatre.  My friend found this place on Yelp and the reviews were good.  We made reservations for 6PM & got there on time, we waited for a couple of mins before they sat us. The place was small, but it was not full when they sat us, but within 15mins there was a lot of people waiting for tables.  They have booths, tables & seats at the counter.  Looks like the place was remodeled compared to the pictures we saw on yelp.

The menu had a nice selection and they had a special menu for the Aladdin play.  I was surprise to see Korean Bulgogi on the regular menu. We ordered the Bulgogi Loaded Tater Tot appetizer, we all ordered different versions of the street tacos (spicy pork, blacken fish & Bulgogi).  For dessert we had a Adffogato, Chocolate Decadence cake & the dessert special a Honey Pistachio Cheesecake.  I cannot say the food was amazing, but it was good & I would go there again.  I heard their hamburgers are really good.  

So if you were looking for a place to eat before seeing a play at the Orpheum try this place it is a 30 sec walk from the theatre.  But get there early.
author: Alett B.

description:
I had a co-worker tell me that the salads were good here.  I went here with my boyfriend during "brunch time" on a Sunday with the mindset of getting a salad.  I tried so hard to get a salad, but there were too many things on the menu I wanted to try.  I pretty much wanted to try all the brunch items.  So at one point, I figure, why am I going to be out and about during brunch just to get a salad?  I got a loco moco instead, which if you don't know is basically the complete opposite of a salad, there's not a single green on it.  But I don't regret it because it was so good!  My boyfriend got the Giants Burger, he seemed to really enjoy it because I couldn't sneak in a bite.  

On top of the food, we really enjoyed the decor, which features posters from the shows that have played nearby at the Orpheum, it was a fun kind of diner vibe.  It took a little long to get the check though.  Further, for me, Sam's is more on the pricey side, and I can't tell if the portions are big to match the price or if the plate is big to trick you into matching the price.  

Overall, it was a fun dining experience though.  One day, I will come back for the salad.  Or another brunch option.
author: Cristina C.

description: We stopped here before a theater performance at the Orpheum because it was convenient. It was crowded, so we chose to sit at the counter. I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich and my husband ordered the "Giants" hamburger. We both ordered the sweet potato fries. Both items were delicious, and we both said that we would order them again. The fries were very thin cut but delicious all the same. I would recommend this diner for a quick meal anytime!
author: Ana C.

description: This is a diner that knows how to be a diner!  Probably just like everyone else in there, we were eating a quick bite for a show next door.  They definitely deliver on speed and the breakfast burrito was full of goodness and quite filling.  Would definitely stop by next time that we have a show to see!
author: Rob R.

description: Good food and great service by Sheena.Nice spot in the City to Relax and get some good food
author: William G.

description: My daughter and I were looking for a place to eat before the theater and stopped in at SAM's. We've eaten there before, and found the food good and the service quick. There was a wait that I figured was too long, and didn't want to miss our show, so we just went across the street and got coffee. At some point, I realized that my wallet was missing, and I couldn't find it anywhere. I thought someone had stolen it out of my purse. I figured I would never see it again, so of course I cancelled my cards, etc. Imagine my shock when I got my wallet back in the mail today!! Everything still there, including my cash. Just a note was added from SAM's management apologizing for taking "so long to mail it back to me."  I'm just thrilled that the employees were so honest. I had checked with them right after I lost my wallet, but apparently whoever found it wasn't there when I came in.  I'm so happy to get all my stuff back, and really had my faith in humanity restored. Thank you guys for returning my wallet, and know that you've got a customer for life!!
author: Sybil M.

description:
What a gem Sam's is. A half a block up from the Orpheum, it is now our go-to pre-show dinner locale. We'd heard about Sam's for a while but was always late in making a reservation on a show night. Taking a chance this last time, I arrived very early, before the rush. The gentleman who greeted me and said "no problem" to my request for a table for four at 6pm turned out to be the chef himself, Neil Marquis. His pleasant and welcoming demeanor was matched throughout the restaurant. Our server, Nick, could not have been more helpful, accommodating, or fun. He engaged with us and provided excellent advice and service. And upon learning one of us was celebrating a very special birthday, he brought out an amazingly delicious bread pudding a la mode, along with a candle, a smile, and a song.

And, oh yeah, the food was excellently prepared and very tasty too ;-). My wife had the Korean beef tacos that were yummy. My pork chop was perfection!

So if you haven't tried Sam's before - go! Just don't take our table on a show night ;-).
author: Jonathan P.

description: Best place to eat before a Show at the Orpheum or The Ballet at the War Memorial Opera House.  Lunch or Brunch is always excellent.
author: Karen M.

description: I've been to Sam's multiple times, usually before attending a show at the Orpheum Theater. I should've reviewed them before now, but better late than never! Their food is great... lots of "comfort" offerings. Their honey fried chicken is mouthwatering, as is their fish and chips. For lighter fare, I usually order the blackened fish tacos, substituting coleslaw for the home cooked tortilla chips.  Prices are moderate; the portions are huge. Wait staff is great and they get you out with plenty of time to get to the show!
author: Annie W.

description:
Got an early dinner here with my brother after classes at UCSF because I didn't want to be hangry on the hour BART ride back to the East Bay.

Food was pretty good, I got the bacon macaroni and cheese and my brother got the bulgogi sandwich. I also got a house salad with my meal. The house salad wasn't really memorable but it also wasn't the worst restaurant salad that I've had. I really enjoyed the bacon macaroni and cheese because there was also added cheese on top (not good for my lactose intolerance but amazing for my taste buds). I also ended up adding the hot sauce they had on the table to cut down a little on the richness of the macaroni and cheese (a personal preference to try and trick my body into thinking it's getting less cheese than I'm actually shoveling in). My brother's sandwich was also really good and would be something that I would try on my next visit (that or the bulgogi burrito). We also got the decadent chocolate cake (mainly because I saw a table across from us get it and I immediately knew I also needed it). The cake was amazing and slightly fudge-y with whip cream, vanilla ice cream, and raspberry sauce on the plate as well

The seating is also not huge, which can become more noticeable if there is a show going on in the nearby theater because you can make dinner reservations. However, they do also have bar seating if you're not super inclined to be sitting directly across from whomever you're with. Also, when they're slammed it does take a little bit longer to catch a waiter's attention. However, they also ensure you get your food in a timely manner so it wasn't a huge annoyance.
author: Muneet S.

description:
Between the ridiculously slow service (over 35 minutes to get my cup of coffee while waiting for a BLT) and the rudeness of some of the staff, I'm through with Sam's.

It's a shame because I work nearby and there are some weeks where I'd go to Sam's 6 days out of a week. Today, however, I wasted 45 minutes of my 60 minute break for food which STILL HADN'T ARRIVED. I ordered a BLT. Bacon and toast. Seriously, 45 minutes?!?!?

Now I get to finish my 10 hour work day hungry because Sam's could efficiently fulfill it's only role; to feed people.

I walked out and won't be coming back.
author: John A.

description:
I ordered the Chicken Tenders they were Tasty! The menu offers a variety of Brunch and Breakfast selections. Breakfast is offered until 15:00. Plenty of beverage selections including Beer on Tap (that's a plus) 
I had water with my entrée, can't say much more than that.
author: Wong W.

description:
The food was good, but the service was meh. We were on a lunch break and our server just kept walking around idly while we waited to order. It was frustrating. The food was good though. I like their sweet potato fries.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BY7fPfHjrp0/
author: Veggie E.

description: I am going to give Sam's Diner 4 stars. My wife and I have been there twice now before going to the Orpheum Theater. The interior has been updated to a modern vibe. The menu is extensive and everyone should find something to their liking. On our first visit I had their fish & chips. They were some of the best I have had. My wife had the beet salad and was pleased with her choice. Today I had the spicy pork burrito. The flavor was good. My only issue was that there was too much rice in the burrito. I think it would taste a bit better and be more healthy if there was less rice and maybe some coleslaw inside for some crunch and flavor. Or maybe have it come with a small green salad. My wife had The Cobb salad. This was a bit disappointing. The salads was more of a glorified green salad. It did come with hard boiled egg, avocado and bits of bacon. It was missing the traditional ham & turkey for the extra protein. This is still a great place to go and I recommend that you give it a try. I think there is just some menu options that need some improvement.
author: Jim P.

description:
TLDR: great place for food near theaters. Accepts reservations and food comes out quick! Reasonable prices. 

This place is the perfect location to grab a bite to eat before heading to the Orpheum or Golden Gate theaters. We were a group of 6 attending brunch here before the Saturday 2pm showing of Hamilton. Since it's become insanely harder to find a place that does brunch reservations on a Saturday we were pleasantly surprised to see this place did and had something available 4 days before the show. Originally for 11:45 we had to call an hour before and change to 12:30pm and they were accommodating without hesitation. We all got right in at 12:30. This place is smaller, holding maybe 30 guest but it was very cute inside. The prices were great and the food quality was very good. Can't go wrong with the breakfast tacos or Benedict. Letting them know you are going to the show helps and they get you your food super quick. This is our new go to!
author: Brandi W.

description: I went there last night with a couple of people and the food and service were great! So much flavor and the staff were so sweet. I would definitively recommend.
author: Ashley V.

description: Came here pretty hammered after Pride last Saturday. Can happily say their club sandwich resuscitated both my girlfriend and I. Service was very kind as well, I highly recommend.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Great little spot on Market. If you're craving a classic American diner, this is a great place. I love their burgers, and they even have malt vinegar for your fries.

Customer service is also great.
author: Do P.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the civic center area. The service is quick, decent size portions, and the prices are reasonable (for SF).
author: Ian M.

description: Soooo goood! Great service! Definitely going to have to come back to try more items on the menu!
author: Suzie M.

description:
Can you get more precarious than walking around Market and 8th Street (Civic Center area) late at night?  Surprisingly I have the will and desire to do. And this one place I have wanted to check out for a while. 

When I walked in, I was surrounded with a bunch of sports memorabilia's and many cool neon lights from beer companies with the local Bay area teams. 

From the menu, I ordered the popular Giants Burger. For $16.50, I get thick Angus beef patty with two kinds of melted cheese (cheddar and pepper jack), avocado, bacon, grilled mushrooms and a spicy sauce in a bun. A side of fries is also included with this unique burger. I asked my beef to be medium-well. But the patty turned out very arid. And for that price, I would probably get a better burger elsewhere and slightly cheaper. 

With my meal, the bar/restaurant has eight different kinds of beers on tap. I chose the Anchor Steam's California Lager. For $5.00, I get the San Francisco brew in a frozen pint glass, which I indeed liked. 

I thought my meal and visit was mediocre. But more importantly, I did survived and left that Civic Center area unscathed.
author: Matt G.

description:
Very disappointed today. The food and service here is usually pretty decent. Today, we arrived to join a small crowd waiting to get in. I asked if the two of us would be able to get in, order and eat before our 2pm show. The young woman smiled and said no problem, 15 minutes. This was at 12:20. 

At 1:05, I went in to remove ourselves from the wait list. I told her it was a very long 15 minutes. She apologized and told me that we were next.

I eat out often enough to understand that a business cannot always guesstimate how long a guest will sit. At the same time, they have a responsibility to learn how to gauge realistically.

The food here is good enough that we'll return in the future but never again with less than two hours before show time.
author: Dexter D.

description: I love this place so much, talk about a hole in the wall. When you have a play to get to you get your food so quick and you're never late! They're so friendly and kind. Love them lots
author: Katarina B.

description:
Love this place! Made a reservation for 10 people for 6:15 to make it in time for an 8pm show. They were super accommodating and helpful when we needed to add someone at the last minute, and we were able to get out of there with lots of time to spare for the show!

Food is also v good. My friends got sandwiches and chili that all looked great. Tacos were pretty good, too.
author: Sarah L.

description: Excellent breakfast place.  I work in the area and this is my regular go to place for breakfast.  I've been to several other break spots but this is the best.  Service is good, food is good, atmosphere is good.
author: Joe R.

description:
This is a convenient place to go before a show at the Orpheum. If you have tix for the Orpheum you get 10% off the price for food. There was a short wait.  A lot of folks were headed to the play. 

Their wine is horrible. Nothing but the house wine.  But they have a nice selection of beers that I'll try instead next time. 

We had the garlic fries which were crisp thin and super garlicky. Also had the deviled eggs that had absolutely no flavor even the some overly crisp pork belly. 

We split the fried chicken order which came with mashed potatoes and gravy and a  house salad. The four pieces of chicken were small. The skin had a sweet crisp batter but needed seasoning. 

The burgers looked great. Probably try that the next time. 

Service was good and staff friendly.
author: Frank T.

description:
What a great place to eat, every thing done to perfection and great service. The French toast and the pancakes and the Benedict(I had the salmon)
Was great.
author: Don E.

description: 3 large pieces of Honey Fried Chicken came with mash potatoes with gravy and a side of coleslaw.  100 times better than KFC, the chicken was not dried out nor over cooked.  Honey-seasoned batter was pleasantly crispy with a hint of sweetness and the slaw was crunchy and refreshing.  Korean bolgogi beef and kimchi loaded tater tots was also surprisingly satisfying as a meal on this cool night out before heading off to the Orpheum theater on Market Street.  $16 chicken, $13 tater tots, with tax and tip, $37 dinner total...it made the night out affordable and enjoyable.  Counter service was friendly and attentive as folks watch the Warriors win on the big screen behind the open bar/kitchen/prep area.  I guess i found my go-to place for a pre-theater sit down meal.
author: Kid N.

description:
I stopped by Sam's Diner before going to a musical at the Orpheum Theatre. Dining solo meant that instead of waiting for a table, I ate at the bar. Firstly, it gets points for the seats at the bar being more comfortable than the usual bar stools.

I ordered The Giants burger, but changed out the patty for a veggie burger and skipped the bacon. It was really tasty! The Giants burger has a lot going on (cheddar and pepper jack cheese, avocado, mushroom, lettuce, pickle, tomato and chipotle aioli) but it definitely worked together. 

Since I had just gotten off a long international flight and was quite peckish, I decided to try some dessert. I got the Apple Pie á la mode and really hit the spot.

Don't think I would have been in this neighbourhood if I wasn't going to the theatre but I'm glad I got to try out Sam's Diner.
author: Cathy H.

description:
This is one of the best dining experiences anyone could ask for!  Sam's just keeps getting better.   
I had the Wicked Burger of the West and I was NOT disappointed!  Brought a colleague along for the experience and he was amazed!  
I tell everyone I know to eat at Sam's when in San Francisco!
author: Jacque D.

description: This is the greatest spot for pre-Orpheus Theater matinee lunches. And the Korean tacos are terrific too. And, if you like eggs Benedict mid-day, then this should be on your list.
author: Gerald S.

description: $13 for a Cobb salad with no chicken and an unsliced avocado. Not being a snob, but a $13 cobb salad should have chicken on it and/or the avocado spread out.
author: Da X.

description: I don't know why it's called a diner because it's not. The food looks amazing when you see it but it doesn't taste like anything.
author: Anna O.

description: First time ever here. Really nice little diner. Really good breakfast, would TOTALLY recommend their French toast.
author: Celina B.

description: Right across the street from the hotel. Figured what the heck glad I did because it's really good. The bacon Mac and cheese was great! The coffee was great too and a lot cheaper then Starbucks!!! That was in the hotel!! Convenient because they didn't have any coffee in the room!!! Anyway the breakfast there at Sam's diner really good to the brioche French toast looks wonderful I had to over easy sausage biscuits and gravy it was really good too . anyway stop in at some coffee it's a good stop.
author: Harry P.

description: Surprisingly good. We've lived across the street for over two years now and have always walked by sams thinking it's dirty like the streets it occupies outside. However we were pleasantly surprised! Everything was clean and the food was actually delicious. We got the Benedict, French toast, and chocolate chip pancakes. The prices are a little steep at 14-16 a plate but I gusss it's to accommodate all the tourists across the street. Overall we'd be back if we were craving something breakfast specific since they have a pretty good selection!
author: Vanessa K.

description: We had lunch. Daughter has celiac and brought food. They offered a empty plate for her. Mimosas were awesome. Cool atmosphere. Food great.
author: John L.

description:
This is a very unassuming place that has better food than you night expect looking at it.  It is located in mid-market so the street is a bit scary, I would not recommend going out of my way to eat there.  It is very close to the Orpheum and the show posters in the place are a fun touch if you are a musical theater fan.  The Korean tacos are always a good choice.  For the musical "Hamilton" they did a cosmetic remodel so the interior is a bit nicer.

The problem with Sam's is the very spotty service.  The owners need to be on their staff much more as sometimes service is very slow and indifferent.  Some wait-staff make you feel as if you are lucky to have a seat at their restaurant.
author: Thomas G.

description: We stopped here after the Asian Museum before heading to airport.  Delicious and reasonable.  Korean fish tacos were spicy and good.  Eggs gravy biscuits and hash browns were very good.  We sat at the counter and enjoyed watching the cooks.   Great place.
author: Jane M.

description:
This place is anything but a typical diner. It's 2 mins from the Orpheum and we were there just a bit after the matinee of Hamilton on a Saturday and this place was packed. It is a very small place, but the 6ish employees (not including kitchen, 3 waiters, front desk, and two that I would guess were owner & manager I'd think) still managed to keep orderly track of who's who next, everyone bussing tables, serving food, etc. which brings me to the food. We were seated in 15 minutes, and they APOLOGIZED for the wait! Right after any show, especially a Saturday late lunch/early dinner time and 2 minutes away- I'd have expected a far longer wait. We wait far longer in nowhere-ville for far less. They were immediately taking our drink and appetizer order. 

Which brings me to the food. The FOOD! The menu had every good thing you can think of from fried chicken to scallop Risotto. I had a crab melt and it was great. The portions are generous and the service is so friendly and fast it is unbelievable. My daughter asks me on a regular basis to go back there to eat and I tell her next time we go to a show we definitely will. She doesn't want to wait!
author: R S.

description:
Funny how many times I've come here late in the evening after work despite my initial reaction that it was a "rather dreary little place". The neighboring Burger King still attracts quite a campsite of homeless people, some agitated enough to make it something of a minefield to get to the front entrance of SAM's (all CAPS please). Nearly nine years ago, when I first tried this spot, it was a more Korean-oriented cafe with sullen servers and mediocre diner fare that obviously didn't leave a great impression on me. However, for some reason, I started coming back a couple of years ago to find the place under management. The brown naugahyde booths are still there as well as the unused counter, but the menu got bigger.

The Korean tacos are accounted for, but the rest is much like Denny's redux. The other major improvement has been the attentive service. It appears to be making a big difference in business since the booths are often fully occupied with a microcosm of Market Street life from cops to hipsters with nose rings to armies of tourists representing most of Western Europe nation by nation. I don't look at the menu much since I've ordered the same thing over and over again, the $12 Classic Joe's Special with an additional dollar spent on sauteed mushrooms. It comes with sourdough toast and country potatoes, although I always ask for the hash browns as a substitute. They always oblige (photo: http://bit.ly/1A4u9ms).

Truth be told, it doesn't compare with the Joe's Special served at the Soma Inn Cafe much less at Original Joe's, but it hits the spot anyway with the mix of ground chuck, spinach, onion and scrambled eggs. I squirt a lot of hot sauce on it and even use those little plastic containers of jelly on my toast. But last time, I did order the $12 SAM's Cobb Salad, which was pretty decent with avocado, bacon bits, cucumber, tomato, a hard-boiled egg, blue cheese crumbles and ham with ranch dressing on the side (photo: http://bit.ly/1znHe3D). It was hamstrung by a poor $4 cup of their soup du jour, French Onion that was missing the cheese and used salad croutons instead of a baguette slice (photo: http://bit.ly/1DVIvD1). All in all, it deserves another star just for the service upgrade.

FOOD - 3 stars...still nothing special but better than my first visit
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...they put my wattage in their lighting but otherwise the same diner
SERVICE - 4 stars...here's where they got better, much better
TOTAL - 3 stars...sometimes Joe's Special is all you need at 9PM
author: Ed U.

description: I liked that it was close to the theater. We grabbed a quick bite, but it was not worth the price. The staff was nice and very attentive.
author: Krystina H.

description:
We stopped in here for GREAT service before seeing a show at the Orpheum. Happy hour prices are fantastic, our food was quick and delightful, and we were frequently checked up on by any and every staffer walking by.  They knew we were entering the lottery for tickets to see Wicked, and celebrated with us when we won them!  Shannon was our server and she's just wonderful - warm, friendly, bubbly.  Can't wait to come back again.

Can't comment too much on food because it was a quick stop before the show.  Mozzerella sticks for appetizer, then we shared a tuna melt with french fries.  All were fabulous and came out quickly.
author: Jessika S.

description:
My friends and I needed a place to eat before our show at The Orpheum and this place is less than 5 minutes walking.  By the time we got there we were in a hurry and the staff was very helpful.
