We told them what time our show was and they let us place our orders while we were still standing waiting for a table to be cleared.  They were packed and we waited in line at least 20 minutes.  This was kind of a hassle because the place is small and having people lined up at the door pretty much blocks the walkway.  You could tell though that the staff is used to it and they were definitely getting food out quickly and cleaning tables fast so the next customer could get in.

I had the turkey club with fries - the portion size was so big I didn't have time to finish, but they had handy takeout boxes and the theatre sometimes let's you bring in food.  (I say sometimes because the restaurant staff said it would be fine to take our boxes.  We got there and the usher tells us NO.  Shortly thereafter a customer of another hue comes in with a box and he attempted to wave him through until he caught our side eye and told him no too.  We snuck it in anyway:))  The food was good and prices were good, and I thought it was cute that they have show themed items that vary as the shows change.  I would eat here again and make sure I had enough time to really sit down and enjoy it all.
author: Ketta R.

description:
So after about a month of coming here weekly, this place never fails to deliver with their food and service.

Food: 4 stars- the food is well prepared and could use a little more seasoning in my opinion, but otherwise everything tastes great, and they are very giving when it comes to portion size.

Service: 5 stars easily. I come in the early morning when they open and Doug is by far the best sever I've seen in the industry. He always checks on you, gives you the specials of the day, offers coffee as soon as you walk in. Honestly, I can't comment on afternoon staff but if you ever meet him, you'll understand.

Summary: hands down this joint is a hidden gem here in the market/civic center district. If you want honest, hearty food and superior service, you have to come here. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
author: Taylor G.

description: Loved the decor and ambience. The service was  fast, friendly and courteous. Had the hash specialty, Hubby had eggs Benedict specialty and daughter had chocolate chip pancakes. Everything was so good!!  The pancakes looked fluffy and tasted so good. I loved my hash and could barely finish. It's walking distance to SHN Orpheus Theatre too.
author: Tanya M.

description: Nice little place to grab a bite before seeing a show. I ordered the meatloaf and was a but surprised by the peas & carrots added - not a binder that I would or my mom would have used. There isn't much in the area that is a short walking distance to the theatre and that I could take my kids to, but this did the trick
author: Jack W.

description: We enjoyed our meal as we usually do. This time we ordered off the show specials. Among us we had the shrimp and grits, the smoked ribs, the chicken dumplings and the mahi mahi salad. The shrimp and grits and the ribs were spicier than anticipated but the combinations worked. The salad was enjoyed to an empty plate. The dumplings in the chicken and dumpling were more like packed stuffing an not the usual dumplings. But that plate was also enjoyed nonetheless. We shared the pecan bar with the fixings for dessert and the plate was scraped clean. We didn't have the Tasso stuffed shrimp. Maybe we'll go back for that.
author: Marcei C.

description:
I stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb across the street and got a takeout order from them. I went to pick up my order and it smelled like pee (probably due to the homeless people outside) so I was very glad I didn't eat there. Got my order and got back to my hotel room and realized they didn't give me any utensils, napkins, syrup for my french toast, stirrers for my coffee. They also gave me brown sugar for my coffee (is that a thing? weird). So I was annoyed I had to go back and get all these things. So make sure you specifically ask for everything you need before you leave. 
Food was pretty good. I got a cheese omelette with home fries that was decent. My friend got the farmer's market and that was the real winner. Decent coffee. Nothing that spectacular, but would go back.
author: Sunia C.

description:
We went to Sam's for breakfast on a Saturday morning (29th October).  The food was good n our experience was lovely till one waiter bought the credit card slip. Without explanation or information this guy had added 20% tip to the bill. We noticed it when we were about to add tip as usual.  When enquired about it, he rudely told us that he has done so because people come from different places and sometimes don't tip so he took it on himself to make sure tip is extracted from all. This totally  spoilt our mood as its wrong on so many levels 
1. This is textbook definition of profiling 
2. Whatever is your motive you can't charge the customer anything without their knowledge and 
3 last time i checked tip was discretionary and no wait staff can extort from customer. 
We left the tip as charged n left.  Don't think we will return with such attitudes.
author: Priyanka I.

description: There food is very good. But it's worth going for the food. The menu has a bit of everything, but it's not too big. The portions are a good size. The place seems always busy. I'd give it 5 stars but the staff make you feel rushed even when the wait is only one party and we were still eating.
author: Linda K.

description:
How often do you eat at the same restaurant night after night? Thai food can do that for me sometimes. But now, there's Sam's. Three nights in a row, and still going!
 
I've tried something different each night, and every dish is a genuine home run. Prices are moderate and affordable. The staff is professional, engaged, warm and friendly. 

Steps away from the Civic Center train station, Sam's is a neighborhood oasis that you need to build a long term relationship with. Even if you're just here visiting.
author: Mark W.

description: Just ate here and I will say the food was actually really good. The service was awful! We had Nicholas as a waiter. Worst waiter I think I have EVER had. Can't be bothered to get drink orders right, doesn't want to do his job. Overheard him complaining about people being cheap today. No they weren't being cheap, your service was that bad people weren't tipping you. He needs to be in another industry where he doesn't have to serve people.
author: Brenden B.

description: First time here and the chicken was amazing. The mashed potatoes had no seasoning but once I added salt and pepper they were good. The apple spice cake
author: Mickalyn M.

description: Great, food and we did not have to wait but a minute.  Highly recommend this restaurant for those who like good food.  The bread is highly recommended.  I am going to try there breakfast/brunch.
author: Michael M.

description: Although this isn't the best neighborhood (Tenderloin area), this is a nice little diner with good, fast food and good service. Outside is sketchy and I wouldn't want to walk around alone here at night. But inside, the menu features a good variety of choices. We didn't have a lot of time, but our food came out quickly and it was pretty tasty. Service was warm, friendly, and attentive. If you have the same bad fortune as I had when I got put up at the Holiday Inn for work, this is a short walk from there and a good place to grab a bite to eat.
author: Nicole D.

description: This place is always good! The food just keeps getting better, and the service can't be beat!
author: Eric L.

description: Very good quality food and convenient for a meal before the show. I got the fried chicken and it was one of the best I've had. It was hot, super crispy with honey crust and the chicken itself was moist and juicy. My daughter got the burger and it was pretty good.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Excellent food - The filet of sole was perfect!
Excellent service - Fast, friendly servers who know the menu.

TIP:  A great place to eat close to the Orpheum Theater. Mention that you have tickets to The Orpheum, and you will receive 10% off your bill!
author: Coree B.

description: Not a very good experience. Got an entree but waiter forgot to bring soup or salad. He didn't even care to ask. Brought soup but it was cold. Wife's burrito had no beans in a black bean burrito. Nobody cares in this place. No service. Not going back.
author: Teresa G.

description:
No matter what else I say about this place, let me start with this:  They have a really nice staff that take good care of you.  I've never seen anything but kind and attentive service.  If you're looking for diner-style comfort food, know that you're also getting a staff that will make you feel comfortable and at home.  For some reason (hmm...), this is a place where I like to come when I'm having a rough day or feel a little under the weather.  I always feel better after my visit.

So, I like the place.  I've been in about a half-dozen times and I have yet to have anything other than a good experience.  The menu is pretty extensive - Breakfast in the morning (and through out the day), lunch options ranging from sandwiches to salads to burgers to smaller entrees - and some more upscale dinner entrees.  I've always done lunch here - tried the French Dip, Patty Melt, Korean Pork Sandwich, Korean Tacos, Chicken Salad Melt with Avocado.  Is the food such that it will knock your socks off?  No.  It's not supposed to be - it IS supposed to be tasty and reliably satisfying.  After this many visits, I haven't scratched the surface of all the things I'd like to try.  My only knock is that I REALLY wish they had Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup.  

The set-up is dining room on one-side, counter on the other.  During a work-day, it's nice to escape to the counter and watch a little TV.  They do have a few beers on tap, and a happy hour from 3-6pm.  I'm not sure too many people come here just to drink as it's really a restaurant.  I would say that the prices are not cheap, and may be just a little on the high-side.  But, not egregiously so.  Oh - and, considering the neighborhood, it's a nice escape from some of the rough-and-tumble of the Mid-Market locale.
author: Adam S.

description:
Not a bad spot to grab a bite after a show at the Orpheum theater. We were all very hungry and found this place on yelp. We also saw that we needed reservations for a party of 5 so I'm glad we checked online first. We were able to get one for after the show. 

Our waitress was nice and friendly. We all enjoyed our food, so much everything was gone. Either that or we were just that hungry! I had the marinated beef Korean tacos minus the spicy sauce. They were good. The Pico de Gallo made them a little messy, dripping down my wrist. So extra napkins were a must. The rice needed salt, but was good, especially with the extra drippings on the plate. Overall good place, decent food. There was a variety of choices, cause you know, it is a diner. Korean tacos, hamburgers and a burrito in our party. 

I'd eat here again.
author: Renee P.

description: Wonderful experience, our waitress was super nice and attentive and all 4 of us enjoyed our food. It's clean and modern and decorated cute too. I had chicken strips and they were delicious and their ranch was the bomb. Friends had breakfast, breakfast sandwich, and a burger and we loved everything. Definitely would come back again.
author: Jessica S.

description: Excellent service and friendly staff. We were running late for Book of Mormon due to horrible traffic. They promised to get us in and out in time to see the show. They did it! Great diner food. The burgers were juicy and the sides were all good...especially the fries. We also had a pasta dish that we liked.
author: Janet P.

description: We arrived about 15 minutes early for our reservations and were welcomed and seated immediately.  Food was good.  Service was good.  The location is great for food / drinks before going to the Orpheum.
author: Pat W.

description: I Was looking for a spot within walking distance from the holiday inn civic was told by the lo bby they had good food. I ordered the Korean beef tacos. Great spice, tender meat and just the right amount. The place had great service and the food was good.
author: Elenne V.

description: Our group of four ate here on a Wednesday night in February before seeing a show at the Orpheum (which is half a block away).  We all loved what we ordered -- Bulgogi Tater Tots, custom burgers, Korean Tacos, etc.  Hostess and wait staff were friendly and attentive.  We had made a reservation and called ahead that we were running late due to an accident on the freeway.  They held our table for 30 minutes and were very cheerful about it!  All around great experience.  (Even the bathrooms were exceptional: clean, well-stocked, roomy, and the door locks work!)
author: Julie C.

description: Wait staff was kind of standoffish not a big deal, but they also forgot our order! Then the food comes out Luke warm at best. Tasted like it had just been sitting out and was microwaved. This place would be OK as a greasy spoon diner if it wasn't $17 for a cold plate of crappy food.
author: Tony T.

description: We ate at Sam's before seeing Hamilton at the Orpheum.  We were drawn by the promise of loaded tater tots!  While the tots were advertised on the online menu, we were disappointed to find that they were not on the paper menu.  We asked for them and the chef made a batch up for us.  They were excellent.  He came out later to tell us that the tots were going to be on the regular menu soon.  Our group had some of the specials and some of the regular menu items -- all were good.  I had the Korean tacos, which were amazing.  The food was excellent and the prices were good.  Loved the atmosphere! We will return again.
author: Leslie G.

description: Came in randomly looking for a nearby restaurant for a quick late lunch. Items on the menu were limited by selection & variety & a bit pricey but for what i ordered was definitely worth it! I chose the pesto chicken pasta & was so glad i did. Very delicious & the serving was more than enough for 1 person. Also came with a side of their soup of the day, which i believe was some sort of tomato soup but was also very appetizing to my pleasure. The waiter was friendly as well as the other host. 4 stars only because of the price but overall great experience and would highly recommend for anyone looking for a casual american food restaurant on market st. Will be coming back in the future!
author: Paul E.

description: Great place to eat very simple. Need dinner before the show, place will get the job done.
author: Joe C.

description:
The food is okay, a tad overpriced the service is a hit and miss. The last 2 times I've been here, I've had to get up and get my coffee/syrup (this was after asking for these items without results). Too much chitchat amongst the staff which results in customers being ignored. Another time I was shown to a table but had to get up and get a menu, I was unable to get any of the waitstaff's attention since their backs were to me all on their phones or talking to each other. 
I was just approached by 2 separate waitstaff, one to ask if I had ordered a cupcake, another to ask if I had all my food. The table across from me just received their food, what looked like a tuna melt sandwich on toast was sent back as it was cold. 
I just had a 2nd cup of coffee poured and it was cold!
author: Joyce P.

description: Had wonderful breakfast burrito, loop. It is solid good quality food. It.does get crowded often so try to go at off times. Area has allot of homeless so just be aware
author: William C.

description: The food was ok, if expensive. Diner is cute. Staff rather lax and inattentive. But what really colored our family dinner and prompted this review is the experience of being verbally accosted and physically threatened by a street lunatic while sitting in one of the booths and not ONE staff member noticed or intervened. It was loud and scary and left with the impression that SF is full of cowardly bystanders.
author: U. K.

description: This place is good for simple breakfast and omelets yet the pancakes need a little bit more flavor.
author: Elsa Natalie G.

description: I had the risotto special that was good.  Wish I tried the Korean tacos though.  The fried chicken looked good as well.  I had the blueberry pie with ice cream for dessert.  Very satisfying.
author: Ed A.

description: We went to SAM's before the Friday evening Hamilton and it was great! With a 5pm reservation we finished early but when we left there were people waiting. The food was very good and the service very friendly and attentive. It's conveniently located less than a block away from the Orpheum. It's a great place for families.
author: Christine S.

description: What a pleasant surprise!  The food was DELICIOUS!!!  We started with the Spinach, Artichoke and Jalapeno dip.  It was AMAZING!  Then I moved on the the Bulgogi Burrito. Holy cow!  Totally tasty.  I would recommend tbis place to everyone and will definately be back.  The service was lovely and they were very speedy in getting our food in time for our performance.  The prices were extremely reasonable as well.  This was such a great experience!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Wanted to have some breakfast before leaving SF and we stayed at hotel whitcomb, this place was conveniently across the street.

Looking at the past pictures, they had a much needed renovation and added a ton of tv's, a bar and better upholstery.

Although this place is not that big, they did the best with the space that they had. There wasn't a long wait and we were seated fairly quick. We both went with the eggs benedict to cure our hangovers. They weren't out of this world, but were good at the time. The side of potatoes were soggy and didn't taste fresh.

As for customer service we had to ask a bunch of times for our cups to be refilled and the check took forever.

I would give this place another try...
author: Jerrica N.

description: Despite the lack of exterior "curb appeal", this place has some really decent food for lunch.  Prices are a bit on the high side.  But at least they deliver.  Over several lunch visits with colleagues, we've tried club sandwiches, soft tacos, corned beef hash, burgers, wet  burritos (served with green salsa poured over the top - yum), and a whole variety of breakfast foods,  By the way - they serve real hash browns.  Even when busy, the food service has usually been prompt.  It's a sleeper.  We keep coming back.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Too expensive and they do something I hate: they add the gratuity in the check and then add the tip line on the cc slip. 
Don't. 
Just don't. 
Oh, and I episode have tipped you more than what you put, even though you're over priced.
author: Rachel F.

description: Came here before seeing a late show at bill graham for dinner, and it was pretty much what we expected. Standard burgers (they are tasty and big), but they didn't really stand out compared to other burgers we have had before. Mine was a little different, it was the one with chicaquiles and avocado on top, which was yummy and different. However, we had a little bit of a snafu with our order; at first, I received the wrong order but was told it was what I had ordered. I took a bite, still sure it wasn't the burger I had ordered, only for our waiter to come back and tell me that it actually was not my order, so he took it away. A few minutes later, he did bring the burger I had ordered, but it was a little less fresh than the other one had been, and there was a greasy order receipt still on the plate when I got it. Then, however, we realized there was no avocado on my burger, even though that come standard with the order. Our waiter took it back again, and he brought back the same burger with a couple of slices tossed onto the burger and plate. I did eat it and it did taste good, but it could've been fresher and the service could've been better and more organized. We did end up getting 15% off our bill for all of the trouble, but I don't know if I would come back here without another reason to be in the area.
author: Rachel D.

description: The food was good but the manager's attitude was not. We ordered the rib eye medium but was brought out fully cooked. They took it back but it took too long and we had to leave for the play on time so we asked them to cancel it. The manager returned with the steak and tried to insist we take it and when we declined she gave us attitude. As we finished our drinks, she returned to the table and stuck herself in the middle of the table to clean up without a word, again with attitude all over her face. We had pulled out a cash tip for the waiter, but decided not to tip, even though the waiter was nice... because of her horrible attitude the 2nd time.
author: Joi G.

description:
How come I never noticed this place before?  Last night we were at Starbucks directly across the street.  We noticed a big crowd at SAM's.  We were on our way to catch a show at the Orpheum.  

Subsequently I Yelped SAM's and read the favorable reviews.  So hubby and I came back downtown today for an early dinner.  All wines and beers at HH prices between 3p-5p.  We each started with a draft beer.  Hubby had two.  $3.00 HH price for a pint.

I went with the famous Korean tacos.  And I'm glad I did.  Got the beef tacos.  Three small soft tacos with a scoop of cilantro white rice. If there's fried chicken on the menu, that's what hubby will order.  Today was no different.  Hot temperature, flavorful, and crispy.  We both enjoyed our meals.  

$45 inc tax & tip. A very satisfying meal.

Quick and efficient service as they've got to feed the folks headed to the Orpheum later.

Posters of many Broadway plays hung on the walls with cast autographs.
author: Shirley N.

description: Awesome spot . Great food, excellent customer service and Gabbie, now a manager, has been there since I've been going. Gabbie is accomadting and professinal, an asset to Sam's regular customers. The breakfast plates are the bomb. I recommend the chilaquiles, wings, and their Mediterranean plate. All around a 10!
author: Ray Y.

description:
Sam's was a really nice find, a recommendation from the staff at the Whitcomb across the road. While in SF it was convenient and accessible for us so we ended up having breakfast here a few times. The Farmer's Market and Supreme Leader were both great, the coffee was pretty decent. I also had a great salad there one evening.

The colleagues I was with enjoyed the Korean tacos and the burgers, as well as most of the breakfast options. Everything went down well across the board.

Service was fast and courteous, and we always left happy. I couldn't mark them down, it's great. If I was ever in the area I'd definitely go back and taste the rest of the menu.

The only downside could be if you'd a bit picky about where you eat the street outside can be a bit overwhelming and the decor inside quite the opposite. So if you're faint of heart maybe not one for you.
author: Jack W.

description: This is my "Go To" place when seeing a show at the Orpheum. Great location, great menu, go early before a show or it can be a long wait and you'll be rushing. On my last visit, we had to wait and realized people who came in after us were being called. The host said he called our name 10 minutes ago. I'm standing right next to the host stand, I did not hear my name and he didn't make much of an effort to find us. After we were seated, I watched the wait staff walking back and forth and then going to wait on a table who was seated after we were. I would give the food 4 stars, but service is 2 stars,
author: Linda S.

description: The food is fine, but not great. The service is totally disorganized. Don't order the hash browns. They were undercooked and flavorless.
author: Brian K.

description:
Absolutely loved the French toast. So fluffy and cinnamony. 
The coffee was pretty strong and it tasted like it had been sitting out for a couple hours because it wasn't even hot. :( 

The service was okay but it could have been way better. The diner wasn't packed. There were 4 occupied tables at the time and it looked like there were at least 3 different servers. We didn't really get checked on and when I wanted to reorder my coffee the attendant wasn't coming to the table. She came  when I was almost done with my food, but kindly replaced my coffee.

The place is good to have some fluffy French toast, but the service could use some work.
author: Karen R.

description: Absolutely love Sam's. It's a bit of a tradition for us before catching a show at the Orpheum. They're busy, so get there early, but they try to get you through as soon as possible.
author: Jeanne R.

description: Looking for breakfast in SF?  Sams is it. It's not fancy and it's not particularly cheap but the food is fantastic. You have to try the breakfast burrito. The salsa Verde on it is to die for ,and as a native Southern Californian, I take my breakfast burritos very seriously and usually feel that no one else can make a decent one. If you don't try that, then go for the chilaquiles...amazing. And the service is terrific too!  We'll definitely be back.
author: Teri N.

description:
My friends and I have been looking for a nice place to have lunch before attending plays at the Orpheum. Having eaten many times at the restaurant in the hotel across the street we wanted to find another place as the restaurant had changed its prices and menu. 

Someone recommended Sam's Diner and I'm glad I checked it out on Yelp. The great reviews and ratings, along with being able to make a reservation from the Yelp site, made our decision easy.

First, if you are going to see a play at the Orpheum MAKE a reservation if you want to eat here. The restaurant is small/compact with about 20 booths and a long counter with seating. People were waiting outside the door and I saw many turn away rather than wait.

You can order from the breakfast or lunch menu (there are specials for dinner). There are varied choices, our food was very good, and the service was excellent. Prices are good, too, especially for downtown SF.

I overheard the hostess telling someone they had been open about one month after remodeling. The restaurant has a modern spartan-like look and is very clean. 

We will definitely be back here for lunch every time we head to the Orpheum.
author: Rebecca E.

description: Totally unassuming in appearance but holy cow the food is great. We shared the chili and cheese topped tator tots and all agreed they were so good that they were worth a BART ride in just to have them.  The chili was very meaty and delicious. Thin cut crispy fries accompany the sandwiches. Turkey club was good as was the tuna melt. Really good onion rings too.  We'll be back.
author: Dar V.

description: lost a star because the water tasted gross. the rock was delicious and the fries were fresh,perfectly salty, and crispy. Waiter was super nice.
author: Gigi C.

description:
After walking around the city for the entire morning, my friends and I were very hungry and I was experiencing the pangs of hanger. In my desperation, I suggested SAM's since it was a few feet in front of us. 

I ordered an egg scramble of sorts, and was very saddened by the fact that it was bland, wet, and the avocado mushy. I had hopes for the hash brown, but unfortunately that was also lacking in flavor. I doused hot sauce all over it trying to make it a little more enjoyable. My coffee was very burnt, but I wasn't expecting much at this point. 

I do appreciate the fact that SAM's was there in my time of need, but I probably will never be back. It holds a special memory in my mind, and a reminder to always pack snacks instead of rushing in the first diner I see.
author: Sarah B.

description:
We've walked by this place a zillion times and never stopped. One dreary Sunday morning my wife and I were on our way to the BART station to go to Oakland for brunch. I'd cajoled her into it, and when we passed SAMs, I stopped and saw they had eggs benedict, which is what I was after anyway, so we changed course. 

This was on par with any benedict I've had anywhere. I always get mine on a bed of spinach instead of muffin, and they were totally great about that request. Perfectly poached eggs and a velvety Hollandaise. Zero complaints. So happy I finally checked out this gem in my neighborhood since Little Griddle is so terrible.
author: Guinnevere C.

description: One of the best diners downtown. Quick service, lovely people, nice ambiance, and great food.
author: prasanthi p.

description:
Ive eaten here multiple times when at concerts..Right around the corner from the  Bill Graham auditorium. 

The staff are awesome, the place is really clean, the prices are more than fair, and they get your food fast.

Also, Id like to add, Ive been all over the damn planet, and eaten a hamburger in every damn place known to man, but Sam's " the rock" burger is the best I've had anywhere. Hands down.
author: Kevin D.

description: The food was good, it wasn't great or anything I'd record as a memorable experience. Service was attentive and prompt. Couldn't understand what made this place so great from the reviews that it has vs my experience.
author: John N.

description: Good service, but average food at prices ~$15 for an entree, so meh
author: Y W.

description: We were in San Francisco on business and stayed across from Sams. Had a fantastic breakfast. Will definitely be going back.
author: Debbie R.

description:
Overall not half bad. 

Before going to the Lion King we headed here for dinner. 

After looking at the reviews kinda want to come back for breakfast. 

We got a seat at the bar (a recommend if you don't want to wait for a table). 

The kitchen staff are a bunch of jedis.. super small kitchen and grill but they make it work. 

Server was nice enough and super funny... also very attentive. 

I got the duck sliders which were decent. The husband got the bolognese pasta dish.. lots of meat!!!   Overall good deal for the amount of food that you get. 


They have musical/broadway inspired menu depending on what is showing that the orpheum.. neat idea ;)
author: Vicky T.

description: Food was good.  Wholesome breakfast and not a slim meal for the price $10 two eggs, toast, country potatoes and 3 bacon.  Quick and friendly.  I'd like to go back and try other non traditional items on the menu.
author: Barb B.

description: I had a sausage patty and it was just ok. A bit too salty. Environment is ok, a bit less clean than I expected.
author: V P.

description: This place is located walking distance from the hotel that I'm staying at. Went to the restaurant with a coworker and got seated by the waitress fairly quickly. The waiter that came by to take our order was friendly. I told the waiter it was my first time dining here and was looking to order the tacos, but was not sure which type of meat to choose - marinated beef, spicy pork, or fish. Per our waiter, he recommended the spicy pork tacos, which I went ahead and ordered. Food came out pretty fast. The tacos were delicious! Service was great and prices were decent. Definitely would come back here in the future.
author: Annie L.

description: After partying in the City the night before for a birthday party, the wife and I ate here before heading back to Los Angeles.  Cool spot with in walking distance from our Holiday Inn.  I had a smothered Burrito and it was good.  Good sized portions and it was just what the doctor ordered after a late night out.
author: Satnam H.

description: I was walking bye, headed to lunch and noticed this place.  They had a health inspection score of 100 so I had to try it out and I'm glad I did.  They serve breakfast until 3pm so I had the 2 eggs, 3 bacon breakfast for $8.50.  I will definitely go back.
author: P A.

description:
Awesome food, awesome service.  I had the meatloaf, my friend had the penne pasta with steak.  Came with delicious beef-vegetable soup which was homemade, without a doubt.  And yummy tiramisu for dessert!
David our server was on top of things and always had a smile.  And they serve Hard Cider, (Angry Orchard) a big plus in my book!!
It was our first time here for us, and I'd definitely come again.
author: David S.

description: Great place to eat before a show at the Orpheum Theatre.  Came here at noon before a 1pm matinee and the place was packed.  Loco Moco = a dish popular in Hawaii (Hamburger patty, Fried Egg, Brown Gravy over Rice) tasted authentic.  Club Sandwich w/Cole slaw = traditional and basic, and very good.
author: Rob T.

description: We love Sam's! We come here before every show! It's in such a great spot, the staff is amazing, and they'll make sure you make your show in time! We love bringing people here as well. We've had breakfast and dinner here and love it every time!
author: Mandi K.

description: It's food I guess. Denny's quality in a dirty establishment at San Francisco prices. I live a block away and would appreciate it if they were open past 10 for emergency food, but as a day-only diner it has nothing going for it.
author: Kurt N.

description: Nice place. The manager comp-ed the meal for the guy next me when he spilled his own water. Nice touch, good food.
author: Dan W.

description:
Would not have come in here if not for yelp - and I'm glad I did. 
Had a great cheeseburger, big, perfectly cooked and tasty. Really friendly and accommodating service too. Not a long wait for food. Couldn't ask for more in a diner, I'll be back for sure.
author: Tennille D.

description: Nothing much to say about this place. Everything but our server was ordinary, unremarkable, and not worth saying much about. Caryn, 'though very young, is an excellent server.
author: Swing C.

description: Open at 7 AM and had a decent menu. I really have to give joints on Market Street a real chance and I'm glad I did. They had many items for breakfast. I looooove breakfast. The Wed special was a mascapone stuffed french toast with strawberries but it started at 8 AM. I was too early. Darn. I went with the two eggs OM, wheat toast, tator tots, wheat toast and water. It came out pretty quickly and the eggs were done as expected. The staff was friendly and there were quite a few folks in there that morning. I will have to try some other items on the menu. Their lunch options look good too.  Decent.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
This place down the street from the Curran theater past the Burger King. Lots of signed theater posters. 
Had the rock burger and fish and chips. The rock burger comes with bacon, cheese, bbq sauce and onion rings. It was big and juicy burger. 
The fish and chips came with soup or salad. Had the cream of broccoli soup. It was very tasty. Would have liked it warmer. The fish pieces were small but the fish was moist without heavy breading. 
Good diner food and great service. Three different wait staff asking if we needed anything even though the place was packed.
author: Bacon G.

description:
Stopped in for a late dinner when we were turned away from the restaurant across the street. We were sat right away. Everyone in our party enjoyed their meals. Mozzarella sticks were great served with what seemed to be a homemade marinara.  The Penne pasta, BLT, Sam's Veggie burger , spicy wings, Cobb salad and the Korean tacos were all great as well. They have a nice selection of beer and wine also.  Service was pretty good too. We're happy we were turned from the place across the street!

Going back in the morning for breakfast before heading back home!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Food was great! Had the chicken penne pesto, staff could be upgraded. Don't try Sam's hot wings, just not worth it!
author: Marcela C.

description:
The gem on market steet.

Located at Market and 8th, outside is filled with crazy, homeless, drug addicts but once you step into Sam's it feels like your in a different place. The food is always excellent. If you come for lunch they are always quick, and get your food out very fast so you can eat, and get back to work. The menu is filled with many different options including breakfast sold late if not all day. If your looking for excellent food, and at a great price, come to Sam's Diner.
author: Liz L.

description: Friendly fast service. But the food is not remarkable at all. In fact, one of two pancakes was burned. Would not go back, there has got to be better places.
author: LInda S.

description:
As some have pointed out the service can be slow, but it wasn't consistently slow and we were checked up on from time to time and the staff was friendly. At one point the owner or manager came by to check on us and that is always a good mark for a place.

We had the duck sliders, meat ball sandwich, bacon cheeseburger, and the kids sliders. The duck sliders weren't really that good.  There just wasn't much duck taste to them - perhaps over processed when they were turned into patties?  For duck sliders I would really expect sliced duck meat, or at least the taste of duck. We buy duck because of the flavor, having it muddled and bland means you might as well as order regular sliders.

The meat ball sandwich was filling and good.  Plenty of meatball and a good sauce with good bread. The sliders were OK, my son thought they were to dense (packed to tightly) and my wife liked the bacon cheese burger but the bacon was fairly limp.

We visited on our way out of a show and with the convenience factor I expect we will be back again.
author: Sean S.

description: Great food and gives a good ol diner feel.  Shina is the best waitress with regards to service and always remembers your name. Only been a few times but feel like a regular!
author: Gregory B.

description:
Just after demolishing a 'French Dip' roast beef sandwich in Sam's on Market St. Yum! 

Don't be put off by the somewhat shabby exterior, the sandwich is one of the best I've ever tasted (fries were really good too). My lady had the BLT and slaw on the side, also really good.

Also serving reasonably priced beers ($5 for and Anchor Steam as opposed to $7/8 everywhere else we've been on our SF trip). 

Wait staff were really friendly, and I overheard one of them mention they smoke their own meats and make their own sauces.

If you're in the area and in the mood for a sandwich, check it out.
author: Colin M.

description: We've grabbed a quick lunch here twice before shows at the Orpheum. Good food, quick and friendly service. We'll be back again for sure!
author: Nicole E.

description:
Sam's, being right outside my apartment, keeps me coming back not only because it is convenient but also delicious.

While i'm currently quite sad that they have run out oc chocolate chips for my pancakes, i'm keeping it together and having banana pancakes. 

if it isn't terribly busy, their tatertots come out perfect. i haven't ventured past their breakfast food. They have very good orange juice, however their coffee would benefit if they'd perhaps double their bean use.
author: Jason H.

description:
Order the Coit Burrito! It is amazing!! Seriously.  
I'm not a breakfast person but the rest of my family is so we read some reviews and decided on this place.  Everyone else ordered the Dirty Harry and I almost went along with them but changed my mind last minute and ordered the Coit.  I shared some with everyone at my table and even thought he Dirty Harry was incredible they all wished they ordered the burrito.  Fast service, clean and affordable.  EVERYONES food looked like something I wanted to try!!  Very,very, good!
author: Nic M.

description:
Friendly buzzing restaurant with great food. Sat at the bar, staff friendly and man they were efficient getting a that food out. 

Had a chicken burger packed with salad sauce and avocado. My mate had the golden beet salad that was delicious. 

Friendly local diner
author: Dave S.

description: This place just happened to be across from where we were staying and we needed breakfast asap. This place exceeded my expectations as far as deliciousness goes! It's nothing fancy, kinda expensive, and pretty small. Despite this, we opted to go a 2nd time instead of trying a place next door for breakfast because it was that good. The waitstaff was super kind as well.
author: Rosa M.

description: OMG ALL YOU NEED IN THE green Tomatillo sauce IN YOUR LIFE!!!!! ENOUGH SAID. MY HUSBAND GOT THE CHILI CHILES AND THOSE ARE AMAZING, YES WITH THE SAUCE. I GOT THE EGGS AND HASH. BROWNS and bacon. I got that sauce and put it on everything and that was just AMAZING! Oh yeah get the white grape mimosa....you won't be sorry and only 2 min walk from Orpheum theater! Fast and very friendly sevice...we sat at the counde5and loved every minute. Especially my picky husband.
author: Sylvia F.

description:
I've been to SAM's diner several times, and have absolutely loved it. I have come from out of the city just to go to this one restaurant and usually they treat me very well, but today is why I will never eat at SAM's again. 

So a few of my friends and I went to pride today and I told them that we all had to go eat at SAM's because it was my favorite restaurant and everyone had to try it. Went up to the gate, the hostess asked for a name so I gave her my name and then she said it would be about 25 minutes for a party of about 6 to be seated. So we went to go find a bathroom and we were gone for about 5 minutes, we come back and I just wanted to see how long the wait would be then. The same hostess said that they called our name awhile back, but we never showed so they cut our name. I then asked them how long the wait would be again and once again she said 20 minutes. So I waited outside and once again 5 minutes later she calls us in to be seated. 

So we were seated at 2 different tables and our other party couldn't find their money so they couldn't eat and one of our other party members (one that was sitting at the exact same table) was using the restroom. The waitress came by their table quite quickly and asked what they wanted. The 2 that said they weren't going to eat told them that, and without even asking the others she automatically assumed everyone at the table was not going to order also, so she asked all 4 of them to leave. When my friend said that he was going to order and that he was just waiting for his friend to come out of the bathroom the waitress threatened to call the cops on him. So the waitress went and grabbed the owner and even after hearing that they were in fact going to order the owner told him that he had to leave and also threatened to call the cops. So my friend left and we followed behind. 

I will never be eating at SAM's Diner again. Gotta find a new favourite restaurant when I come to the city.
author: Kiernan S.

description:
Yesterday my daughter and I went to Sam's for the best breakfast ever!  On the recommendation from the server, we ordered the Chilaquiles.  it was the best!  A wonderful combo of spicy and eggy.  - enough to wake up sleepy taste buds but not enough to burn the house down.

Food came out fast.  Service was good but the highlight was when the owner checked in on us.  She wanted to make sure we were well taken care of.  Great service, great food.  We will be back!
author: Debbie W.

description:
This comes from a tourist POV:

If you're staying at the Whitcomb, eat here! Do not let the exterior fool you, it's much more decent on the inside. It's not the most inexpensive, nor the most expensive, and I think that you're paying a fair price for what you get. The waitress was very nice, and attentive. The food was pretty tasty. I ordered one of their burgers ($15 & included fries), and it was good! My roommate ordered the club sandwich and it looked delicious and was huge! I would go back to try it next time I visit!
author: Karen M.

description: Delicious and good prices. Came here before going to the Orpheum since its so close. The food was great and the servers were attentive. Try the Korean tacos!
author: Kasey H.

description:
I'm going for it, sam's spicy chicken wing - best wings in the neighborhood (Hayes/Civic center).  All-american standard fare that includes Korean street tacos and mission style burritos.  One stop shop, one for all, all for one.  

I live a few minutes away so convenience and hunger drives initial pursuit.  I'm here craving comfort food and not fusion inspired grub to be plated.  I'm present because wife and I have palates that are not sophisticated and discriminating.  Patrons are unwavered by mid-markets 4:20 aroma or 7:30 charisma.  I'll be back for more.
author: Aristotle S.

description: This is a must go to eats before watching a show. It's fast and it's very good. I have to say. We saw a line out in front and I said skip it because we don't want to miss the show. We'll look for another one around here. We went around for about 20 minutes and found nothing inviting. So, we decided to back and the line was gone. I said Okay. Let's take our chances. The show will start in an hour. There was a waiting lists. Yikes! It did not deter us of putting our name. Even though there was a party of 4 and 7 before us. I figured it's only two of us. So, I wrote my name on the list. While waiting, we browsed the menu. We were seated after 10 minutes. We ordered right away. Another 10 minutes and we got our order. I got Korean tacos (it's very good) and hash was good too. But need more meat on that. Hot spot for fast eats.
author: ros d.

description: We were staying across the street at Hotel Whitcomb and enjoyed our breakfast this morning.  We sat at the 'bar' and I ordered the Joe's Scramble w/tater tots.  It was delicious - just the right mix of egg/ground beef/spinach and the tater tots were crispy, just perfect.  My husband had the breakfast burrito and gave it a thumbs up.  Our service was friendly and fast.  They have a good looking lunch/dinner menu and beer selection too.  Don't be turned off by their 'outside curb window', inside it was clean and friendly.  Give them a try!
author: Elise R.

description: Excellent breakfast joint. Prices are a little high but that's not their fault. Thank the most liberal city in the country and its out of control taxes. Food is solid and wait staff world class. It's packed all the time because it's the best choice for bfast lunch in the civic center area. crazy Bernie has been coming to this location since the early 80's when it was Stevens Cafe. Same great food now. Big fan.
author: Crazy Bernie S.

description: Update: we went back and decided to give it a shot. It was great. Super friendly and the food was good!
author: Erik T.

description:
I was hungry and in the neighborhood and the 100 score posted in the window was enough to get me inside. (Both the score and that it was posted are all too rare in San Francisco.)

The pulled pork sandwich, potato salad, and ice tea were all I could have wanted. Service was good, and the selection of draft beers was above average.
author: Bruce S.

description: Wow, this place is terrible. Service, food and especially location. I met my friend here for lunch on a weekday (since the location is halfway between the Financial District and the Mission where she works), and I was surprised by the cleanly interior, but it only went downhill from there. Service staff was slow, confused, no one was actually assigned to our table and they didn't manage to take our drink order for 10+mins. Then after taking our order came back to tell us they were out of English muffins, and then somehow managed to get my order wrong. They literally FORGOT the meat in my omelette. But we had waited at least 35-40mins for food already, so I wasn't about to send it back. Tasteless, bland, small portions, high prices, wow everything I hate in a restaurant. Getting the check was a whole other battle... I give up, I'm not sure how this place is still in business but please don't support them.
author: Natalie H.

description:
This place is near the Civic Center in somewhat of a seedier part of Market, but do not despair.  It is busy with all kinds of people and even tourists mixed in with the vagrants of society.  It's all just a part of the landscape that gives SF its character.

Inside this diner, they look to have it renovated nicely with walnut colored flooring and someone's beautiful photography mounted on the peacefully colored green walls.  Now, the important part:  The breakfast here was one of the best.  Wow, that corned beef hash...  I totally devoured my shrimp, avocado omelette.  Really, that's all there is to say.  It's a fresh breakfast and will get your day started nicely. 

It also helps that the people who serve you here are nice and attentive.  It's the best hole in the wall spot EVER!  I'd totally hit up SAM's next time I end up here in the early morning.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: This place was right across the street from the hotel I was staying in and it was pleasant. The servers were friendly and really hustling to get the food out fast. I had an appetizer (chicken strips) and a dessert (blueberry cobbler) both were delicious. My mom had the fried chicken with the mash potatoes and veggies and she said it was delicious. We would go back.
author: Sarah V.

description:
This diner was across the street from our hotel and wow, the homeless guy sitting outside was not joking, it was one of the best diner's I've been to. Vacationing, you want to make sure you have a hearty breakfast because your days are very long.... We ate every single day for breakfast before heading to our sightseeing... The portions are big and can be shared if you want to save some mula... 

Sam's Diner also had great service, our servers were extremely nice giving us tips where to go and what buses to take to different focus points we wanted to see..

Overall great food, service and location
author: Ana G.

description:
First time here. Would definitely come back if I were in the area. The atmosphere is kind of strange, but grows on you. A sort of upscale diner, dive-chic place. 

Pros: good food, good service. 
Cons: slightly cramped, can't figure out the atmosphere/genre

We came in at 6 and just beat the pre-show rush for the Orpheum. No wait, though I know some people after us had to wait a bit longer. The service was prompt and polite, and they seemed to be working efficiently in a team. The main dining area is built in a long corridor with booths on either side. My only complaint is that access to the bathroom requires having two tables scoot their chairs in to clear the aisle. Not quite a fire hazard, but not a positive. 

The food was good, for the price. I had the stuffed burger special with cole slaw. The burger had a lot of good, meaty flavor. Stuffed with cheese and grilled onions really helped other flavors kind of pop. My girlfriend said she liked her party melt, which was cooked to the right temperature for her. The fries had a good potato flavor and weren't overly seasoned.

Overall, good experience. We'll come back for sure.
author: Shane T.

description: Oh my goodness! I had the meatloaf and it was amazing....so amazing that I could not get a picture.  The setting is pretty intimate and there is no a/c and I happened to visit on a warm evening. The staff was amazing. The service was quick and  the food was so amazing. The presentation A+ I would never expect masterpieces from a place called Sam's Diner but viola! We were waited on by Ed, and he was amazing. My son has peanut and egg allergies and they were very accommodating. I will go back before I head home.
author: Cee C.

description: We didn't expect a lot out of this place since it's not in the best area, but I would not go here again under any circumstance. If you don't like flavor, service or cleanliness this is your place.
author: Leigh K.

description: Great diner with awesome food. Had the fried chicken.  Some of the best I have ever eaten.  I highly recommend you try it.
author: Randy D.

description: The food here is good if you are looking for something quick before seeing a show. The service was very fast, but we never got our drink refills which was a bummer.
author: Taylor S.

description:
My experience was a unique one where I was in SF on a trip, and one morning, I woke up with a really really sore throat. The problem was, I was on a really important business trip and still had a week of the trip left (plus, I had to go to different cities after).

So, I read online that throwing together some ingredients like honey, vinegar, lemon, hot water, etc would be an instant relief. I've never tried it but I was desperate. My hotel did not have the ingredients so I started walking along the block trying to find a place and I stumble upon Sam's diner. 

Katie was the one who welcomed me into the diner and although she was confused at my request at first (I mean, I would too if there was a girl who came in early in the morning trying to ask for random ingredients instead of a breakfast...heh), she ultimately came to my rescue as she let me make my sore throat relief there.

Thanks to her and the diner for graciously letting me borrow some ingredients, I didn't get a cold and my sore throat was gone. I'd sincerely like to thank Katie and this diner, and next time I go to SF, I will definitely visit and get some food here!! I'll also have my SF friends go there on my behalf to support them as well :)

Until then, I would recommend this place based on the customer service, as I'm super picky about customer service and which establishments to support because of the service level.
author: Jenni Y.

description:
I work nearby and Sam's is a lunch staple for pretty much our entire company. Sadly, despite the great relationship our executives have with the restaurant (and the great treatment my colleagues get when wait staff know who they are and where they work), my experience as a customer has been seriously negative. The service is just bad. Wrong orders, neglect, long wait times--it's always something.

Last night, for example, my friend and I needed to grab a bite in the area. I warned her the place has not-the-best service, and to cross her fingers that tonight would somehow finally be different. Unfortunately not. We waited to be seated, per the sign, but were ignored by passing staff. I finally hailed down a guy and got permission to take bar seats. When it was time to order, I wanted a milkshake, but was told by the waitress that they were understaffed and that due to the length of time required/difficulty of milkshake-making, it might not be possible. She said she'd check and bring my second choice (a soda) if the answer was no. Literally five seconds later, a soda was dropped off. I highly doubt any "checking" happened--but even if it did, is that right? I mean, you're not out of vanilla milkshake. You just didn't want to make it.

The food itself is fine. Nothing to write home about, but reliable. I prefer their breakfast to their lunch/dinner. The place has tater tots, so yay for that! I'll continue to eat lunch here since there's not a lot of affordable food in the direct vicinity. But I always drag my feet a little when coworkers choose Sam's as our lunch spot for the day. You can't beat it in terms of convenience, but I just wish every customer got the attention and consideration the diner gives to my office's executives.
author: Maura D.

description: I took my 10 year old daughter here last night before we went to see the 6.30pm show of Aladdin at the Orpheum.  Im always a little cautious wandering around this area with kids, its really not the nicest part of town so was thinking it would not work since you couldn't make reservations for 2, and I didn't want to be standing around on my phone trying to find somewhere to quickly eat.  We arrived at 4.45 and it was packed with about 6 people waiting for tables.  But there was 2 little counter seats with our name on them.  We loved this place so much, the food was great, I had a Korean beef sandwich (not sure what it was called) that was delicious with tater tots on the side (these were yum!) and my daughter had sliders.  I loved the way they themed out the specials menu with Aladdin anecdotes, my daughter loved it.  The service was great, super fast and efficient and really friendly, especially with the long line of customers that did not look very patient standing around.  I would definitely come back here and am glad Ive found it since I never know where to eat when visiting the Orpheum.  Theres a place next door that is great too, but the menu is not as appealing for a 10 year old.  This place was perfect!
author: Karen D.

description:
For quick breakfast eats from the Hotel Whitcomb - this is a pretty reasonable spot. Typical American-style breakfast food is available, such as CFS, or Eggs and Bacon, or Omelets, to name a few. There are a few Mexican-inspired dishes as well, while I perused the menu. 

Service was as expected - considering the environment, I'm not expecting much. It's pretty much a diner - reasonable food, reasonable service, and reasonable atmosphere. Nothing impressive, but nothing critical either; it suited my needs during my travels.
author: Franklin H.

description:
delicious and great vibe. Met some very nice people while eating my chilaquiles. 
Corinne was super sweet and the food hit the spot. I'll be back;)
author: SeniorMcDicker P.

description:
YELP IN THE NEWS FEB, 2016 : A Yelp employee publicly complained to the CEO that she couldn't afford to buy groceries -- hours later, she was fired: http://www.businessinsider.com/talia-jane-fired-yelp-eat24-2-2016
____________________________


Whoa, this place rocks.

The food is amazing, the service is great, the price is right, and there is internet. Its also right next to the civic center and saved me from roaming around between meetings.

I was just going to have some coffee but decided on some wings and they were perfect: cripsy, sweet, and with the right amount of spice. 

Anyhoot--note to self--this is my spot!
author: Justin L.

description:
Sam's is in a great location for hopping off BART and grabbing dinner before a show at the Orpheum, and they know it because inside the walls are decorated with many autographed theater posters!  Which make for fun perusing, since their service is a bit slow once your order is in.  I've been here twice now though, and the food has always been worth the wait!

On my first visit I tried the honey fried chicken, and inhaled every last bite!  And more recently came here with friends to enjoy their happy hour.  Their soju cosmo for $5 was sweet and delicious and packed a wollop!  Mozzarella cheese sticks were fine, kinda tasted frozen and their marinara sauce for dipping is pretty poor.  But our waiter recommended their Korean style hot wings, and WOW - I would take the 40 minute BART ride just to come back and enjoy those wings!  Perfectly cooked, with one of the best asian style hot sauces ever to pass these lips.  Just WOW. 

So come to Sam's and enjoy your pre-theater feast!
author: Terri N.

description:
I had lunch here today. I had a great hamburger and fries. The burger was so good I wanted to take a nap! The service and staff were excellent. The cost is reasonable as well. I will eat here again soon.

For those who visited during pride weekend who needed to use the restroom and wrote a bad review. You could not use the restroom due to fire code and the number of customers who had already been in the place. Adhering to the fire code does not equal bad service. The fire marshal was coming through on the regular that weekend due to crowds.
author: Kiana D.

description: Love the wait staff!  Down to earth atmosphere.   Good food.  Had many great lunches here.  We need more places like this that are affordable and approachable.
author: Drew B.

description: Really liked this local joint! The service was fast and friendly, and the Korean tacos I had were messily scrumptious. I sat where I could see other dishes coming out, and they looked tasty, as well. If you're staying at a nearby hotel, I'd recommend coming here for breakfast, rather than the overpriced, under-quality hotel restaurant.
author: Dennis M.

description: I just returned from San Francisco and can't say enough good things about this wonderful place. I was there for a breakfast, lunch and a dinner and each was terrific. Everyone working there is warm and thoughtful. And the food is delicious. I can't wait to go back!
author: Patricia K.

description:
Upon first inspection, Sam's Diner doesn't seem like anything special, but I've found myself repeatedly returning for more.

Why?
Sam's has a killer burger. They cook the meat perfectly and use quality ingredients. That comes through in how good their food tastes.
The waitstaff are accurate, attentive, and incredibly friendly. The kitchen is also pretty quick, so expect fast service for a sit-down place. I've also never had my order messed up, so that's pretty darn impressive.
The price is right. You get plenty of food for what you pay, so it's easy to fill up on yummy diner-food without paying excessively. 

Noteworthy:
Sam's has some bar-style seating, so if you're looking to grab a quick meal solo, this is a comfortable place to do so. 
They fairly recently swapped out much of the art, and they are now emphasizing the theatre scene in their decor. They had a Lion King-themed specials menu when I ate there most recently, which was rediculously cute.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Been coming here for a few years now. It's a breakfast joint. So? 

  Well, apparently SAMs has changed.  Still a small little restaurant but the food has gone from "eh? It's breakfast..." To "wow! This is awesome"

 My meal rocked. The change is for the better at SAMs. Definitely recommended for grabbing a bite in the worst area of San Francisco.
author: Christopher R.

description: This place is not for vegetarian. It is located behind city hall on market street. With my friend , we ordered beef tacos and I recommend it. Beers are cheap at happy hours .
author: Maria C.

description: We went here before seeing a show at the Orpheum Theater. Luckily I had made reservations because a lot of people had the same idea.  It was fairly crowded and had a bunch of people waiting as well.  I got the Giants Burger and it was delicious. Everyone at our table enjoyed the food. Pretty quick service. We were in and out within an hour. I'd recommend this place and would definitely eat here again.
author: Kristina V.

description:
Party of 12 hungry tour bus drivers.  WELL DONE FOLKS!  Our waiter was excellent, food was outstanding, service was outstanding
when in the city I will return
author: John R.

description: Five of us came for pre-show dinner, first time. The waitress was friendly and very efficient. The food for all of us was terrific. And, without rushing, out in time for the show. We'll be back.
author: Philip C.

description: Stayed at whitcomb hotel across the street . Had a great breakfast . No wait fast service.
author: Angel C.

description:
On our way to the S & M Festival, my husband and I stopped for lunch.  It was a bit of a wait to be seated, but once we were settled, the customer service was non stop.
My husband ordered the Mediterranean plate, which came with baba ganoush, humus and tomato salad.  He loved it, especially the baba ganoush, and he is not an eggplant fan.  I requested the Cobb Salad without meat, and the server didn't give me a hard time for going sans ham and bacon.  It was fresh and delicious.
Charming diner atmosphere with wine and beer, great food and impeccable service.  Sam's Diner is a winner!
author: Robin C.

description:
Sam's Diner surprised me by being a lot more spacious, attractive, and clean on the inside than I expected based on the surrounding businesses. I was greeted casually soon after entering, and offered a table, or a seat at the bar. Because I was on work travel alone, I chose the bar.

My server tipped me off that it was still happy hour and pointed me to the beers on tap. I wasn't expecting beers at all, let alone on tap. And the list was pretty swank! It was stuff I certainly didn't expect to see in a little  diner on Market. I had a Pilsner Urquell on draft. It was served in great shape. I could have also had a couple IPAs, a Full Moon, an Angry Orchard, or a stout. Coors Light was on the list for people's dads, and I appreciate that.

Feeling encouraged by the friendly reception and beer options, I skipped the usual diner food and ordered a chicken burrito.

It came out fast, and well presented, but it let me down a bit. The rice wasn't noticeably seasoned and had a wet, sad texture like it was waiting to become a casserole. The chicken was really high quality meat, but also unseasoned. The cheese was fine. The beans were bland. The chips were a bit stale and boring, and they were served with a salsa that had lots of heat but no flavor otherwise.

I was hungry and scarfed it down anyway. I score this place high because of the great, professional waiters, and the totally good beer selection. If I could re-do my evening tonight, I'd skip the attempt at Mexican and order a traditional diner plate. I bet the burgers here are awesome. The salads looked great too.

I'll definitely come back for breakfast and burgers, and I'll avail myself of that Pilsner Urquell on draft again, too.
author: Curtis B.

description: Overall the food was pretty good. I shared the coit tower burrito and the wicked burger. The burrito was supposed to have tater tots in it and it didn't. When I asked I was told they were in there. Besides that, all of the wait staff was great and it's newly remodeled and clean. Great location to eat before seeing Hamilton it's really close. I wouldn't go back there just for the food but would consider going back if I was going to another show at the Orpheum.
author: Megan B.

description: Almost always come to Sam's Diner before a show at the Orpheum...saw Beauty in the Beast for a 2pm showing.  Was offered to wait 5 minutes for a booth or 3 counter seats that were available immediately.  Took the counter seats and it was quick and easy.  The food was delicious....S.F. Patty Melt (Angus Ground Chuck Patty On Toasted Rye Bread With Melted Provolone Cheese And Grilled Onions), Mojado Burritos (Served With House Cilantro Lime Rice, Cheese, Black Beans, Sour Cream And Pico De Gallo, Topped With Verde Sauce) and The Rock (Angus Chuck Patty With Bacon And Cheddar Cheese, Topped With Onion Rings And BBQ Sauce).  Everything was perfect and waitress was very attentive.  Would recommend this restaurant to all.  This is a long (two-sided) restaurant with narrow pathways so just be prepared to squeeze through to the bathrooms (two singles) when it is crowded.
author: Lisa E.

description:
We happened upon what we thought was a hole in the wall, and were so surprised.
The service was excellent - all the staff was hospitable and attentive, and the burgers were really some of the best in SF.    

We'll be going back again soon - they have fresh crab sandwiches with Pepper Jack and avacado !   It's crab season, so we won't wait too long.

Really a rare find close to the hip Twitter building, so you've got to deal with the street people, but it's definitely worth it once you get inside.    

Go for lunch, you'll be rewarded.   This is where you can't judge a book by its cover and your misgivings, if you have any, will be quickly overcome.
author: Whitney D.

description:
I'm giving three stars as an average of two very different visits. There was no wait to sit down on either trip as they were slightly off prime mealtimes:

The first visit had very well-prepared traditional diner food. It was served politely and quickly and the coffee mugs were never empty. It wasn't a mind-blowing experience, but a repeatable one. I'd say "four stars" on that. 

The second visit was the opposite: Overly-greasy food slapped together, no coffee top-offs, and having to get up and hunt the waitress down to find the check. If it weren't for the inexpensive price and quick seating, that second visit would've been a single star. I'll give it two.

Average those together and get three. I will give them another chance to see which of those experiences would be the more common.
author: Daniel G.

description: First time here. I came in because I saw many people inside. The food is horrible, worst breakfast in SF period. Staffs are rude. Coffee is tasteless. My advice : Do not eat here.
author: P S.

description: Sam's is a restaurant, masquerading as a diner.  What I mean by that is that the food is really delicious... and the setting has the comfort of home.  It's tucked away in a hidden location, right on Market Street, fifty feet from BART/Muni.  I had little optimism when I settled on it, looking for something to eat before the theater in a veritable ghost town of restaurants, but boy was I pleasantly surprised!  We sat at the bar (counter), ordered diner fare, and beers, and had a friendly chat with the bartender (who may have been the owner, based only on how much she attended to us).  Everything came hot off the grill, and fresh and clean tasting.  I am not one for TV's while dining, but this is the place for it.  The game was on, and there was a good buzz of conversation.  It's a gem of a place with that hometown diner friendliness and comfort food charm.  Great for before or after the theater, or a quick beer for intermission (without having to get a second mortgage).  By the way, this is a great place for kids (chicken "fingers", milkshakes, fries)
author: James G.

description: SAM's is easily accessible on Market street. It's a small-ish kind of diner but food is okay. Also, if you're dining there with a few people, make sure that everyone's there, otherwise they won't give you a table. Or at least that's what they said. I really liked their fish tacos. It was kind of odd that they served it with a scoop of cilantro rice, which I really liked, but it was hecka good. Ordered it with hot sauce on the side (which I never touched). The thing that I did not like though was the service... Or should I say the server. She was not attentive at all, she seemed distracted. It was just an odd experience. Her service was very poor. Will probably not visit again but I definitely recommend the tacos and the patty melt to anyone who will visit.
author: Leah Anne B.

description: We ate breakfast here. Delicious omelettes, French toast and the best fruit salad I've had in ages. Definite must do for the happy tourist!
author: Jude Q.

description: Had the deluxe French toast with sausage patties, staff was very friendly and helpful. Very small and tight spaces. Food was delicious :)
author: Andrew K.

description: Pre-Hamilton dinner.  Pleasantly surprised.  The outside of the diner is a bit deceiving; you think it's a dive diner.  But you step in and it's a nice decent place to grab a bite before the show.  After being told there would be a 20 min wait for a table counter space opened up and we sat down.  Our order was taken right away and food came out soon after.  The Famous Korean Tacos (with beef) were the best.  The meatloaf was really good too.  Definitely good place to go before the show.  Will be back.
author: Bee N.

description: Everytime I make this run from PA I must stop here. Very welcoming and the food is great. Just a short walk from BGCA.
author: Adam A.

description: Food is decent. Personally I think the food was a bit highly priced for what you get. Very convenient if you are staying at Hotel Whitcomb. Coffee was better the last time we were here but no worries there's a Starbucks right across the street next to the hotel. This place is pretty average but they have a good variety of food.
author: Kandace W.

description: Waiter recommend famous korean tacos, it was horrible food wasted my time and money, the glass water was good
author: Xiomara C.

description:
I was wandering up Market on the way to the office when I had that 'my stomach wanted breakfast three hours ago' feeling.  I looked up, and there was Sam's Diner.

I was seated at the (full) bar, which was odd for a diner, and my waitress was super friendly and didn't charge extra to give me coffee in a to-go cup.  The breakfast menu was interesting, but as soon as I saw the shrimp omelette with tater tots, the deal was sealed.

The omelette took a while but the bar was a nice place to wait and watch the morning news over coffee, and when the food came out, it was a huge portion.  I think I might have actually waddled out of there afterwards.

I'm not sure if I'd come here during PM bar hours, since the Tenderloin can be pretty sketchy then, but when I'm on AM diner patrol, Sam is a target of extreme interest.
author: David S.

description:
Before seeing The Lion King we decided in advance we were going to check out SAM's. I wanted to go there because of the pastrami sandwich they had on there menu. We had to wait a bit because the place was pretty packed but the wait went by fairly quickly. Once we were seated we had to wait a little longer then I wanted, to be noticed. Once we were noticed though the waiter was extremely friendly and explained that the wait was long because the place is getting packed. 

The menu is small and it plays into The Lion King theme which is cool. I didn't see my pastrami sandwich on it and was starting to panic. But once I asked the waiter about it he said that they can fire one up for me. Awesome. Food came out in reasonable time. I have to say though it was not what I was expecting. I was expecting a nice big sandwich with pastrami piled in it. Instead it was a grilled cheese with pastrami. Not bad but definitely not the best. It also did not come with a side of pickles like the menu I read earlier said. The Coleslaw was very good though. Made with vinegar and not mayonnaise. I loved it. I would try this place again, but in no rush to come back.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I have walked by Sam's countless times and I finally decided to go inside and eat.  I was pleasantly greeted and then taken to a booth which then I ordered a iced tea and given the menu.  I decided on the club sandwich with fries.  My food came in about 10 minutes and was perfect.  Hot and crispy fries and the club was superb.  The menu is pretty standard with a few exotic touches.  Place was very clean (bathrooms) as well.  I had a hard time leaving because my waitress was so beautiful.  I had my tea refilled just so I could see her a little bit longer.  Highly recommended.
author: Robert H.

description: Great diner on market street! Clean and welcoming with great breakfast selection and huge serving sizes. Omelettes were delicious as were the pancakes. Staff friendly and helpful. Nice diner to go to when the grime of market street gets to much.
author: Mollie M.

description:
Excitingly below average.  

It's one of those places that just doesn't seem quite clean.  I mean they could scour the whole place for a week, and maybe they do, but still it has an old musty, embedded grime feel to it.  You know what I mean?  You've been in those places, haven't you?  (Tracy is full of them--but this wasn't Tracy).  The place seriously needs to be spiffed up, and as expensive as that may be to do I don't think they have a clue how much money they are loosing because of this grime factor.  You see how many people are walking by outside?  Why are so few stopping here when the food carts in Civic Center a block away have long lines?  There's a reason.  Take a look around.  Sorry--don't mean to be harsh.  Tough love.

The staff seemed friendly enough but you could tell they would rather be somewhere else.  Dang, I am getting depressed just writing this--and I promised myself I wouldn't!

But what about the food, you ask?  Well, I had an omelet.  Denver, to be exact.  Not sure what kind of cheese was it it but it was gross.  I think it was American which is a TERRIBLE choice for a default cheese.  It's not even cheese.  I suggest you have the waiter/tress ask people what kind of cheese they want in their omelet.  Admittedly my-bad for not speaking up and saying what kind of cheese I wanted but seriously, the server should ask.  Cheese is a very personal thing!  

So, overall it was okay but next time I am in the area and need to grab a bite for breakfast I think the Burger King next door will likely get my attention first.  Jeeze.  I can't believe I just said that.
author: John K.

description: We discovered this place through Yelp when looking for a place to eat before going to a show at the Orpheum.  Perfect location - we had a great time.  This is a diner the way they used to be - good comfort food, friendly service and frequented by a wide range of people, families, couples, etc..  Fun, tasty and ever so convenient.  We'll be back.
author: Karne N.

description: I didn't eat here as we already had dinner. We were staying at the hotel across the street and wanted to grab a couple of beers at a convenient location. To my surprise, this place was open late and served beer. They had a pretty good selection at decent prices. The server was friendly and attentive. I have to travel to SF for work twice a year and will make sure to return here.
author: Toni W.

description:
If you are going to a show at the Orpheum, you probably already know that your eating options are limited around there, but Sam's Diner has got you covered. 

They recently renovated to help attract the theater crowd (nice photos of SF and old playbook posters) and even feature a special theater menu (our menu was themed for the musical Lion King which included things like the Mufasa Burger and Simba's  Breakfast "Cub" Sandwich). I am always a sucker for special menus with special prices, and if you tell them you are going to the show, you actually get 10% off of your meal you get there too. Pretty good deal. 

Plus they have a beer and wine license now (so yes that means the bloody mary on their cocktail list is not made with vodka, so beware!). $4.50 for most beers on tap is pretty good, but $4 for a PBR in a bottle? That is kind of nuts, even for SF prices. 

Food wise, we were all pretty happy with our dishes--I got their crab melt which was toasted pretty much perfectly and had an ample amount of avocado in it too which was the really reason I ordered it (I may have a clinical obsession for things with avocado ha). Adam G. got their honey fried chicken which was pretty darn tasty and very moist inside, but I have to say the coleslaw and the potatoes were just so so. My dad got the steak and minus a few pieces of fat on it he had to eat around, he was pretty content indeed. And my mom got the lion named burger and it was pretty big, almost like a lion. We ended with the chocolate molten cake which also was good, but we all sort of felt like have we had better diner food elsewhere? Sure. But can you get much better than this being a block from the theater? Probably not. Although there is a burger king next door if that is your thing :-)
author: Sarah G.

description: I had to wait quite a while to get seated even though there were open tables, the hostess just ignored me. Once seated, service was slow and the waitress was surly.  The food was ok.
author: M. P.

description:
Visited on a Monday morning with 2 buddies. Chose this place because it was across the street from our hotel and also b/c my buddy's son is named Sam, so seemed perfect. It wasn't.
Huevos rancheros: not horrible, but not that good. I definitely could've made these better on my own.
No hot chocolate
