My friends got a couple of other things and they weren't impressed.
Also, I didn't like our server. He sucked too
author: Corey L.

description:
Pretty good meal - I had the famous Korean tacos with beef.

3 soft corn tacos with beef and a side of lime rice - I really enjoyed the meal. It was a bit of a wait. PRO TIP - get to the restaurant around 6 pm if you're headed there on a Saturday night. The crowd seems to all rush in around 6:30 or 6:45 pm.

It's not the best neighborhood, which is the downside (and it's kind of awkward to stand in the small corridor inside the restaurant) but the food is good. A good ol' American diner. Staff is friendly and patient (at least it was the night we went).

Great pre-Orpheum spot to eat.
author: Jen B.

description: Great service and I loved the posters filled with signatures that spanned across the room. However, I got the Lil' Mama burger and I had the worst (up all nigh, vomiting twice) reaction. My fiance got the The Giant and was perfectly fine. However, I am tempted to ban burgers from life for a little while... well, maybe.
author: Catherine W.

description: If you are like me and need to start the day with breakfast then this is the place for you. Sam's is conveniently located, has a great menu at reasonable prices and I really enjoyed their corned beef. The service by Douglas was excellent and the autographed posters on the walls of past San Francisco shows were pretty cool!
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
I have been going to Sam's for a while now, and have eaten a few items off of the breakfast menu.

Hash browns are solid, but the corn beef hash is from a can, which is kinda sad, but not totally unacceptable. Pancakes are good, but pedestrian.

The main reason for 3 stars, and not 4, is because they changed their menu, and removed the thing that I ordered most often (and didn't replace it...) which is the breakfast sandwich. Unacceptable for a diner to not have a (normal) breakfast sandwich. I haven't seen the new menu, so I don't know what to think of that, but a lady told me on the phone that they now have a breakfast club, but I stopped her after turkey and tomatoes. Booooo

If you want to achieve a more unique or specialized menu, that's okay. But it better not include canned corn beef hash. If this has also changed I will update.

Other than that, the service is usually good and friendly, and the coffee is decent.
author: Fletcher G.

description: Good food. Perfect place to stop and grab a bit of you are catching a show. Service was fast and friendly waiters.
author: Sherell G.

description:
Affordable hidden gem! Friendly service, homemade food. Loved the quinoa soup!
The other menu items looked great too - daily specials and a different soup every day.
author: Sarah G.

description:
GREAT DINER in the up and coming Mid-Market area!  Great menu and usually great service!  Can get busy and slow things down, but for the most part very reliable and a good value for the money.  Good burgers, good sandwiches, aw wait a minute, this could take all day!  Lets just say in all of several meals here (breakfast & dinner) I was only disappointed once and that was the fried chicken as it must have been the smallest chicken I'd ever seen and eaten. = (     Every other meal has been good and a fair deal!  Love the sticky zipper IPA they serve on draft from across the bay, a good local craft brew (they have other beers as well).
The chocolate cake dessert kicks ass!!!
You will likely hear many European accents as you dine here thanks to the Hotel Whitcomb across the street.
CHEERS!
author: Sean M.

description: Breakfasts large enough to split and attentive service. With the hotel across the street, we came here for breakfast nearly every other day.
author: Cherine F.

description: *sigh*.  I've tried this place twice and REALLY want to write a better review but it is, both visits, at best mediocre. The food is good, no doubt about that.  Atmosphere is anemic...not interesting at all for a diner.   Seems lost between an upscale restaurant and an old greasy spoon.  It is the service, though, that really brings the experience down.  Their lack of confidence, inability to please despite their attempt to do just that, makes you realize how awkward it all is.  Add to that the one waiter who should have taken a break because he was cursing a blue streak, dropping so much profanity at full volume that the entire restaurant could hear.
author: Bea E.

description:
We ate here before going to the Orpheum to see Phantom of the Opera. If you plan to eat here before seeing a play, arrive by 6:00. Any later and it starts to get very crowded. We arrived at 6:30 and waited 20 minutes for our table. (They only take reservations for parties of 5 or more). We figured out what we wanted to order while we waited, so once we were seated we could order. We were impressed at how quickly our food came out. We asked for the check once the food came and paid it while we ate so that we weren't late for our show. (Note: The Orpheum is across the street)
The food was delicious, and the staff was very nice and hard working. I had the vegan burger and really liked it (lots of onions and no condiments other than ketchup, so heads up if you like more than ketchup). My husband got the meatloaf and I tried it--it was VERY good. My parents split the Reuben and the Phantom Burger and they really liked them too. And their fries are yummy. 

Whether we see another show or are just in that area for fun, we will definitely be back to eat here.
author: Ashlee P.

description: Oh SAM's! This is my husband and I's go to place when we are enjoying a night at the theater. The server there knows our face since we always go in before going to a show. The food is good! They usually have a special menu with themed food items based on whatever musical is playing at the theater. They have a pretty good selection of beers that we usually indulge in too. The only real thing you have to keep in mind when coming to SAM's is that its not a huge place, so if you want to get a table and have plenty of time to eat and not have to run to your seats for the show (which we have had to do before), make sure you get there about an hour before the show starts. Enjoy!
author: Andy S.

description:
SAM's Diner apparently did NOT like me. 

So, we watched Motown the musical this past weekend, we heard that we can get discounts at SAM's if you showed them your ticket so we went there to celebrate my friend's birthday right after we watched the show. 

They sat us down fairly quickly, but I guess since there were so many guests from the show they only had 4 menus for our table of 6. 

It was about 5pm, but I really wanted an eggs benny. But, they only serve them until 3pm. Boo. So, I look at my menu and saw that they had a crab melt. I told my friends that I wanted to get that and they said that they didn't see it on their menu. I look at their menu to find that the crab melt was blacked out of their menus. UGH. 

Take 3. I saw that their french toast special was being served all day. So when the waiter comes I told him that I wanted their french toast special. He says "Normally we would serve breakfast all day, but we cannot make it today with the large increase of customers". Sooo, basically he told me that they didn't want to make it.

So, I went with a tuna melt. 

It took about 40 minutes before our food came out. WE WERE STARVING. My tuna melt was dry and the cheese wasn't even melty. The fries that came with them are shoestring fries and were cooked perfectly.

My friends ordered truffle fries as an appetizer. It never showed up, so we asked the waiter. He was honest and told us that he forgot to write it down and asked if we still wanted it. We said yes. 

It came in about 10 minutes. 

I might come back to try it again...maybe get a benny. I like to give places 2nd chances if there is potential. There definitely is potential in being very good. All the items on their menu sounded delicious. But, if the 2nd time sucks I probably will not come here every again.

He mentioned that he was on a 2 week vacation and this was his first weekend back. I don't know if that was an excuse or not, but... yeah... He wasn't very good.
author: Jackie d.

description: The outside looks like it would be a dive, so we've never went in. We were very hungry on Black Friday and decided to try it. Now I will never eat breakfast anywhere else in SF but here. Country Fried Steak, YUMMY!!!!
author: Andrew V.

description:
Reasonably priced food, fast service and great location are what makes Sam's diner a good place to go.  I ended up going with the Pesto Chicken Sandwich since the server recommended it.  The sandwich itself had grilled chicken breast, melted cheese, and sun dried tomatos on a toasted bun.  

While it was good, I couldn't help but kick myself for not ordering the Crab melt sandwich that a friend of mine ordered.  That sandwich was superior in taste to mine.

Side note:  They had some beautiful black and white photography on the walls!
author: Lorie N.

description: Definitely a great place for lunch or breakfast. Doesn't have the wow factor, but absolutely has good value
author: Anthony S.

description: Refreshingly old fashioned, no frills, diner. I've always had amazing service here. Their breakfast is delicious and reasonably priced. I also will stop in here every now and then for lunch. Their BLT is delicious and he fries (ask for extra crispy) are some of my favorite in the area.
author: Semuteh F.

description: I've been to Sam's to get some dinner before watching a show at the Orpheum theater just recently. I wasn't thrilled by the experience. The waitstaff is friendly and assertive, the food is a little uninspired and bland. I would probably still come here again before a show due to the convenient location, I wouldn't go out of my way to get here in any other case, though.
author: Bonzo M.

description:
I have eaten here a couple times now, & the first time was great, service was good & food was tasty... Typically I wait until I've actually given a place a few tries before writing a review as I like to have full experience etc.

Well unfortunately over the weekend, I was staying up in SF & decided to try here again for breakfast Sunday morning & well, I'll never eat at Sam's again. First off the service was terrible. I had to track actually flag the hostess for Coffee refills as my waitress   spent more time in back of the restaurant than paying attention to her customers. I ordered by breakfast Biscuits & Gravy with eggs & bacon & wanted Pancakes so the waitress told me I could substitute my Hash Browns with the Pancakes. I thought cool perfect do that then.

As I sat waiting for my meal I noticed that the music choice was quite a bit of gangster rap? odd music choice for a  restaurant, but eh, it is SF right?

MY order comes out & it looked amazing, tasted great at the time,  but I was still a bit frustrated that my waitress not one time checked on mew or refilled my coffee. The next time I saw her, she went scooting by and dropped my receipt off mid meal saying I think you'll need this and was gone before I could ask for more coffee. This was the last time I saw her, and upon finally finishing my meal saw that I had been charged for my regular meal & a short stack of pancakes, not been given a substitution (this was like an extra 8 bucks)  so I basically bought 2 breakfasts & didn't even get the hashed brows. I asked the hostess about it & of course my waitress was on break, and they couldn't adjust the charge so I paid figuring I was not going to be bringing my business back here until I spoke to a manager about this experience. (There was not one available & Since I work around the corner in 11th street I planned to stop by this week)  Needless to say, rather than let my blood boil or have an argument to start my day I paid my bill and left a small tip.

SO here it is Tuesday, & I'm home sick with what the Doctor believes in a Norovirus infection, I.E. Food poisoning. How do I know it was from Sam's? Basically I didn't stop and eat anywhere else that day, I was at a concert & did not feel like paying for over priced anything there.

Bad service + bad food + food poisoning = I'll never touch this place again which sucks after having such a great first experience. I have always had a rule about dining out & that is if it ever makes me ill, I never go back.
author: Zach O.

description: Always great food and service. I was able to order my loco Moco and boy was it great! This is a place to come to.
author: Ray Q.

description: I don't usually write reviews, but I thought I should after having the most disgusting Denver omelet ever here. The ham was cheap and prepackaged, the eggs are the kind that come premixed, and the cheese was either Kraft singles or some other sliced "cheese". Hash brown were equally as bad. The best thing about the whole meal was the wheat toast.
author: Dustin S.

description:
This small almost hole in the wall place was right across from our hotel and we had juuuust arrived in San Fran from LA and were STARVING!

Yelped it really quickly during check in and it had good reviews. 

Our waitress was super nice and attentive! It was brunch time so we of course had the mimosas. Thank you for serving more champagne than OJ, mmmm much needed for the vacay!

I had the San Francisco crab eggs Benedict and they were amazing! I ate up every last piece! 

So many delicious looking items on the menu and you can't go wrong with $5 mimosas! 

Def recommend if you're on Market Street.
author: Harlow H.

description: Thursday's Special - California Omelet veggie-style, with avocado, cheddar, country potatoes and sourdough toast. Yummy! Eat here!
author: Patricia A.

description: The first time I ate here last year, I had spicy Korean barbecue tacos which were amazing!!! Unfortunately, today I had the complete opposite experience. As soon as I sat down I asked about the lunch special. The waitress seemed a bit oblivious as to what the special was. When she asked the cook what the special was he kind of rudely replied it's not ready yet even though it was 15 minutes past when lunch began. I asked the waitress again because I was willing to wait for it, again the cook replied it's not ready yet! That's the minute I realized I should have left. I didn't listen to myself and stayed and order what has to be the worst chicken burrito known to mankind. The chicken was boiled and unseasoned the rice was undercooked and the beans were watery. I took three bites and decided that I was not going to eat that. I waited patiently for the waitress to swing by and asked me if everything was OK. That never happened. So I asked the other British waitress who was very friendly for the check. Finally my waitress showed up and I had to do you in headlights look when I told her that the meal was horrible. I just paid it and he left a tip but I will never be returning to Sam's Diner!!!!
author: Alex L.

description: I had the BLT with fries and my friend had a pancake stack. Both were equally delicious! Our soda tasted a bit like chlorine, though, and they already include "gratuity" in the bill. Way to confuse foreigners, for sure.
author: Maarten V.

description:
Most'est awesom'est and best'est tasting'est order of breakfast hash browns you'll find in San Francisco!  Good orange juice too!

I say this from the perspective of someone who orders hash browns with a side of eggs, instead of the the usual eggs listed first order.

A solid breakfast comfort meal is important.  Feeling comfortable while you are eating the food is also important.  Sam's get's it right all the way around and you'll never be rushed out the door.  

Free HD TV and Free WiFi to fill the short time waiting for your fresh food.  The service is good and the place is very clean and nice on the inside to round out an overall excellent experience.

I'm upping this review to the Best'est 5 stars for Sam's Diner!
author: Chris R.

description: Great burgers and Korean tacos.  Food came out fast but she was slow coming back but was very nice when she did. Nice casual atmosphere and interesting photos from the past.
author: Frankie M.

description: Had breakfast on a Monday. Fast service and courteous staff. Great breakfast selection and was really good. Eggs benedict was the best.
author: Trent C.

description:
Great food, staff was fantastic, nice menu with a lot of choices. Loved that we could have a sandwich to a pork loin. The special "Phantom of the Opera" menu was a great touch. The "Phantom of the Opera" burger was to die for. 
They sat our party of 6 immediately and we ordered, ate, had dessert and left in less than 90 min. 
Only negative I saw was that it's small, so make a reservation or go early.  This will be our go to place anytime we go to the Orpheum!
author: Jen S.

description:
We all know the average American cuisine is very fattening..
I specific asked my hash brown not be cooked with oil.. And they did anyway .. So the counter girl was pure friendly enough for me to give two stars. 
My breakfast price tag was 13$ without tips.
If you're hungry and don't mind those billions of empty calories, go back there again..
author: Pedro D.

description: Great place to stop at. We were watching a musical at the Orpheum and then walked out of the theater and to the right and there we were at Sam's. Casual ambiance and good american bites. Quick and friendly service too. I would definitely come back!
author: Charlotte G.

description:
So, let me first say that I am from the south and I kind of expect servers to go the extra mile when their livelihood, tips, are dependent on the perception of those they are serving. With that being said....
 The portions you will get at Sam's will make it worth the price for a burger with fries or even a turkey club with fries. My gripes are not at all with the portions or even with the quality of the food.  Our hotel was very close so we did eat there many times and found the issues to be a recurring theme. The first night, our waiter forgot what drinks we ordered. It took him about 20 minutes to come tell us he forgot what we ordered and asked us what our drinks were.
  The second time we went for dinner, the kitchen was 'backed up' with a large party and it took a really long time for us to get our food.
  Any time we went, we had to ask for refills. If we ever got them, they would bring the glass back to us but would not give us more ice.... So I get a topped off coke, with no ice? What? Are we in Europe? Their menu even says on it "bottomless refills". I would have liked for on just one of my visits for someone to have been proactive, saw my empty glass, and brought me my refill, without me having to ask them.
author: Corinne B.

description: Definitely would recommend this place to the world! I had the club sandwich and there homemade coleslaw it was amazing! Ambiance was great, service was great this place is great great great!
author: Brisa E.

description:
Four of us went to dinner together at Sam's Diner before a play at the Orpheum Theater, and I really can't stress how positive surprised we were with how great of a spot it was! We looked online for a reasonably priced place close to the theater. We had low expectations.

The host who sat us was extremely friendly to all the guests in the line, and he created a very welcoming environment. After taking a seat, we took a look at the beer menu, and I was really impressed that a little diner had such a great tap beer selection.

And onto the food ~ while it is a diner, the food is definitely a couple notches up from diner quality. My buddy had the korean tacos, and I had one of the three it came with, and they were delicious. I had the honey fried chicken, and that was quite good as well. My wife got the sliders, and those were also good.

All in all, food's good. Drink's are good. Service is good. Price is right.
author: Kevin H.

description:
SO glad I spotted this little diner out of the corner of my eye while walking down Market with the bf! Breakfast served all day WOO! Decided to take a chance since we were tired of everything else that came to mind and couldn't have been more satisfied. 

Service was great, employees are super friendly and attentive. We sat at the bar and the good came relatively fast considering they had another party of about 15 people. I ordered the applewood smoked bacon breakfast- came with 2 eggs, hash browns, and toast. The bf ordered steak and eggs- came with hash browns and toast too. We also got a side order of French toast. The food was BOMB.. Perfect portions, no complaints on anything! Super plus, the French toast was to die for!!

Definitely became my new go-to diner!
author: Alexandria M.

description:
C'mon, San Francisco! You need some better dining choices close to the theater. 

We can here based on the yelp reviews and were sorely disappointed in the food. 

We ordered the beer battered onion rings, mac and cheese, and Korean Spicy Pork Tacos. The onion rings were probably the best of the bunch. The Mac sauce was very runny and the tacos had some rubbery cheese. 

The staff were very friendly and helpful. They are the saving grace of this establishment.  The place was packed and they stayed cool under pressure. 

I'm sorry but I cannot recommend this place.
author: Stephanie D.

description: I'm going to give Sam's Diner 5 stars based on the experience I had last night before seeing Matilda. Bart was running a little behind, and so was my guest and I, so we arrived at the theatre at 7:15 but were starving and thirsty for a beer. We saw the diner and decided to try our luck. The first thing they asked was "are you seeing the show tonight?" When we said yes, they seated us at the bar and took our drink orders right away. We ordered a sandwich and fries and saw that our order was put as priority. We got our food in about 10 mins and made it to the show on time! Not only were the waiters/servers extremely nice, the food was delicious and they have a themed specials menu for every show at the Orpheum!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I used to be a breakfast regular here before I moved. If you stop by in the morning, be sure to ask for Katie, Daniella, or Theresa to be your server. These girls are the sweetest servers on the planet.

The breakfast is very reasonably priced. The pork chop breakfast is fantastic as well as their simple breakfast parfait if you're looking for something lighter. At happy hour, this place has the best prices as well as some awesome food.
author: Darita S.

description: (Long overdue review):  We ate dinner there with a friend on September 14, as it was conveniently located near the Asian Art Museum.  My husband had the fish filet tacos ($10) and I had the Mediterranean plate ($9).  I can't remember what our friend ordered - but anyway, the food was very tasty and our server was pleasant.
author: Susan L.

description:
Was in frisco for a wedding and we were all hungry and had no idea where to eat. Glad we found this place!

Good food!!! Great service. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone in frisco. The burrito i had was delicious!
author: Erica A.

description: After San Francisco Pride, we were starving and spied Sam's right away.  We had to wait just a few minutes to get in but were excited about some good, comforting, diner food after a long day.  I got the fried chicken and my partner got the Sam's Chuck Three burger.  The burger was the bomb.  The fried chicken was fried and hot but didn't have much taste to it.  I traded a thigh for half of the burger with cheese, mushrooms and lots of sliced avocado.  By the time we left, we were miserable.  We couldn't finish it all.  Oh, and we started with the beer battered onion rings.  They were ok.  Not stellar but we were so hungry that we needed something to start with.  Service is fast and friendly.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I've been housesitting in one of those big tower gated communities they're building all over downtown and came over to Market street looking for breakfast.  Given it's location, right in the midst of the at times sketchy Civic Center, I was at first apprehensive about Sams.  My hesitation was completely unnecessary as I stepped into this warm. welcoming place.    

I was seated at a full sized table, even though I was dining by myself.  The server arrived promptly, told me her name, and happily answered questions.  My food arrived quickly and was good! The best part?  TATER TOTS!

Great spot...don't let the location put you off.
author: Unemployed D.

description:
Good food, good prices and convenient location off of market

Glad the managers care about service and work to make it better!

Free wifi!!

Always love everything I order
author: Zoe D.

description:
One of my favorite place's while I was in art school!! (Ai is only a couple steps away.) Seriously after a long commute on Bart and still have time before an 8:30am class? Getting breakfast a Sam's Diner is the best. Every time I ate here with my fellow classmates I'd be in a good mood the entire morning. After having French Toast?! Right?!

Awesome & Love it!!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Had an amazing burger here yesterday! Their plain half-pound chuck burger at a very reasonable $10.5 incl. fries is just amazing, cooked perfectly medium and still pink in the middle. Had to resist the urge to order another one since it was just so delicious. Service is super quick and efficient too, ambiance is classic diner style. Will definitely be back next time I'm craving a burger.
author: Noa E.

description:
Great coffee!  Really good. Better than I was expecting.  

Excellent service from Doug and the other floor staff. Efficient and friendly. 

Typical California diner menu but well executed and priced well. Good variety.

Higher recommended.
author: Kevin K.

description: My daughter really enjoyed her very large steak burrito and I totally Loved my blackened fish taco!  We will return :)
author: Brandi J.

description:
Service was good. 
They had hell or high watermelon beer of which I had many. 
Food was alright. Aioli was delicious but why was the bun on my sandwich so greasy. I was buzzed, it's a diner and it definitely soaked up the beer.
author: Ryan C.

description: Great alternative for a good breakfast outside of the hotel.   Service was amazing and the portions are huge!
author: Leslie W.

description: I have to give props to this place, it looks like a little hole in the wall but is trendy and clean on the inside. My son and I went to see a show at the Orpheum last night and for those of you who know, there aren't a whole lot of dining options around that theater. So - the easy stuff, place was clean, food smelled and looked awesome on everyone's plate as we walked in...so yeah, it's all good but 5 star worthy? Here's the 5 Star - LOVE this place - I have recently gone Paleo (or kind of Paleo without giving up alcohol). The waiter was knowledgeable and totally worked around my ridiculous requests, and it all turned out great and yummy....5 stars for that extra effort!!
author: Leane M.

description:
I've been here first time in my life. 
We needed a meeting place in the neighbourhood which is open late at night and also offers a bigger variety of food as all of us have different tastes (vegetarians, burger eaters, fish lovers). 
The food was great and the servers were really friendly.
author: Johanna B.

description:
The burgers are not bad and the meat is usually cooked very well. The Korean Tacos here are good too. But there definitely are better taco places. So do not come here if you are specifically looking for tacos. 

Basically this place is a good choice if you want to get a late dinner on Market street as it is open till 11:00. Service can be a little slow at times.
author: Shringar P.

description: Great breakfast. Great service. Would definitely come here again. Great place for tourists to come and enjoy great food. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Owner super nice as well
author: Diana L.

description:
Unfortunately the food here was really bad. If my friends and I hadn't been so hungry (we were stuck waiting three hours for the Pride parade to begin so that our contingent could march) we would have sent our food back and tried again elsewhere.

The beer battered onion rings were very obviously from some big corporation's freezer line, which would have been forgiveable if they weren't totally soggy as well. Same with the fries.

My friend's NINE dollar plain veggie burrito (are you kidding me???) was mostly bland rice and beans, and another friend found her party melt inedible. She left most of it uneaten, even though she was the hungriest out of all of us. My tuna melt was so-so, edible mostly because I was hungry, but at $11 it was three dollars over priced.

Normally this kind of mediocre food would get two stars from me, but not when we had to wait thirty minutes to be seated and not at the ridic prices.
author: James L.

description: What first attracted me to this place was a their sidewalk sign that had a drawing of Bob from Bobs Burger. Which happened to be one of my favorite shows. My boyfriend and I waited in line for a little bit to be seated, and the wait was totally worth it once we eat their delicious food! Will be returning sometime soon!
author: Ana C.

description:
Wandering down Market Street and remembered I hadn't had breakfast. Got the Yelp app out and to my delight, Sam's diner was literally across the road from me and had a decent star rating, so popped in for a look, and a brunch.

Looked a bit shabby and the decor is not the best but after being offered a seat at the counter I actually felt really comfortable and liked the place - managed to catch a bit of the Cowboys game there while I waited too. 

Coffee was quick to appear, top ups were prompt and really plentiful. I opted for Sam's Deluxe - a ridiculous blend of french bread covered in icing sugar and maple syrup and a separate plate with 2 eggs and crispy bacon. I use the word 'ridiculous' to mean 'absolutely incredible' in this instance!!

The bacon was perfectly done, the eggs were sublime and how I managed to get 4 slices of French toast, 5 rashers of bacon, 2 fried eggs, 3 cups of coffee and some iced water into me and still move, I have no idea.

What I do know is that this fueled me on a 6 hour walk around the city!
This is a really unassuming place that I'd love to go back to.
author: Elliot A.

description:
Going to keep this short and sweet.
I'm visiting San Fran for a vacation and it was about 10:30 pm and my wife and I were starving. Did a quick search to see what was close by and Sam's diner was only a few minutes walk away.  Decided to try it.

We showed up 20 minutes before closing (11pm closing) and was greeted by an extremely friendly waiter (and i am thinking the manager as well).  I think his name was Jacob (spelled slightly differently). I was shocked at how friendly he was seeing we were coming in wtih only 20 minutes until closing. We ordered quickly, and ate quickly knowing they were closing very soon.  But the entire time Jacob was awesome.

The food was great too. I had the Loco Moco and my wife had the Beef Dip.  Both items were pretty good!

If I lived here, I would definitely frequent this place.

4/5 for food
10/5 for service
author: Nick L.

description: As far as diners go, this place is solid and good.
author: Monica S.

description:
most items are not bad. This is my fourth time.

This time I had their pulled pork hot sandwich.

It is not pulled pork, but probably a pork roast that was cut up in cubes and then pan fried and put on top of a hamburger bun them cole slaw on top of it.  If I had know the cole slaw was on top of it, I would not have ordered it as a side dish and the server never said anything.
author: D L.

description:
You won't find much better in this 'hood without spending a lot more or getting pretentious. And Sam's is the hardest-working little diner in town. 

I have to admit I've never remembered to see if they have an accessible bathroom. I should do that. The restaurant itself is tight and narrow, but they've always found room for my wheelchair (and sometimes another one besides mine). 

The service is speedy, hard-working as heck, and they're all just darned nice folks. If sometimes the kitchen gets a little backed up during rush hours, you certainly won't see anybody idle around the shop. 

The diner staples are tasty good stuff, and the Korean smells really, really good. I seem to mostly come here for breakfast-ish, and I can't face spicy food for breakfast, so I haven't really tried the Asian stuff as often. But I can reliably get a tasty omelet that isn't a puddle of grease at a good price. The pastrami was surprisingly tasty stuff. Good sandwiches, good burgers, good basic diner food.

If you're looking for after-event food, especially something that's affordable or kid-safe, I totally recommend this place. If you're just in the neighborhood, be aware that they get swamped when the Orpheum lets out and maybe eat some other hour. If you work around here, come on by for lunch some time. (No, don't ask for a Twitter discount. I know what you Twitterpates get paid.) Free wi-fi and big tables if you gotta work. IN a hotel nearby? Sam's breakfast is probably cheaper AND better than theirs, if they offer one.

The real hidden gem: their beer taps. They've stocking all US microbrews, with a few concessions for the tourists, and of course they have Anchor Steam like they oughta. Want a relatively quiet place to watch the game? Order some beer and appetizers and watch the TV.

And you've got to give them credit for trying so hard. They may be the cleanest restaurant on Mid-Market, and some of the best service. Every time I come here it seems they've made another small improvement to the building, the menu, the kitchen. They're a scrappy little local business working their butts off to be successful, and I just want to hug the whole restaurant.
author: Anne K.

description: Ordered a French dip, got a tuna melt. The tuna melt was passable. The waitress also filled my glass of water to the brim, making it hard to pickup to drink. The decor was unremarkable. It's just your average drab diner servicing the weekend drunk...possibly served by the drunk.
author: Barnabas F.

description:
We stayed at the Whitcomb Hotel across the street and our doorman recommended this place. I liked it because it was right across the street from our hotel. 

The place did not disappoint. Casual atmosphere and servers that were attentive and friendly. We had breakfast and dinner there twice during our week. The breakfast was big and hearty. It was the breakfast burrito that they are famous for. It was really flavorful, and not loaded with a lot of potatoes like some places do. 

The high point, was the dinner I had the Korean tacos. These things were delicious. I am not a food snob, but i actually stopped the waiter to tell them how good they were. Perfect amount of spice and flavor. You get 3 to an order and each bite was delicious. 

So glad our doorman recommend this place, it was fabulous. While we ate at other places during the week, this was an amazing food stop to kick off the early part of our week.
author: Mark D.

description:
Was going to an exhibit near by and stopped by Sams for lunch/breakfast. No wait - got a booth quickly. The hostess (owner?) was very friendly and I will say that I noticed all the staff was very friendly as well. My order came out wrong initially, they noticed quickly and fixed the order (and gave me some fresh fruit while I waited). I found Sams service to be excellent. Quick on the refills etc. 

Food: 

GF got the Korean beef tacos and absolutely loved them. Says Her Coffee was strong, fresh and tasty (ie didn't seem like cheap stuff)
I had the veggie delight omelette with country potatoes... it was good but a tad greasy for my tastes... perhaps this was a one time anomaly since I noted other reviews saying the exact opposite. Iced tea was really good.

Overall it was tasty & fast and I would definitely go back if in the area again.

A strong 4 to 4.5 stars...
author: Mike B.

description:
I adore this place. The prices are good and the food is great. The wait staff though, is AWESOME.

Try the HUGE breakfasts here, free wifi for planning your day and a chit chat with the waiters. Everyone is so accommodating. 

I only wish we lived closer, it would be my regular "non greasy" spoon, easy...even if it was just to have a cool place to go, have a nosh and enjoy an hour of your day.
author: Blume S.

description: Tenderloin location. Watermelon beer. Faint aftertaste of watermelon in light beer. First time where you could actually taste the terroir of the fruit in the beer.  Good burgers. House ground chuck gives you a "beef" flavor unlike the standard frrozen patty. Tried the burgers and salmon. Salmon portion size was 6-8oz cooked. larger than normal. Salmon ~15 entree. Dangerous area at night. Be careful. Wouldn't  go out of my way to eat here b/c of the number of homeless in the area.
author: Doug C.

description: I stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb across the street. Thanks to Yelp reviews I tried Sam's instead of the restaurant in the hotel. I had the pork tacos. Delicious. And a lot of food. I highly recommend this little hole in the wall for a quick casual meal.
author: Donna F.

description:
It was past 10:00PM and the closest healthiest choice by my hotel seemed to be Sam's Diner so I thought I'd check it out. I had the chicken teriyaki that included coleslaw, white rice and side salad, kinda weird combo for a teriyaki dish if you ask me.

This was the most uneventful meal ever, but I really didn't expect it to be anything special even though the fancy schmancy menu gave that impression. This snore of a meal was $10 which was not worth it but it was edible.

I did though have a very chatty and friendly waiter and he did his job very well, which made my evening more enjoyable as I finished up the meal with some hot tea. He definitely went out of his way to make our time there enjoyable and seemed to be working hard taking care of his customers. Good job waiter dude!
author: V W.

description: I eat lunch here everyday. The service is hit or miss depending on which waitress you get. Pulled pork is killer.  Not cheap.
author: Jenn P.

description:
Grabbed a burger and some fries here and they weren't anything special.

Then again it's hard to totally destroy garlic fries so if you're in the area and looking for standard American diner fare, stop on in.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Sam's Diner is everything a good neighborhood diner should be: affordable, comfortable, clean, great food, great service, open for a good part of the day, and did I mention great food? 

I've lived in the neighborhood for almost three years and finally decided to give Sam's a try this past New Year's day.  The ham and cheese omelette I ordered was PHENOMENAL. A thick layer of cheesy ham and egg goodness. This was accompanied by a sea of crispy hash browns.  Everything about this meal was spot on.  My only disappointment was that I hadn't made a visit sooner.  

This place is top notch!
author: Javier M.

description:
Been here twice before and both times before a show at the Orpheum. First time was good 2nd time was great! Ok, so we had to wait about 15 or so minutes, but we were there about an hour before the show started. The wait staff and manager were polite, friendly and funny. 
The manager was constantly reassuring everyone that they would make it to the show on time. He kept the traffic flowing. He was cleaning and seating in a timely manner. And all was a smile!!
Our waiter, Caleb, took our order before we sat down (or I should say as they were cleaning our table/counter space) so we could make sure we had time to eat and get to the show. He was adorable, friendly and sassy- made our time there super fun!!
The other wait staff was just as great, we didn't catch their names, but we enjoyed sam's diner and will definitely go back, even on a none show time!!  Thanks guys!!
author: Sara J.

description:
I came here after an event at the Orpheum last week. 

The menu is ambitious, it's mostly delicious diner food and some extra gourmet things worked in. The owner is a DARLING and great to chat with about anything from news to current events. Everyone here is working their butt off. There were two cooks who never stopped flying through the orders.

I ordered the Korean tacos and they were very tasty, I'd get them again. Oh, they were definitely spicy, but I like that.

I ordered the calamari, it was tasty, but too chewy. The sauce and breading was good, but the toughness was a touch annoying. This is where the 5th star was lost. I'm going to try other things when I go back, but I think I'll order this again to see if it works out better. 

My fiance ordered pancakes and sausage and was mega happy.

Overall, fun place, good food, will look forward to the next visit.
author: margaret c.

description: Great food and service, definitely be back. We had the meat loaf and baptized chicken.
author: Dwayne T.

description:
I come here probably once a month. My second to last visit was not so good. 

As I was ordering my lunch, i was speaking to the waiter but also pointing at the menu. I ask for a Cesar salad (while pointing at a Chicken Cesar Salad)  with a side of the appetizer ,chicken wings. When my food came (Salad first), i said to myself ''Wow the Cesar salad comes with chicken, that's PERFECT!!!!'' After I ate half of the salad, my chicken than came out. I bit into the chicken and guess what i seen?? BLOOD! YUCK!!!!!!!! I told the waiter and he took it back to have them remake it. About 10min later he came with the chicken. I bit into the chicken and guess what i found again BLOOD!!! YUCK #2. I inform the waiter once again the the chicken still had blood inside. He took the chicken and had the cook remake the chicken for a 3rd time. About 10min later the chicken came out. I bit into the chicken and guess what i found?? YUP your right BLOOD again!!!!!! after that i gave up, i just asked for the bill and i don't want the chicken anymore. 


When my bill came, i was a bit confused being that i swore i order a Cesar salad. Well apparently i was pointing at the Chicken Cesar Salad so he thought that was what I wanted. How did you assume that?? bad CUSTOMER SERVICE. 

What you should have said instead of taking matters in your own hand was ''Ma'm your asking for a Cesar salad but, you pointing at a Chicken Cesar Salad, which would you prefer?? Adding chickening is $4 extra is that OK???!!!

Other than that they are ok!

3 stars- For that bad experience. 
if i didn't have that, it will be a 4
author: Kristell B.

description:
We all had The Hangover omelette - super spicy- yum!
But the service was awful...
author: Tracy G.

description:
2.5 stars

I went here when I was pretty hungry before a concert for a quick bite to eat. 

I ordered the famous Korean tacos. To be honest it was an American diner and I had no idea what I was expecting. I even overheard the waiter say to a customer: "this is Kimchi, what do you think?"

The fact that that had to be asked made me concerned. The staff is friendly but the tacos were meh. 

I love fish but the fish in the tacos were just okay. They didn't have too much flavored and they were not battered well. The tacos were sizable but everything just broke on me. In the end I just ate them with a fork. 

Overall, the tacos were just meh. For $10! Perhaps if I tried their breakfast food my review may be swayed.
author: Anh T.

description: Katie was our server, and she was such a delight. I was having a bad day, walked in to get a beer, and her smile just brightened my day. Great customer service; I forgot I had a bad day. Definitely coming back.
author: Omar J.

description:
I go here so often when I'm in the city. The cook is so nice, and so are the rest of the staff. My favorite dishes are the Korean Tacos -- to die for!!! The BLT -- I loves me a simple, delicious sandwich, and the scrambled eggs with ham, country potatoes and wheat toast. 

I always feel very comfortable here, sitting by the bar, sipping my coffee, reading a book, watching the news, or chatting with the staff. They are very fast, food comes out in no time and they are pretty attentive to whatever I might need. 

Sometimes they create a special menu to celebrate which ever show is showing at the Curran Theatre. They also have free wi-fi!! Just ask for the password.
author: Ezekiel G.

description: The staff was very very nice, food was very good, they were frequently checking up on us to see if we needed anything. Was a bit crowded. Was conveniently located by our hotel
author: Hatem A.

description: Traditional diner. Food is very good and service is quite nice as well. Never had to ask for a water refill myself.
author: Anthony G.

description: The chicken in my pesto penne was undercooked. The pasta itself was cooked well, sauce a little bland. The dinner role was really good. We ate at the bar, day immediately and was served quickly. The apple pie is fantastic!!
author: Jessica D.

description:
2.5 stars. I echo what a majority of the reviewers here are already saying--the service is loads better than the food.

The food... Well, they try. They really do. It's your regular American diner fare. Jimmy Dean-like breakfast sausages. Slight overdone bacon. Bland hash. Pillsbury-like biscuit. I could make this at home except I paid $13 for it.

They've recently renovated so the interior is clean and modern. I LOVE how they are incredibly transparent with why on their menu: "Well, Twitter and Dolby just moved in so I guess we have to cater to their tastes."

God bless them.
author: Linda T.

description: loved it.  It is becoming known in the theatre community so get there early if you have a play to attend.  Lots of great diner and healthier and all day breakfast foods.
author: Lee M.

description:
We went to Sam's Diner last night before a 6:30 performance of the Lion King at the Orpheum.  There were six of us; 3 children and 3 adults (one senior).  I highly recommend a reservation if you are planning to catch a show.  The restaurant is busting at the seams before and after the shows.  That being said, the location can't be beat in terms of proximity to the Orpheum and Civic Center BART station.

The service was very good.  The whole staff was working hard to keep things moving and get people to the show on time.  The food was fairy good.  Great menu for us, since we had a diversity of age groups and food preferences.  I will definitely go back again when in the neighborhood.
author: Christina B.

description:
***SERVICE BETTER THAN FOOD QUALITY***

I came here on a Wednesday morning for a quick breakfast around 8a. 

I was greeted and given coffee immediately.  Win. I ordered Eggs Benedict, tomatoes instead of ham. 

The viscosity of the hollandaise sauce was off. It was runny. The English muffins were not properly toasted. The eggs were poached the way I like.

The hashbrowns which came with the dish were asi asi. 

The server gave me rye instead of wheat toast but she did not charge me for it so I cannot complain. 

I ventured into this place because I could not find much else in the area. The food and coffee quality was average at best but the service was great. 

There is WiFi available here but it was very slow when I used it.
author: Ravi M.

description: The patty melt was very good. Menu had a variety of dishes.  Great place to dine before going to the Theatre. Service was good also, very attentive.
author: Linda F.

description: We were looking for a place to eat after a show.  It's a great place to eat.  Our waiter, David, was friendly and efficient.
author: Debbie G.

description: I used to be a regular at this place as the food is decent. Not any more though after today's experience. I walk in at 7am, the place is pretty empty and I ask for a table for one. A gentleman points me to the bar counter, to which I say "I'd rather sit at a table please". He's said the tables are for more than one customer (again, the place is empty!). Well done, you've just lost my business with this appalling customer service.
author: Maciej W.

description: The service was great even though the restaurant was packed. I got the Denver omelette and it was so good, possibly the best one ive had. Its a very cool environment with all the play posters from local plays.
author: Hanna P.

description: I love this place, but why so expensive?  It's $6 to get a chicken breast added to your $8 salad....  that makes no sense.  All of their prices are super inflated.  The food is really good, but not THAT good
author: Daniel H.

description: Just ate here for the first time tonight. Ok diner on a not so great block of market.  My chicken burger was lousy (frozen? painted on grill marks?) but the fries were good. Their Mexican/fusion food was good though- Korean tacos. I might try their beef burger if we go back. Very good service.
author: j-mo h.

description: So far the last four times I have been here the food and the staff have been great so if your looking for good home cooked food give this dinner a try you won't be sorry.
author: Travis A.

description:
1.  This is an update.  This is a review of breakfast at Sam's Diner.

2.  The service was super friendly.  The food came out quickly.  The service was much better than my first trip to Sam's.

3.  The ambiance is that of a basic diner.  It is clean and well kept.

4.  Scrambled Eggs and Bacon - The breakfast was a good rendition of the basic American breakfast.  The portions were generous.  The eggs were scramble well.  Cooked pretty much perfect for my own taste.  The hash-browns were very good and there were a lot of them.  The bacon was slightly over-cooked.  The sourdough toast was good with lots of butter.  I enjoyed my breakfast.

http://tinyurl.com/4228xqg

5.  Fruit Cup - The person I was eating with ordered the fruit cup.  It looked very appetizing.  The fruit was obviously fresh. There were strawberries, melon, grapes, and a blackberry.

http://tinyurl.com/44u66pf

6.  Sam's Diner is a good spot for breakfast.  I would not necessarily go out of the way to go there.  After all, that stretch of Market Street isn't really the nicest part of San Francisco.  But, if you are in the area or need to meet someone in the area, Sam's is a nice alternative for a decent breakfast or lunch.
author: Mark D.

description: Just had some vanilla milkshakes here with my sister :) cool and cozy situation going on. Regular diner, in a happening part of town. Not a bad choice if you're in the area and feeling like ice cream.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Just around the corner from my training class so it is a good safe goto
Korean tacos are amazing 
Breakfast is hearty and staff at counter is nice and welcoming
author: C Z.

description:
Pleasantly surprised. Came for a pre-Orpheum dinner, and luckily had called in the morning for a reservation because the pre-dinner crowd is big. Unluckily, the woman who took my reservation managed to list my name as "Courrtnney" and the listed time as 6:15 am, so they had problems finding my reservation. A waiter came over and assured us they'd manage to seat us somehow -- and then a second waiter was the one who realized that my reservation had gotten listed under a badly written name and incorrect time. Points to both of them for handling it well AND figuring out what happened.

The outside looks a bit rundown, but the renovations inside are indeed quite nice. I like the signed show posters framed on the wall -- gets you in the mood for your post-dinner show! We ordered off the special pre-show menu: dungeoness crab melt and seared sole. Crab melt: plenty of crab and the avocado was a good addition. The scallion aioli indeed tasted scalliony and complemented the flavor well. Fries were standard. The sole was a surprisingly large piece of fish. The roasted tomato salsa on it was so-so (tasted a bit canned) but had more of a kick than I expected (a good thing!) and the mascarpone polenta was fantastic. The veggie side was also perfectly cooked and not mushy at all. 

Service was quick and super friendly, and we liked the new booths. Definitely make reservations if it's a show night. We'll be back for future pre-show meals!
author: Corinne C.

description: No one gave me an explanation as you said in your response back as to why it happened. I had to stop the waitress to tell her and she then offered me another drink which I didn't take. I told her I wanted something off of my bill and I was not charged for the tea and pie. If a manager had come by and explained to me I would not have left the review that I did. So to say what you said is incorrect.
author: Sophie B.

description: Had a great Cobb salad. The thing that made the difference for me was Great service. My coffee never ran low, a feat with someone was drinks coffee like me. It didn't hurt that Jakob was an incredibly handsome server. Thanks for a great meal Sam's!
author: Chris R.

description: I've been dining here since 2002.  I like the food and the old-time diner feel.  And it doesn't cost a fortune to have a great lunch!
author: Mitch H.

description: The pulled pork sandwich was superb. Juicy smoky bbq pork on a soft bun made to perfection.  The French fries were long slender and crispy.  Yum!
author: Ramon C.

description:
who'da known this cute little diner was just down the street from the Orpheum?!!  I've been going to the theater for years, always rushing to find a place to eat before the show - always anxious about getting our meal in time for the show.  We've been to several places and just discovered Sam's Diner, just half a block from the Orpheum on Market.  It's a little place and the food is like any diner fare but with a bit of fancier fare for theater nights.  

We ordered the clams, the crab melt and salmon teriyaki for dinner.  They were done nicely and I was surprised at the portion size of the salmon. I'm used to a tiny piece of fish but this piece was huge - I could barely finish it.  The taste is standard teriyaki grilled.  

What really stood out was the service - they really work hard to get you out the door on time for the show. They're very personable and really want to make sure your food is to your liking.  

I was going to give them a 4 star rating but being so close to the Orpheum, with decent food and decent prices, I'll give it 5 stars.  It's not a romantic place, or a gastro-phenomenon, but it's a great place for a good meal right before the theater, and just down the street.
author: Bon J.

description:
Although I might have given Sam's a 3 rating previously, I've realized that context must be taken into account with each review, and Sam's definitely deserves a 4 within context.

GROUP: I came with a reservation at 6pm for 13 people on a show night at the Orepheum (Les Mis). They accepted a reservation a mere three days beforehand and that was a super good idea because the places was packed. There were already two other big groups there so without a reservation, we probably wouldn't have gotten a place.

FOOD: It's typical diner food and I had a hard time choosing because nothing really seemed THAT good. However, from the various dishes I tasted, nothing tasted bad. Everything tasted pretty good. I got the chicken-fried steak which came with mashed potatoes and gravy and some garlic roasted veggies. The steak was super tender and the gravy was awesome.

SERVICE: The minute we got seated, I knew we shouldn't expect excellent service because the place was so busy. I could see that all the waiters/waitresses were running around trying to get everyone served and all the cooks were cooking away. Seriously. I saw knives flying and the stove was so hot, you could swear they were doing some flambe back there. So, yes, the food came out slowly, it was hard to get the staff's attention, and we had to wait a long time to get things that we asked for...BUT like I said, I was expecting it: it was show night at the Orpheum (literally a block away) and we were a party of 13. 

Some pros of the service which I highly respect them for:
-they split our checks whichever way we wanted: individually, groups, partners, etc. Whatever we asked for 
-upon request, they also prepped our checks while we were eating so that we could just sign and leave when we wanted
-the waitress was just really genuine in that she really wanted to help us get everything in order and was apologetic when it wasn't
-the owner of the restaurant came to check up on us at the end and reassure us that we had plenty of time until the show started to finish eating and get out of there
-we had a birthday in the group and the owner brought over a mini molten chocolate cake with ice cream. SO YUM.

All in all, I think I would definitely come back here if I had to eat at a restaurant around the Orpheum. It's a diamond in the rough of the Tenderloin. I just might come 2.5 hours earlier than the show instead of 2. And maybe come with a smaller crowd!
author: Katherine K.

description:
I didn't completely understand this place.  It was a diner, but they had Korean tacos.  I guess this is what happens when Koreans open up an American-style diner.  We didn't have such things in AZ or FL.  I can definitely dig it.

The tacos were certainly tasty, but I wanted more spice to them.  More sauce as well.  I also couldn't completely tell how the bulgogi was that different from carne asada.  

I was happy that the waitress was able to sub me fries instead of their homemade chips.

The location is also odd.  It's perfect if you have to descend into the Civic Center BART, but it's not necessarily the safest/nicest area.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Closest thing to experiencing an East Coast/Connecticut diner in San Francisco. A perfect place to go before a show. Really accommodating to my dietary restrictions. All they need is a rotating cake display. Really nice waiter too.
author: Andrew K.

description:
We tried this for the first time last weekend and the food and service was excellent!
It was my birthday and our server brought out a mini chocolate sundae to me!
author: TBird M.

description: Great place for breakfast. Coffee was good, service was good too. I had the bacon stuffed pancakes...odd but it was delish!
author: Erica S.

description:
I've eaten here twice and both times I sat at the counter.  This place often gets HUGE lines out the door because the Orpheum theatre is across the street.

It's a diner.  It's simple, it's classic, the employees are nice, and they are FAST!  

I asked my server what I should get off the menu, and he recommended the fried chicken.  TWICE I've been back since then to get that very dish.  The sautéed veggies are nice and garlicky, their french fries are crisp, and their fried chicken is DELICIOUS.  

Check this place out if you need a bite to eat before a show, just make sure to make reservations or eat at the counter!  It's DEEEEELISH!
author: Stacy S.

description: The food and service here is amazing. Every Time I've been there, which is practically every Saturday lol everyone has been extremely friendly and greatly accommodating. The food is amazing too, I am obsessed with Mahalo Loco Moco, and their Egg Florentine. Did anyone say..."mimosas?" Yummmm definitely will keep on coming :)
author: Gabriel G.

description: This place is cute with super happy and friendly people working there. Its right down the street from the theater too.  When we arrived, they asked if we were going to the show. Because we were, and time was a priority, they made sure we looked at menu as we waited for our seat. Once seated, out order was taken and we were served in no time. Its casual and a fun little place.
author: Lisa F.

description:
SAY AWAY!!!!!     There you have been warned!!!! 

Attended a Women's conference on Monday and went here for lunch.. Service was horrible, we ordered 2 sandwiches and one beet salad and 50 minutes later still hadn't received our food.. Our server was VERY overwhelmed or inexperienced - maybe a bit of both..  So bad service isn't why I've only gave this place 1 star... I've been since all week since eating here... 

Again.. STAY AWAY!!!!!!
author: Maria A.

description:
The food was excellent! Hot mama burger... Yum!!

This place can get really busy so factor in time.
author: Hannah K.

description:
Been to this diner quite a few times. It is always satisfactory- the menu has everything that you crave but I usually have breakfast and lunch.  In the past nothing to rave about and nothing to complain out.  It fills the void with good diner vibe.  However, the reason why I am writing this review is because I went in for lunch on the 29th.  I am thinking the manager? sat us and told us the specials for the day.  He pointed out new items like the Korean tacos and other tasty selections which I dont think Ive seen before but could be wrong.  I chose one of their specials- the crab melt sandwich since he sold me.  I usually get the tuna melt sandwich but the crab was soooo tasty.  It had a luscious sauce that made me eat every last bite.  I would def order that again and the service was excellent!! 2 different gals asked if we wanted water!  

Yes I would go back as always.. but they def get a rare yelp review from me :)
author: Margo R.

description:
Be prepared to wait a while for a table. 
Be prepared to wait equally as long for the Menu.
Be prepared to wait just as long for coffee. 
If you don't ask for water it will not come at all, just like drink refills (speak up...a few times when you've run out, otherwise you are out of luck and will be ignored).
Give yourself at least two hours from the time you get there to the time you get out.
Be prepared to remind them of your complete order, after only half of it makes it on your plate.
Be willing to eat whatever they put in front of you (I ordered or thing and they brought me another but it took so long that by the time I got anything I told them it didn't matter and I would jut eat it as is). 
Hearty breakfast. Well cooked. 
If you want your toast/English muffin un-buttered you must ask for it otherwise your carb will be smothered in butter.
Be prepared to drop more cash than what your meal is worth.
author: Gabriela G.

description: Don't pass this place up if you're in town and need a good diner fix. Outstanding and wholesome breakfast with good, attentive service along with the cleanliness surpassing your average Denny's.
author: Ryan K.

description: Great food, Great Price and cozy atmosphere.  Would definitely eat here again.
author: Nick R.

description: The Food was just ok. Got our order wrong. The wait staff never checked on us once. When we complained about all that went wrong. We were given a 3$ discount and told that was all they could do. We will not be back here and would not recommend it.
author: George R.

description:
Let me say that the staff are extremely welcoming &I friendly. Now, its not fine dining by any stretch, but what would you expect? 


My beef is that the food is not consistent nor do I understand why it takes so long?

Breakdown in management and proper training!.Don't know if I'll be back...I only get an egg on a bagel with cheese, but again its only 3get ingredients! I don't get it's to bad.


Really, it wouldn't take much to bring it up a notch.
author: Serano S.

description: after finishing my food realized there were green bugs all in the salad like afids. i am so disgusted right now.
author: Carrie S.

description:
Day two visiting SF. Headed to the Asian Art Museum. I've not eaten since 10. Time for a late but quick lunch.

The fast food joints didn't appeal to me. I stumbled upon this place as I walked toward the museum.

Sat at the bar. Ordered the corned beef hash benedict. That's corned beef hash with a poached egg and hollandaise sauce with hash browns. I ordered the eggs over medium. That means it'll run, but not all over the place.

I'm a patient person, but my patience has limits. After 25 minutes of waiting, I had to ask the waitress what's going on. Her eyes begged for more patience and so did her words. As I was about to walk out hungry, disappointed and angry after 30 min of waiting, my food showed up.

Grades:

Food: A
I have nothing against the food; it was actually very good. The hash browns were nice and crispy. The hollandaise tasted fresh. The hash was moist and delicious. Obviously, the 2 stars above this review is not about the food alone.


Appearance: It was 3 PM. The place looks and feels like a normal diner. Not too clean, which means business is slow, but not too messy, which means they need to clean the place up.

Service: C
This is where the problem lies. During the 25 minute wait, I tried to make eye contact with my waitress, but I didn't want to bother her, as she is hella busy. Amidst the apology she made about the unreasonable wait, there was a mention of a grill that started from cold and how it had to be heat up. What?!? The grill was cold? How about the other grills the cooks were using and slinging food from. Were they cold?

Her apology was heartfelt, as it was clearly not her fault, but I really wish she'd check in on me every once in a while and offered me something to eat. If there was a delay in serving me or anyone, I'd like to be told why, and I wasn't.

Ultimately, she gave me a discount for the wait. That quelled my anger somewhat. Still, a) I resent being ignored and b) that didn't make up for it.

Verdict:

I would eat here again, if I head down this way on foot. I really liked what I had and would like to try the country fried steak. If the service improves, they get more stars. Is that a deal, Sam's Diner?
author: Alex L.

description: Great service every timed.  Excellent chilli and good burgers.
author: April M.

description:
BLUF: Nice place. 

Please note this is really not a diner, but a slightly upscale restaurant. Dishes are average $15-20 and up. Definitely not a "$". Not sure why it's that way on Yelp. Service was great, food was good but I wouldn't come back because of the price in proportion to the serving size. Salads were micro size as well. Pasta was a decent size. Wings were a great appetizer.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Went to SF for a wedding and stumbled upon this place with my family everyone was very friendly and welcoming, 
Food was delicious hot and fresh the waiter was very nice and patient with us since we were a party of 7 would definitely come back if I find myself in SF again
author: Michelle A.

description:
Since I stay at the Whitcomb Hotel any time I'm in SF, I always end up at Sam's.  The coffee is good, the plates are just the right size and the service is usually pretty friendly and fast.  You won't leave here hungry.  Their Eggs Benedict is really awesome!

I've actually never had a bad meal or service here.
author: Jen C.

description: Went here based on the reviews before a show at SHN and it lived up to everything we expected. Totally delicious diner food (we had the sliders and the Korean pork tacos) and some of the best service we've had anywhere in the city....our server Robert was outstanding!!
author: Nicole I.

description:
Stayed across the street and happened upon Sam's. In pretty much the armpit of San Francisco, Sam's is quite a breath of fresh air. 
The restaurant is well maintained, clean with walls having appearance of fresh  paint and fun art adorning the walls. 
The Service the first visit was on point. The waitress was attentive and fulfilled all needs rapidly. Service on the second visit wasn't quite as great, but still decent. 
Food was classic and cooked well 
Definitely stop here for breakfast or any other meal :-)
author: Lauren W.

description:
I was visiting SF and was getting sbux across from Sam's Diner and thought it was a cute place to get some breakfast. No one even greets us and the bus boy came to seat us because he saw we had been standing there a few minutes. The waitress, I believe her name is Jane, walked by us about 4 times and helped every other table but ours (there were only 3 other customers there). We waved down the other waitress and she asked us if we needed anything and we told her that we ready to order. She even acknowledged that Jane had just walked right by us. 

We ordered our breakfast because I do not eat sausage, I asked if I could replace it with bacon. It came out with sausage on it still and I asked the same man who sat us if I could have bacon instead. I told him he did not need to remake it, I would just replace it. He took my plate away and brought it back with sausage and bacon, after I told him I did not want the sausage either. 

No one came to check on us again, even when we were done with our food and ran out of water midway. We walked up to the register and had to ask for our bill after sitting for 15 minutes after we finished our meal. We looked over to the other side of the wall and they were all just chatting with one another.

The food was alright, but do not expect any good service!
author: Karuna N.

description: AMAZING service!! We were concerned about making it to see Wicked on time and the owner assured us we would have plenty of time.  She was so kind! We were seated quickly and received our delicious meals with plenty of time to spare!  Our handsome waiter was very attentive and checked on us numerous times. Thankful for the kind and fast service!  Would definitely come back again! :)
author: Ana ..

description: Great food, nice staff and conveniently located from my hotel. This is my 2nd trip and I have been seated and received a drink within 5 mins each time.  I am a breakfast guy so I didn't venture past steak and eggs and bacon and eggs but both were great and I look forward to making a return trip here the next time I am in town. The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 is they screwed up my toast order both times and gave me wrong toast .
author: Geo L.

description:
When my friends and family were in town for our wedding in November, we stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb (Across the street), and came here just about every day for Breakfast.

Great food, friendly service, good selection, reasonable prices.

Really, we were pleased with everything we ordered each time we were there.

My 95 year old grandpa considers himself to be an eggs benedict connoisseur, often times sending back his order if the eggs aren't poached properly, or the hollandaise wasn't right...he ordered the Bene 3 days in a row... that should tell you everything.

Since then I have been by many times for dinner, and enjoy a variety of their weekly specials... OMG the Korean Tacos are freakin' amazing...
author: Kevin O.

description:
The Unfortunate Breakfast: An anecdote concerning a hungry girl and SAM

Woke up at 5am STARVING and slightly hungover in need of the most satisfying breakfast known to man. Spent 20 minutes yelping, searching for the primest most perfect nook. Took off on my bike and got to my decided on place and sadly realized it just wouldn't do. Cold, annoyingly hungry, meandered and yelped more and went to "lunch sack" where I got a miserable, oily, egg croissant sandwich. Downed that and only whetted my appetite. Walked the WRONG way to "SAMs diner" which on yelp looked like the exact thing my heart desired, and a poop emergency beseeched me to locate it immediately. Finally arrived. Watched the news with old men and sipped my Bloody Mary. Ordered a veg omm with hash browns. Awaited the satiety that surely awaited me with a ring of the kitchen bell. 
What was placed in front of me was the soggiest, spongiest, lowest quality excuse for an omelette that my face contorted with disgust as I put a forkful of cheese-lava'd yuck into my mouth. The Sysco vegetables tasted like they were carved from a stack of holiday print napkins and I wanted to cry "help!" and make the waitress get it out of my sight.
Moved on with a heavy heart to the hash browns. Or should I say "hash blechs". Had to CUT each bite with a fork and knife they were so overcooked. No amount of squeeze-bottle ketchup could mask the nothing flavor of disappointment. Don't even ask about the wheat toast. It was probably from a Sysco knockoff.
Too shy to complain, I paid the $19.58 and left my almost full plate on the counter as I walked into the chilly morning, dissatisfied and unsatiated.
author: Emilie M.

description:
Home of the regulars! Dining at the counter you'll notice the sounds of a mom and pop breakfast diner: 
-regulars coming ordering "the usual" 
-crackling sounds off the griddle 
-the sound of coffee pouring 
-and ESPN Sporstcenter (they recently got flat screens installed)

Open at night also, this is a popular spot for pre-event dining with the Civic Auditorium and the Orpheum. From pancakes to club sandwiches to chicken teriyaki! The service was pretty good! Even the cook took the time to see if needed something to drink while I was at the counter. 

For a hearty breakfast out of the norm, I was recommended the Loco Moco: Burger Patty, Eggs, and Gravy- all over a bed of rice! YUM!
author: Paul D.

description:
Classic diner with a solid menu. However, my party of 3 waited 15 minutes just to see our server, another 10 to get waters and finally to take our food order. It was not at all busy (maybe 3 other tables in the whole place) 
The food was luke warm when it came out (nothing worse than cold french fries). The food itself was good but it would have been great had it not been sititng there for who knows how long.
author: Ashley J.

description: Food good service great.  Changes menu with shows at the Orpheum.  My wife loved the fried chicken.  The Jackson 5 burger was good as well.  Would go there again if I was in the area.  I don't think you would be disappointed.
author: Hank Z.

description:
Stopped here for lunch before the matinee of Wicked.  I had a tuna melt with avocado, and my theater companion had scrambled eggs, bacon and fruit salad.  She always has bacon, if it's on the menu.

Both meals were standard diner fare.  Good quality and good service.  The produce (avocado and fruit) were actually very good, better than expected.

I'd eat here again if I were in the area and hungry, but I wouldn't necessarily make it a point to bring someone here.  A-OK.
author: Linda M.

description:
Cool place for breakfast and they serve all day.  Don't go here if your looking for the Ritz but the food is great.  Owner is on site all the times and quite friendly.  Good food (comfort food)  hits the spot, nice small spot and a good find.

Check it out
author: Shirley W.

description:
Reading other peoples'  reviews on here, it seems like this is a popular pre - show, pre - night - on - the - town sort of place, which I guess would be a great way to describe it, seeing its close proximity to Tenderloin and south of Market nightlife. As a matter of fact, this place fueled our epic Market Street Cinema night that I just wrote a review of (well, a lot of things fueled that night, but anyways) This is a great place.

We came here because Munch Haven was closed already, and we needed some delicious 10pm breakfast food. The place had a fair amount of people in it, and it looked pretty clean for a TL diner - type place. 

I got an omelet, and it was served with buttered English muffins and perfectly - cooked red potatoes, at a very reasonable price for such a large plate of food! My friend got a veggie burrito, and she said it was amazing. I didn't try any, but I'm going to take her word for it. 

Sam's Diner is a great place to fuel up for whatever kind of night you're about to have, and unlike a fancy restaurant, you'll have plenty of money in your pocket to spend on strippers and blow...I mean...drinks. Cheers!
author: Angela S.

description:
Wife and I stopped in after getting a second hand high while walking around the pride festival. Jakob the server of the day was attentive, made good draft beer suggestions. Both of us just had sandwiches, the Korean pork sandwich was a standout, would certainly be back and order the same thing. 
Reasonable prices, drinks came out first and fast, like they should, food was overall very good.
author: Raymond S.

description: Pork tacos were delicious. And the service was beyond superb. Doug made great recommendations and was very quick.
author: Christine F.

description:
We ordered the Teriyaki Chicken and the Philly Cheese Steak -- the latter being a specialty according to the menu. The food service was SLOW. They apologized and said it was due to a computer/printer malfunction. They gave us complimentary beef barley soup and deep-fried cheese sticks to attempt to make up for it.

The soup was "OK"; the cheese sticks weren't "gooey" enough on the inside -- they were still too firm. Finally the food arrived and we were told our bill would be adjusted to offset the long wait.

Despite being apologetic and making a sincere effort to make up for the long wait with free food, our entrees were nothing special. So, even if the service were flawless, I can't see myself going back for the food.
author: Paul L.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a place to eat and grab some drinks prior to a concert at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. This place definitely fit the bill. I was very surprised at the draft selection they had available and the menu did have some interesting fusion items that you wouldn't expect at a diner. 

I got the Biscuits and Gravy special which was above average. The only disappointing part was how little gravy was actually available on the biscuit. I also asked for a bowl of clam chowder which the waiter offered to give to me for free which was a definite plus in my book. The clam chowder was good as well although I do prefer it to a bit thicker.

My friend got the Chicken Fried steak which also looked good. The only complaint he had was that the used a brown gravy on it instead of country gravy. 

Another friend of mind opted for the special Korean tacos which he said was very good. 

Service was very prompt and friendly. The decor was quite nice too with signed cast posters of different shows.
author: Richard T.

description:
The coffee? Great.

The food? Okay. The eggs were great, but my hash browns were lacking flavor. Ketchup kind of fixed that.

The day I went, they were having several technical difficulties, and I know that this can be stressful. But what really made me cringe was that one of the servers was chastising my server right at the counter, repeatedly. It made me feel bad for my server. She seemed nice enough, and got my order right, and while it took me a while to get a fork, that's probably because she was being sent off to restock a bunch of supplies in urgent, annoyed tones.

I would try this place again, but perhaps at a different time of day.
author: James M.

description: I had the Midwestern Burger which was a great but difficult choice due to the many delicious offerings! The burger was an homage to the pork tenderloin sandwich ever so popular in the Midwest. It was a great portion, came with pepper jack cheese and a chipotle aoli. My server, who I think may have been the owner, was super kind. I asked her for more information about the chipotle aoli and asked to sub te fries for tater tots and it was no issue. Definitely would go back and try some of the other yummy looking items. Must go if you're in the area!
author: Moni E.

description:
