My fambam and I went to see the 100th Bay to Breakers and as usual, my tootsies gave out at 9th and Market.  So my girl TT and I went in search of breakfast.  I remembered seeing Sam's when we went to see Wicked last year, and they were sporting quite a few stars, so I thought this would be the spot.  TT poked her head in and gave her approval, there were a lot of people enjoying their food.

What is cool is the way the service is transferred between all of the staff.  We were greeted by 1, seated by 2 and received our beverages by #3.  #1 took our orders, #2 brought the food, #3 kept the drinks going, #1 brought the check, #2 picked it up and #2 rang it up while #3 brought our to go containers.  Hope you kept up with that!  LOL

I enjoyed the french toast with banana's, two eggs and corned beef hash.  TT had the pancakes with bacon and scrambled.  We both loved the breakfast, our service and everyone's attitude!  A great stop for breakfast.
author: Bee D.

description: Excellent breakfast (French toast for dinner!) and they were very welcoming and personable, even on a Saturday night! Everything was delicious!
author: Becky M.

description: Enjoyed the Korean tacos. Even the white rice had a nice flavor. The staff is super nice. The decor isn't going to win any awards but it's a diner so..
author: Will S.

description: Small diner went there for dinner we wetr sat right away. Being from out of town we asked for food suggests out waiter was helpful, knowledgeable and great. I had the Korean tacos Yum! 3 overstuffed tacos so full they could easily be 3. I left happy and overstuffed like my tacos. My husband has the 3 Chuck burger... wow that's a burger! Delish cooked just how he asked. Fast friendly delish. Check em out. Great food great service. Great price.
author: Sarah U.

description: My husband and I are on our way to becoming lunch regulars at this place and I'm pretty excited about that.  I have ordered plenty of things off the menu and haven't found one I didn't like. The Korean tacos are inarguably the best menu item but chicken sandwich, pesto pasta and veggie burgers are really good.  The salads come with fresh, healthy looking greens...not the sad defeated greens you often find at diners.  The staff have been unwaveringly nice and there's a nice, friendly vibe at the bar.  For only complaint I have is that sometimes it takes awhile to get your check, which is irritating during lunch break.  But even this complaint could be seen as a good thing, as it means that they aren't trying to rush you out.  I wish I was unemployed so I could sit at the bar all afternoon watching weird competitive dance shows at the bar.
author: Michelle K.

description: First off all of the staff is excellent. Our server Danielle was very polite and friendly. Wonderful Huevos Rancheros, and their pancakes are delicious. I have never had a pancake sprinkled with powdered sugar on it! Whenever I come back to San Francisco I'll make sure to stop by again. Prices are very inexpensive, I am very impressed!
author: Courtney G.

description:
One day after work, tired and bored, I stopped in here on a whim and felt like having an old school diner experience.  The waiter was very friendly and gave good recommendations when i asked him about the menu.  I ordered the daily special, baked chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies and soup on the side.  The soup de jour was vegetable -- kinda like minestrone but without the pasta.  Very nice.  The main dish was surprisingly good as well -- chicken was very tender and juicy and nicely herbed, mashed potatoes and veggies were uncomplicated and the gravy was rich and pretty salty--but I like it that way.

I had apple pie a la mode for desert which was a huge portion I couldn't finish...also good.

Although I didn't order one, they have a nice variety of beers, domestic and imports, on tap.

Other than the daily special, the waiter had highly recommended the Korean tacos, their burgers (which are ground and formed on premises), and the teriyaki dishes, which looked generous.

Service was wonderful, food was delicious and exceeded my expectations.  I'm looking forward to going back and trying something else.  For that, 5 stars.

*Edit -- FYI, after reading other reviews on less than stellar service, I should mention that I came in at about 7:30 PM on a Thursday evening.  maybe that helps.
author: Jordan B.

description: Stopped in here for breakfast at the bar, got a cup of coffee and waited 30 minutes for the server to come back, wasn't going to wait another hour to eat, so went next door to Munch Haven and got much better service. Sam's also charged $3 for a small cup of of shitty coffee, skip this place.
author: Drew C.

description: The service was incredibly friendly, they popped us into a table quickly and were always around to grab our order and refill drinks without being annoying. The food was on FUCKING POINT. French toast was off the charts. Fries were better than most, and price was low. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Timmy B.

description: Went here for breakfast. Right across from my hotel. Amazing! great French toast, potatoes and service!
author: Allie R.

description: Sam's isn't too bad. If you're looking for solid food at a fair price this your spot. Won't blow you away but you will get what you expect. Be aware if it's busy they won't make breakfast (even though the menu says they do).
author: Rob R.

description: I was recently on vacation in San Francisco and discovered this gem. I had breakfast each day of my stay at Sam's and thoroughly enjoyed it. The food was great with a good selection of home cookin' types of dishes, very clean inside and the wait staff was friendly. Highly recommend to any hungry travelers in the Bay Area!
author: Adam S.

description:
We were looking for some place good to eat, near the Orpheum Theater that served food that could be kid friendly.

Let me start by saying that there is NOT a lot of upscale choices within safe walking distance.  That section of town is super sketchy and a lot of places are more geared toward breakfast and lunch for on the go Art institute students or the odd businessperson.  You DO NOT want to walk around that hood.  SAM's is right on Market and minutes from the theater.

It's a diner but the interior has been recently updated and looks really nice.  The counter/bar area has a nice warm sports bar feel.  The seating side is banquet tables and four tops.  Decorated with signed posters from the various shows that have been through the Orpheum.

Now to the food.  While they don't have a "kid's menu", they did have chicken strips (made with actual chicken breast - go figure!) and fries.  Kid was very happy with that.

Adults were happy with the menu too.  We ordered the open faced Hot Roast Beef, SAM's Spicy Pork Sandwich and the House Special Chuck Three Burger.  Barely had a chance to see the Burger, it was huge and delicious and there was a hungry 17 year old boy waiting to inhale it.  He gave it rave reviews.  The Hot Roast Beef was thinly sliced and mouth watering.  Very good!  Served with steamed mixed veg that actually looked pretty darn fresh!  The Spicy Pork Sandwich was amazing.  Think about a spicy Korean pork, grilled and yummy on a really good french roll, also grilled on the flat top and then throw on some crunchy Asian slaw!  

As for the service, place was packed with other people going to the theater.  We had about 45 minutes from the time we sat down until the curtain time and we were able to make it.  The staff is very friendly and kept assuring us that we would be fine.  

One note on the pictures posted here by others.  The food looks WAY better in person.

I WILL go back, the hard question will be what to order.  That pork was really good.......
author: Kimberly G.

description: Great breakfast and service, perfect comforting food that is quick and cheap and DELICIOUS! I loved this place so much I was sad to leave San Francisco.
author: Katie R.

description:
My wife and I visited Sam's Diner based on Yelp's reviews. We are so glad we did. The food was great, the staff was very friendly, and the owners were welcoming and funny.
I had the French toast and bacon... Loved it! And my wife enjoyed the Korean Tacos.
author: Toby R.

description: Came across this place by accident during a trip to San Francisco. The food is great, the staff is super friendly and the prices are reasonable. I highly recommend this spot if your in the area.
author: Jose L.

description:
Great Pre-Show spot if you have less than an hour before show time.  The lady at (Orpheum) will-call sent us here and it was a great suggestion.  

Sit at the counter if only for the chance to watch and listen to the interaction between the staff and the street folk ... "I need a bag of ice and no one else will give me any" (so why should we?) ... but they did!

Right away the server (I think she was the owner too) asked "Are you going to the show?" (I guess we looked obvious ...) us - "Yes."  her - "Well don't order breakfast and stick with the pre-show menu."   She then went on to tell us how great the show was (smart folks at the Orpheum gives her free tickets) and how nice and fun the cast members are.  That made us like the show even more.   

Food was diner worthy (Korean tacos, Patty Melt, Caesar Salad).  I wish I had room for a shake because they looked really good!    

Only had to step over a few hobos and their pit bulls on the way out and the car in front of ours was broken into but they skipped us so all in all a good night!
author: Kelli R.

description: Sam's Diner is one of me & my girlfriends new favorite diners in San Francisco! The customer service was very friendly & educated. Our waiter was Douglas, he was great! I asked him what the dish I ordered had in it & he ended up giving me a quick history lesson about the dish in addition to their twist on flavors. I ordered a special they had "crab egg benedict"
author: Mike L.

description: The Chef's house salad is phenomenal! My family and I had never had golden beets before and they turned out to be really good!! The burgers are also really good because the beef is tender and juicy. Not to mention the pleasant treatment by the staff even though we arrived shortly before closing time. Over all a great place for a family meal that is cozy and comfortable from the moment you walk in.
author: Gloria M.

description: Quick service.  Place was a little old/dirty like a diner should be.  Breakfast was good though.
author: Mike M.

description: SAMs great place for locals to grab micro beers on a cold day.Clean, great service and staff. Would go back next time I'm in town for sure.
author: Will H.

description: Just discovered this place.  Nice and quiet. . great food. .. awesome service... and the selection!! Took me forever to decide but was well worth it.
author: Kym M.

description: When you just want a decent diner in the Civic Center, you go to Sam's. This ain't no fancy-schmancy white tablecloth joint. It's a diner. And a quite decent one.
author: Barry S.

description: Not a bad little diner. I had the Three Chuck burger and it was absolutely delicious. Also it has a convenient location of right outside the civic center bart. Overall good eats and a good week happy hour.
author: Mathew C.

description: my friend and I are from DC and were in SF visiting in October 2010 and staying at the whitcomb hotel across the street. We decided once we found out how expensive the hotel restaurant was to try sam"s diner. we were in town for 6 days and ate there everyday. The food was excellent with a great menu selection. I was also rather pleased that they cooked my breakfast grits to perfection as I was born in the south and a harsh critic of southern food made anywhere else but Sam's diner got it right. I will return to SF one day and when I do Sam's diner will defenitely be on my list to eat there once again. ... We were two satisfied customers... Thank You!
author: Cheryl J.

description: I've been here several times only to realize that I get ignored every single time. Being a black man, I assumed that maybe someone was having a bad day or being cautious because of their location surrounded by homeless folks. But after a pattern of being ignored and a lack of simple curtsy, I concluded that I didn't belong. Sorry Sam but you won't see me again.
author: Felix H.

description: My bacon cheese burger was terrific. So was my wife's and her girlfriends. The korean tacos were just ok, per the gal that ordered them, but she may have been influenced by the loooooonnnngg wait to get them. The prices are very reasonable, esp by SF standards.
author: David S.

description: What an enjoyable evening we had at Sam's Diner right before we saw Wicked at the Orpheum!  The staff was extremely friendly and the service was wonderful.  The food was great, too!  Two of us ordered the Korean tacos which were apparently amazing.  One had the salmon and said it was great.  I had the mac & cheese with chicken and ate every bite.  We would definitely return to Sam's in the future!  Oh, PS, if you're up for dessert, we highly recommend the chocolate molten lave cake - YUM-O!
author: Justine G.

description:
My friends and I were tired and out of it from a late night before and on a mission for comfort food. We were hungry for some breakfast at noon and it was the closest diner to the hotel we were camping out at downtown SF.

The menu had a good selection of breakfast and lunch items. There was nothing out of the ordinary and that is what we were looking for. Good ole chicken fried steak and veggie omelets. 

The service was prompt and they were on it with the water and coffee. I think our hung over demeanor gave our desperate need for liquids away. The food was sufficient to hit the spot but wasn't spectacular. Even still, for the condition we were in, the whole experience helped us start our day off right.
author: Yasasha R.

description: Just got out of the Orpheum Theater and came here for an early dinner. I got the Korean Fish Tacos with cilantro lime rice . This food was amazing. Very delicious. For desert I got apple pie with ice cream. The pi was wonderful with a great tasting flaky crust. I want to come back and try a breakfast item.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Since we were staying at a nearby hotel, this was really the only choice around for a Sunday morning breakfast.  It is a small diner, with standard booth seating, as well as counter seating.  The service was rather slow, and the food was just ok.  There really wasn't anything special about the place, but it seems to have a constant flow of people.
author: Kevin V.

description: Good food but not for the chronically hypoglycemic. You may pass out while waiting.  Nearly empty restaurant and a burger took over a half hour from ordering to my table.  Wasn't worth the wait.
author: James A.

description: This was my dinner spot for the two nights I was in San Francisco. The Korean tacos and sandwiches are awesome. Both the pork and beef ones are good but I find myself preferring the pork more.
author: Simon C.

description: My cousins and I had a very special event last weekend to see WICKED at the Orpheum theatre rig down the street and found this restaurant. Now, I would make every opportunity to visit this restaurant when I am in the city. They have an extensive menu and we each had something different. The food was affordable, tasty and plentiful! The service, however, raised this review to five stars without question! Caleb and Jacob were AMAZING! Besides being attentive to our requests, they were both adorable, charming and downright FUN! We made sure to get a photo with them to capture our fantastic time for posterity!
author: Karen Z.

description: My boyfriend and I had a great meal the other night. The staff was so friendly and the service was on point. Will definitely return.
author: Genevieve D.

description:
This is literally up the street from my bf's house. We come here at least once every two weeks or so for breakfast, which for us is around 2pm!
The wait staff is always friendly, and accommodating to my bf's service dog (double plus).
I love Sam's Diner! I haven't had a bad meal yet in the year plus we've been coming here. I'm fond of the Ruben and my bf love's his Loco Moco, but we occasionally get other things.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I honestly don't remember much about being in this diner because I was probably more than 8 beers deep but what i DO remember quite clearly is the most amazing goddamn turkey reuben that I ever had. Ever. 

I can't even tell you what prompted me to order it except seeing someone else's reuben being made on the grill. I can also tell you it came with a huge greasy ass pile of fries but they were the good kind -- really crispy with a lot of potato.

I also can't speak to the people working there but they didn't give us any grief when I was put in a headlock by my friend, and they also didn't make fun of me when I inhaled my entire plate. So all in all, I'd say the experience was pretty tops.
author: Kathleen K.

description: Went to Sam's prior to seeing Motown last night. Rob gave us excellent service and the food was fresh and delicious. We will probably come back when we come up to see Kinky Boots.
author: Darcy R.

description: Great food, terrible service. Omelettes and milkshakes are good but it took forever. Like forever. Waited like 20 minutes to pay.
author: Maddie R.

description: They have remodeled and the place is a lot more pleasant. They also have new artwork and a mural! How cool for a Diner. The menu has been expanded and the food is still very good for the price.
author: Tony L.

description: I come out to this area from time to time for shows, and I never know where to go for dinner beforehand.  Finally got a chance to check this place out before seeing Book of Mormon a couple weeks ago, and it was really great.  The place was PACKED, so it took a little while to get seated.  After getting seated, the service was amazing and our food came out really quickly.  I got the spicy Korean pork sandwich and my wife got the crab melt, and both were delicious.  They also have a decent beer selection.  I will definitely be back next time I am out here for a show!
author: Andrew M.

description:
My hubby and I came here for a pre-theater meal.  Our show was at the Orpheum, which is too far a walk for our usual pre-theater dinner at Katanaya-Na.

I got the chicken fried steak; my hubby got the Philly cheese steak.  We sat at the counter and got our drinks immediately, but it took a while for a waiter to come and get our food order.

Chicken fried steak was okay; Philly cheese steak was not.

Luckily there's a TV at the counter, which was nice because the Giants were playing.

However, I don't know if I'd go back.  Next time I watch a snow at the Orpheum I'll make e walk to Hayes Valley.
author: Aura J.

description: I travel to SF regularly and usually stay near SAM's. The burgers, Korean tacos, and breakfast options are all fantastic. Service is friendly, if a bit slow (standards seem to different in SF).
author: Tres C.

description:
So there I was, staying at the Hotel Whitcomb while trying to find a place to live in San Francisco.  It had been a nerve racking few days so far and I was pretty stressed out.  Finally one morning I woke up and decided to go find a place to eat some breakfast before continuing my grand search for a new abode.  I walk out the door into the bright sunlight, a little hungover from my discovering the Toronado the night prior, and right across the street from me I see a blue sign that reads "Sam's Diner".

Now let me explain something here.  I have a real weak spot for a proper diner.  Not some kind of cliched  nostalgia franchise like Mel's, but a real honest to god diner.  Needless to say, I was pleased when I walked in.  There you had a real lunch counter, a cook manning the grill like he was born with a spatula in his hand, cute waitresses that seemed to know all their regular customers by name (and from what I saw, that's a lot of people), and old guys reading their papers while drinking their coffee.  It's the kind of joint that you walk into and immediately feel at home.  

So I sat down at the counter, looked over the menu and ordered a T-Rex omelette with hash browns and sourdough toast.  The coffee was good and strong, and in no time flat my meal had arrived.  It was exactly what it was supposed to be.  Simple diner/greasy spoon food.  Nothing fancy, exotic, or all that amazingly great, but just exactly what you'd expect from this kind of place.  This isn't the kind of place to visit with lofty epicurean requirements but it's one of those places that if you really get it, you'll love it.  Later that day I went on to sign a lease for a place on the way to the airport to leave town, and had a nightmare of a time getting back to Texas, but at least I had that hour of calm at Sam's.
author: Joshua W.

description: Great service, 3 dollar beers during their 3 hour happy hour 3-6pm and awesome food. The chilled atmosphere is also a bonus. Recommend the spicy pork super burrito with chips and salsa went down an absolute treat!
author: Louis R.

description: Best customer service I've ever had in San Francisco! Perfect place to stop for lunch or dinner before a show at the Orpheum. Can't wait to go back!
author: Sara G.

description:
We tried this place last week before a concert at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. I wanted a sit-down restaurant that was walking distance, not pricey and open for dinner. Most of the places in that area are closed after lunch so it was slim pickin'. 

Sam's worked out perfectly. It's open for dinner and It wasn't crowded so we got a table immediately. I don't know if it's never crowded because of the neighborhood (you have to admit, Civic Center in SF is not the safest of places to walk around at night) or because we were early (5ish). Distance wise, we were about 2 blocks away from the auditorium. Price wasn't bad, I would say average for what we got.

I had the pork chops which were grilled and they gave you 2 cuts. It came with soup or salad, mash potatoes and gravy and mixed vegetables (not the frozen kind either). My daughter had the fish and chips and cole slaw. Then we shared the molten chocolate cake and two scoops of ice cream that came with it. We were pretty full when that came but we managed to finish the cake part and most of the ice cream.  The coffee was good too.

What I enjoyed the most about this place was the waitress. She was very friendly but not in an overly irritating way. She gave suggestions and was attentive. And I remembered to tell them that I found their establishment on Yelp and got my discount!!

I would return again if I were in that area for another show.
author: C R.

description: Stumbled upon Sam's Diner while hungry and walking to the BART along Market St.  Ended up being a great find!  First and foremost, the service was beyond exceptional.  Everyone in my party agreed that is was the BEST service we had ever received, no exaggeration.  The waitress was funny, extremely nice, and gave wonderful recommendations.  I ordered my burger as I always do: as rare as possible, and I was not disappointed!  The food quality was well above what we were expecting, and it tasted delicious for a very reasonable price.  Definitely would recommend this place, and if I am back in the area will be sure to go back!
author: Andy W.

description: Took a chance that this would be a good place for lunch. That turned out to be correct. I had a tasty burger and the waitress-recommended potato salad was excellent.
author: Steven K.

description:
THE BEST HASHBROWNS IN THE CITY OF SF! 
Let's start this off right. That's pretty much the standard commentary about my most beloved breakfast spot in San Francisco. Might go as far as saying best breakfast in SF, but I know and have tried a number of quirky and fun joints with their own claim to break-fast fame. 

The wait can seem interminably long on occasion, but worth it every time. 

The location may not seem like much, the doorway almost a literal hole in the brick wall. 

Not much else going on around it, kind of the dead zone on Market stuck between the bustle of Lower Market / Downtown and Upper Market / Castro, but dang is the food worth it. 

Try any of their omelets, you'll be hard pressed to finish, although the helpings are ample without being ridiculous. Baja - sour cream, pico, cheese (ask for cheddar as American is the standard and not real cheese FYI,) hashbrowns and toast of your choice. Or the Texas - chilli, sour cream and cheese, hasbrowns, and toast. 

Maybe feeling sweet toothy? Try the French Toast, and cinnamon that ess. It's fantab. 

The eggs are always quality, although I've yet to lunch or dine there. Can't make the wait past breakfast. But the lunch plates and steak plates and salads all look delish on the way to their consumers. 

The service is pretty great, depending on who you get, but as I frequent the establishment, they know my order by heart, embellishments, add-ons and all, And for me that means a lot. They smile when they see you and get your order good. 

And per its location and the salty crowd of the civic-loin nabe, there's almost always bound to be a funny attempted check-skipping, which rarely goes off as planned - these chicas will chase you down the street to get that payment filled. Don't think you're getting away clean here. I like to cheer them on. 

The coffee's wonderful esp for dinar brew. They're always on top of the refills. Mr. Pink would tip here.
author: Kelly S.

description: Visiting from out of town and staying at the Whitcomb across the street, needed someplace to eat at 9pm. Second all the good things said by others here, Sam's is way better than you have a right to expect. I'd definitely return for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
author: Steven H.

description: This is a great diner. Good food. Good coffee. Good service. French Toast is particularly good. Eat here instead of restaurant at Whitcomb.
author: Stephanie T.

description: We had the Korean tacos and some kind of burrito, flavors were good, but the meat is of very poor quality with a lot of gristle, had to be spit out. I wouldn't recommend getting any red meat here. Staff was polite, but didn't say anything about the fact that we only ate 1/3 of our food.
author: Krystine C.

description: I flew in to San Francisco today and basically have an all day layover until my flight departs. I took a cab (ran bout $40.. Which I could've probably rented a car for but whatever) to SAMs Diner. Not only was the food great, but the staff was very welcoming and let me stay long after my breakfast was devoured. They let me sit for an hour and a half until my friend came to pick me up. Ask for Katie, she is a very kind as well as the rest of the staff. Made me feel right at home, if I'm ever back in SF I know this will be a place to visit again.
author: Will M.

description:
I went to Sam's before seeing a show at the Orpheum. I was impressed with how they managed the urgent crowd of theatre-goers all trying to make an 8pm curtain. After a wait, we were seated in a nice booth and promptly ordered.

While my boyfriend's bolognese was only so-so, I was very impressed with my shrimp louie salad. Both shrimp and vegetable were fresh, delicious, and attractively plated.

I told him that I wanted to come back here before every show in the future, just to eat that.

Of course, that's before I woke up with food poisoning. =(
author: Becca S.

description: The service was great and the honey-fried chicken was good.  Stopped for a quick lunch.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Decided to try Sam's Diner after seeing a matinee performance of Kinky Boots at the Orpheum Theater based on Yelp reviews.  It's only a half a block away from the Orpheum and it was a pleasant surprise!  I ordered the marinated beef Korean tacos and my friend had the trio of sliders.  Both of us were not only impressed with the quality of the food but also with the taste!  Our server was wonderful with his warm welcoming and no hurry manner.  Even though people were waiting, he never tried to hurry us in any way.  I will definitely return to this gem!!!!
author: Nadene R.

description: As I drove into The City, rainy,cold and dark, the last thing I thought I would find was a nice place to have dinner before The Lion King at The Orpheum. We found this small place just down the sidewalk and gave it a try. The staff was friendly I enjoyed the bar option if we were going to wait more than ten minutes. After being seated quickly, the servers were team players, happy and funny. The food blew my mind however. Hectors polenta was culinary crack and the meatball sub was fabulous. My girlfriends vegie burger was also wonderful and hearty. I will be back.
author: Charles G.

description: Yes it convenient to the theatre but the food is average. Except for the Korean tacos, all the food seems purchased from a cheap supplier and is fried and assembled with speed.
author: Joel S.

description: Came down from Rocklin to see Book of Mormon. A stagehand at the Orpheum recommended Sam's. Said Orpheum staff eat there all the time. Place was full but only took 15 minutes to get seated. Staff was great. Food was excellent. The Jerk Chicken was excellent. I know where I'll be dining the next time I come down for a show.
author: Jimi F.

description:
We went for breakfast at an actual breakfast hour (between 8 and 9) and while there were plenty of people there, it wasn't overcrowded or anything.  Our standard breakfast fare, however, took so long to arrive (and we were starving!) that the kitchen definitely seemed overtaxed.

The French toast was bland and very eggy (as yellow as an omlette?  a bit weird) and the hash browns seemed a bit undercooked, though the eggs over easy came out well.  The coffee was, you know, diner coffee.  Hot. The service was good, but that's not enough to make me go back, not unless it's the only place open (hey, I've been desperate before with diners and I'm sure I will be again).
author: Lisa S.

description: We were running late for a recent show at the Orpheum and went in Sam's simply because it was conveniently close. The restaurant was full and there were two parties waiting, so it didn't look promising. The waitress (didn't catch her name) was very friendly and said she would do the best she could to get us seated - even giving us menus to look at while we waited. As soon as a table opened up, the manager (Gabby) got it cleaned, seated us, took our orders, and had our food out to us faster than I thought possible. The meal was great, and we made it to the show in the nick of time with full stomachs. Excellent!
author: larry r.

description:
Solid diner food. Hubby is a big fan of the breakfast burrito sans sour cream. We like to hit Sam's at least once a month. 

They have a range of healthy to ye olde diner fare, including daily specials like roast beef, roasted chicken, etc. They also serve breakfast all day, which is always a plus in my book. 

We consider ourselves regulars. :) Three stars is as high as I can do - it's a diner but it does the job just fine!
author: Jean L.

description:
I don't like to write bad reviews. I especially don't like to write bad reviews of independent authentic diner type restaurants in San Francisco, because they're few and far between in this city of caramelized drizzled arugula that gets plated for the mere pittance of $34.95 plus the health care surcharge at fine establishments all over town. 

I LOVE places like Sam's Diner. I've been to Sam's quite a few times now because the food is excellent. But, more than once, the service has been horrible. And today was the worst of all.

Knowing that the service can be slow to slovenly (even though the waiters/waitresses usually look like they're about to break the sound barrier) I asked my friend who arrived first to order for me; I get an hour for lunch, no wiggle room. She sat down. After a few minutes of feeling invisible, she flagged down a waitress, who said, "I'm not your server-- can you wait five minutes?" Five minutes later, another waitress did come by. My friend said she wanted to order for two people (I was still racing to get there). The waitress said, "Why don't you wait until the other person gets here!!!!????!"

Um, maybe because we know from bitter experience that service at Sam's can be slower than fossilized molasses. And anyway, why do you care? Just take the order!

Then I arrive and, oh holy miracle, the food arrives a few minutes after I do.

The water, though, got there before me. Small glasses, half full. Note to Sam's: if your servers have trouble getting to all their tables at reasonable intervals, they should probably FILL the water glasses to brimming the first time. Because it might be the last time.

The food, as usual, was good. We managed to spend some time talking about something besides the horrific service we were getting.  At one point I even sighted our waiter and somehow conveyed to him the fact that I needed more water. He brought it right away ('right away' at Sam's means 'in less than ten minutes'). But just as he started to rush off again I bit on something hard and plasticky in my sandwich. I pulled it out. It was plastic. I immediately got another jolt of plastic from the same mouthful and removed that too. After two or three tries I got the waiter to stop and listen to my story. He earnestly took the plastic and huddled with another server, then disappeared again for ten minutes.

That was the last we heard of the plastic. No free meal. No discount. No apology. It was as if, like the service at Sam's, the plastic simply didn't exist. 

My friend wanted me to complain, and almost took matters into her own hands. But I told her that if the plastic was not acknowledged I would just make sure to write a review of Sam's. 

Sam's is one of those places where sometimes they bring you the check and sometimes they just expect you to pay at the register in front. As my lunch hour was by now rapidly dwindling, I asked our waiter how I should pay the bill this time. He said "I'll bring you the check!"

Five minutes. Ten. Twelve. We walked to the front register. He was there, cheerfully ringing up our bill. Such service!

He said, "Thanks, folks! Have a great day!" We said nothing. Until we got out on the sidewalk. Even then our angry words were cut short by the fact that I had to rush back to work.

We did decide that the best service at Sam's seems to coincide with the presence of the owner/manager (I'm not sure of her actual title). Of course, she was not there on this fated day.

Oh Sam's, I love your food. But not your service.
author: Robert C.

description: Ashley was amazing.  She took over when our waiter totally forgot about us.  She was the only one that filled our coffee and water.  This is a great breakfast place, if you're looking for diner food in the Tenderloin.  We had the veggie omlette and the eggs Benedict.  Both were excellent.  Came back later in the evening for drinks and snacks with my nephews.  It was still busy, and fun.  The service was good that night.  The beer was good too!
author: Chuck M.

description:
I've been back to Sam's a few times recently and the food quality has seriously dropped.

-Chicken Teriyaki
Bland, not enough sauce, small portions, overpriced, and they were out of dumplings so they switched it for broccoli. Not a fair trade at all!

-Veggie Burrito
This USED TO BE REALLY GOOD. But the last time I had one, it was seriously 80% STUFFED WITH PLAIN WHITE RICE. I was hoping for a salad stuffed in a tortilla, but ended up with a bland carb-fest. Also, VEGGIE BURRITO + COFFEE + TIP = $14. Think about that... I feel that's overpriced... $10 for a vegetarian burrito? I'm going to Taqueria Cancun from now on. 

-Three Chuck Burger and French Fries
OK. If you LOVE French Fries, go to Munch Haven. They have 1000000% times better french fries than Sam's. Seriously, Sam's fries are terrible and bland. The burger is still amazing, but honestly I want to take the three chuck burger to-go and buy the french fries at Munch Haven. 

So after living on Market and 8th for a while, I can safely say there are WAY better and cheaper places to go to than Sam's. 

Sam's Diner = Bland.
author: kevin l.

description: Just like home cooking if your relatives are tweakers!
author: chip m.

description:
Two restaurants on the same block.
Two claims of "the best breakfast in town".
Two hungry siblings.

Let the brunch battle begin.

First up was Sam's. Having enjoyed my sandwich last month I had high hopes they were gonna deliver on the hype. Sis and I settled on the french toast, topped with strawberries of course. Portions were generous, proactively splitting across two plates was nice, and price was reasonable. Quality? Eh. Grandma makes 'em just as good using Trader Joe's variety.

On to Round 2 (http://www.yelp.com/biz/munch-haven-san-francisco#hrid:B3P4yLnEaqlM4LykoNPHAw).
author: Jason B.

description: Great food.  Very personable staff.  Wanted apple pie one visit and they were out.  Wanted Blue Moon beer this visit - they were out.
author: Jeanne F.

description:
I was kind of stoked to try Sam's--the bare walls and fake flowers lent an ambiance of classic middle-of-the-country family restaurant, and the photo menu made me nostalgic for many adolescent hours wasted at Waffle Hut--but Sam let me down.

The place does basics just fine, so my eggs-over-medium, hashbrowns and english muffin were quite tasty.  I might even call the hashbrowns the best I've had in SF.  However...

We rarely saw any server, and my benedict-obsessed brunch buddy had to suffer thru eggs benedict atop *untoasted* muffins.  The humanity!  And atop this, it's no cheaper than any other brunch spot in the 'hood.  Go for the 'browns or not at all.
author: Dana S.

description: the service is exceptional. we arrived around 6:40 for a quick bite before an 8pm show at the orpheum. we were most graciously greeted and seated quickly. unfortunately, bec of it being an extremely but typically busy show night, the full menu was not available. my trio of sliders were okay. fries were excellent and the portion was perfect. hubby's coney dog with homemade chili was alright. the homemade chili was a bit different, but hey, to each cook his own!  there seemed to be an awful lot of bare bun for what was there. the teensy, petite waitress was out of this world - friendly, quick and efficient. we were outathere by 7:30, in plenty of time for the half-block walk to the theatre.
author: Diane C.

description:
Lunch is ok; for the little cash. Quick and super friendly diner.    
I like getting breakfast for lunch.  Try and see if the cook can make you breakfast chicken apple sausages,Eggs, home fries for lunch.  Sometimes he will make it and most of the time he won't. Or, ask if the cook can make a sausage sandwich. This is kinda off the menu but when I gotta have it, I'll ask.
author: Bert K.

description: We were in San Francisco 2 days after Christmas for "Dead and Company" concerts at the Bill Graham.  We were astounded that nothing in the general area was open to accommodate the throng of people that were converging upon the area!  It was chance (and desperation) that had us wander in to Sam's Diner!  What a boon for us!  Although a little pricey for the average "dead head" ...the place was mobbed!   At times, the line to be seated was out the door, but the staff was both gracious and expedient in getting everyone in and fed before the shows!   We ate at the bar, because we couldn't get a table, but still ordered from the full menu...and the service was amazing.  We had the opportunity to eat 2 other meals in San Francisco that were pre-arranged, but had we known about Sam's in advance we would've opted to eat there each and every time!  Now, back in L.A. we wish they had a location here. We would be regular customers!   Hopefully Dead and Co. will be returning to their New Year's Eve shows in San Francisco...and we will find ourselves in Sam's once again!  (We are sorry it took so long to post this! However, it should be obvious that the impression that was made upon us was a good and a lasting one!) GO TO SAM'S!
author: bonnie b.

description:
See! This is why I love Yelp. Before watching Wicked, I researched quick and good food around the Orpheum Theatre and found Sams Diner. 

So this is how it went (the show started at 8 p.m.):

7:10 ish- Arrived in restaurant and sat down in our booth.

7:13 ish- Waiter took our order and even asked if we were going to the show. He suggested fast dishes so it wouldn't take too long to make since he knew the show started at 8 p.m.. *Brownie Points!*  My husband ordered the Nachos and I ordered a side of Onion Rings. 

7:20- We received our food. Yes, it was quick! The onion rings were delicious and my husband's nachos were pretty good. 

7:40- We got done with our food and paid the check. 

If you like running waiters & waitresses, this is the place to go. I only saw 3 people running the whole restaurant (and it was busy) and they managed to get the job done. 

Overall, great service & good food.
author: AnnaMarie S.

description:
I'm a regular here. This place is solid and dependable.

The spicy pork sandwich is somewhat unique...highly recommended.

AND you can get a chicken fried steak here for breakfast, which isn't the easiest thing to find in SF.
author: Essron J.

description:
Wanted the french toast but I felt it was a little to much money. So, went with "the bomb" breakfast burrito and it was good but needed more cheese. It's called The Bomb so make it amazing! It was a little dry and needed an extra side of sour cream to help with the goodness. 

Bacon was good.  Coffee was good. Staff was nice but a little slow on service. Slow on refilling the soda. 

Overall we might be back but there are so many other places to try so you really need to be awesome for us to come back.
author: Mel W.

description:
Thee BEST breakfast joint in SF...not kidding.  My honey and I come here whenever we are craving for a delicious filling breakfast.  We always get the Italian sausage omelet.  It comes with your choice of hash browns or potatoes (both are good) and toast.  I guarantee that you will be FULL and SATISFIED after this.  I've also tried their veggie omelet which is also delicious.  My honey has ordered some different items before...such as bacon, ham, etc. and has never complained.  

As always the only con I have is their cleanliness.  But keep in mind, I have OCD with germs.  

Oh, and this place is totally affordable.  We've also been meaning to try this place for lunch or dinner, when I do, I will update my review.
author: Cin W.

description: I had a great experience here today. The food was good but our waitress was the best part. My mom lost her wallet and we went back to look for it. Couldn't find it and Katherine, our waitress took our number and called us back a couple hours later. We found our wallet. She was so kind and went out of her way!!!! Good people ;)
author: Caroline M.

description: Hungry and only an hour before going to watch Wicked so we hurry in.  Loco moco for dinner was pretty good, happy to see it on the menu, but their nachos were pretty eh, but we just ate them all because it was there.  Won't order those again if there is a next time.  For some reason Burger King might've been a better option maybe.  Oh well.
author: Emy B.

description:
Working on Market St, you hear about places to eat. At first I resisted eating diner food because immediately I thought the prices were a little much for what they served. 

But eventually I had to try this place-I ordered a Chicken Avocado Melt Sandwich with Fries-ABSOLUTELY LOVEDD IT! The buttered pan toasted rye bread with cheddar cheese and minced chicken, celery and avocado was the BEST SANDWICH/LUNCH MEAL i have ever had this entire summer! I want to come back to that place everyday!
author: Danielle B.

description:
Located right out of the Civic Center Bart station Sam's is a decent place to come and grab a bite to eat. I think the times that I have come to try the breakfast it has been quite pleasant. 

They have seating on the left and counter seating to the right. 

The people here are friendly who work here. I do find that when I have come here there are people on both sides enjoying a meal or coffee. 

(Seems like regulars too) 

I do find that the prices are reasonable and they are quite quick with service. The portions are good. The pancakes are good,eggs I got was cooked just right and bacon nice and crispy. Hashbrowns,very lovely,tasty and good portion. 

This place is nothing fancy,but I like greasy diner food with reasonable prices and also I think they have a happy hour too. 

P.S They also have a burger too. Now,that isn't so bad is it. 

Very friendly service again and food not that bad.
author: Dani D.

description:
I went here for brunch. The staff was friendly if a little unrefined; but hey, this is a diner on Market street, not Farallon.

Everything arrived relatively quickly.

I ordered the french toast which was delicious. Very well prepared and tasty.

Why the three stars?

One star down for what I was served when I asked for cranberry juice. It tasted like liquid sugar and red food coloring, which was probably exactly what that was. I could just dump a packet of sugar into my mouth with water for the same effect. It was sweetly disgusting and I didn't drink any of it after my first sip. Making cranberry juice is brain-dead simple: cranberry concentrate + water and ice. Add a little sugar for the average American's sweet tooth (I never do this at home but I like it tart). It shouldn't taste like Hawaiian Punch syrup.

I ordered some eggs, done over hard. The eggs had plenty of blackened bits on them which gave them a strong and unpleasant flavor. They need to clean their cooking grill more often!

Will I go back? Not sure; if I do I certainly won't order any cranberry juice.
author: Eric v.

description: Loved it. Was a great little place to walk to from our hotel. Breakfast was good.
author: Iris R.

description: Service ranks zero stars, we consistently got ignored.  Do not even think about standing outside while waiting for a table, the gal just softly calls names out, does not go outside to check if the party is waiting outside. When we went to see where our name was on the list, it was crossed out. There is basically no room to wait inside, if you do you get in the way of the employees.  Avoid this place if you value your time.
author: Kimo L.

description:
Came here with a group of 8 before going to see The Lion King at the Orpheum. It's a block away from the Orpheum, and honestly the only classy place around (there's a Burger King and a Carl's Junior nearby too). We went in without a reservation and had to wait so that they could accommodate us (no big deal). The walls are decorated with signed posters of all the past shows from the Orpheum, Curran, and Golden Gate Theatres (soo cool!!!). 
The menu had "Lion King Specials" (very cute) and all sounded very delicious. We all ordered a variety of dishes from the menu and were all very pleased. I ordered a burger, and it was delicious and juicy medium rare (just how I like it). Our waiter was very attentive and helpful, especially when it came to splitting the check. 
Overall a great place to go if going to see a show at the Orpheum. It's very clean and the staff is incredibly polite. Will be coming back when the next Orpheum show comes in.
author: Mitchell Q.

description: Always walked by this place and finally my GF and I gave it a shot. We got seated quickly on a Saturday (brunch) time. It took 30 mins. to receive our order. When the food finally came, it was tasteless! So disappointing, granted the fact that we waited so long and the food was not even worth the wait. Never coming back again.
author: Raciel A.

description:
Not bad! We came here for a quick lunch before our "Wicked" show across the way at the Orpheum. We almost dined at the restaurant at the hotel across the street, but opted to eat here instead. It's not much to look at from the exterior, but we were pleasantly surprised by this little diner as we stepped in. It felt cozy and a place where 'regulars' frequent. 

The menu had a lot of variety... from everything breakfast, to teriyaki plates, Korean BBQ, burgers, salad, pasta, hot and cold sandwiches, jambalaya, even fried chicken! I agree w/ another reviewer that the menu makes you want to order breakfast, no matter what time of the day it is... it all looks soooo appetizing! Alas, I didn't want to fall into a food coma and be rendered utterly useless for the next couple hours so I resisted the urge.

We were on a time crunch, with less than 30 minutes to order, eat, and finish before our show began, so we all ordered "easy" items. One of us had the Tuna sandwich w/ fries, 2 of us had the Club House w/ fries (myself included), and my sister had the Philly Cheese Steak w/ a green salad. My sister and I split our plates with each other so we could have a little bit of both =]. We all scarfed our food down, partly because we were in a rush and partly because everything tasted great. 

Service was fine. I would come back again if I were in the area catching a show at the theater. It has a mom and pop feel to it, and a nice option to have besides the Burger King next door and the Grill across the street. Before tip it was a little over $38 for our food [with water only].
author: Pearl V.

description: Strange experience at Sam's Diner today.  We enjoy going to this restaurant before seeing a show at the Orpheum.  Today I was happy to bring a friend here for the first time, before a "Wicked" matinee,  and the food was tasty for both of us, but the Cobb Salad I ordered was incomplete.  Halfway through eating it, I realized that it didn't have avocado on it.  I flagged the waitress down and asked her if the Cobb salad should have avocado on it, and she said, "No." Thinking I must have been mistaken, I kept eating, but something told me to check the menu.  When I did, I realized it was missing both the avocado AND the bacon.  When I flagged her down again, and showed her the menu, she apologized, took the half-eaten salad back to the kitchen and came back with it now with avocado and bacon on top.  Of course, the salad wasn't as good as it otherwise would have been, since it was now somewhat overbalanced with those ingredients.  I thought it was very strange that a waitress should be so unfamiliar with what she was serving.  But I'll go back.
author: Tricia T.

description: Had lunch here last week.  Simple, basic diner fare.  Had the philly cheesesteak.  Good sized portion and wasn't bad.  Potato salad is closer to mashed potatoes in texture but ok.  Choice of table or counter.  Free refills on soda.  Fast service.  Sitting at the counter lets you see the cooks perform their magic.  Always impressed how cooks keep the orders coming.  If you need a filling lunch fast not a bad place to eat.
author: Edward V.

description: Let me just say this is by far one of the best diner experiences I have ever had! My sister and I were staying downtown and needed a solid breakfast to get our day started. From the moment we walked in the service was prompt! After having our mouths water over basically the whole menu I decided to order eggs benedict with a side of bacon and my sis ordered a crab sandwhich melt. The food was FABULOUS! It was so flavorful and came out piping hot! Our waitress never left our beverages half empty and constantly checked on us to see if we needed anything, as a mater of fact all of the waitress checked in on us. This is some of the best service I have had in years, I was talking to the waitress and she said she would for go her tip as long as we promissed to revue this place on yelp, well we left a 20% tip and there was no way I could not let people who plan on eating at this place know how great it is. They are owned by a korean women who is also one of the head chefs, so they have lots of yummy korean fusion items on the menu. If your looking for solid comfert food with a twist, SAMS DINER is the place to go!
author: Camille W.

description:
when i was in high school i went of a school trip to SF and we stayed at the  Whitcomb Hotel and Sams Dinner is right across the street i got up one morning to have breakfast with my friends and the food was good if i ever go back to SF ill go to SAMS DINNER !!

i got the pancakes breakfast and bacon , eggs, and hashbrowns and orange juice  highly recommend
author: Karina G.

description: No no no. Too bad this experience ruined SAMs for me. Slow service, took 10+ mins just to have our order taken. Ordered the spinach and mushroom omelet, had wayyyy to much cheese and was undercooked. Bad texture all around. -_-
author: Cori W.

description:
Like Anna D, we also went here before seeing Wicked after my friend did some research on Urban Spoon.  We were NOT disappointed.  The food was great, low cost, and timely.  The wait staff was incredibly friendly and fast, and even gave us a break on the dessert price.  

Word to the wise - don't order the peach cobbler.  Not because it's bad, but because they actually don't have it anymore.  Our waiter said they need to take it off the menu and was very apologetic about it.  

I'd go back again in a minute.  There was so much on the menu that I wanted to try.  I had the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and it was delicious.   I'm rarely in that neighborhood, but I know that if I find myself nearby again, I'm making a bee line for SAM's!
author: Trisha F.

description:
I live within walking distance to SAM's and during the two years that I have lived in my current apartment I have eaten here at least once a week.

Pros:
--If I am eating at a diner, I do not have expectations of a remarkable culinary experience, I am looking for the basics.  In this sense, I am more impressed by well executed service, eggs, bacon, toast, burger etc...than I am by a menu that is extensive or exquisite.  In this regard, I think SAM's offers a well made breakfast.  There are some nice surprises like a really well made hollandaise sauce for their eggs benedict, and burgers that have a really nice lean-to-fat ratio.

--The sports games you want to watch are always on at the black granite bar.

--Happy hour selection of food/drinks for after work.

--Well made soups by the owner's mother that are made in small batches and often overlooked.

Cons:
--It is hard to branch out away from the basics here, spaghetti dishes and quesadillas taste like homemade (not in the way you'd really like) and salads are not markedly fresh.  The one exception is a hamburger called The Chuck Three, a  cheeseburger with mushroom, avocado and bacon that is a heart-clogging-i-don't-care-if-i-die-because-im-already-in-heaven kinda thing.

--The staff here can, at times, be incredibly rude.  During my last visit I was tired from work and wanted to get-in-get-out with some food.  An Asian waitress came over to me and said "Oh, you finally learned how to order one meal at a time?" snidely which left me completely shocked, and sadly, not wanting to spend any more money at this place.

Overall, a solid diner that will meet your needs for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Prices are decent and essential dishes made well.
author: Martin C.

description: I came here last night, before watching American Idiot at the Orpheum, with a few friends. We all ended up getting the Phillly Cheese Steak and the Fried Chicken. I personally go the Fried Chicken and it was probably one of the most crispy fried chicken I have ever had. It had a slight sweetness which was quite surprising--the menu said it was a honey based batter. The portion was also pretty generous. The breast was slightly dry, but my other friend said his was not. The leg, thigh, and wing was prefect! My friends said the Philly was pretty good as well. Even though it was busy, the staff was friendly and prompt. I will definitely have to come back and try the rest of the menu.
author: alfred c.

description:
I loved this place.  Was going to the area to watch Wicked and wanted a nearby place to eat.  We chose this place since it was conveniently the next block over from the theater.  

They had good service-always checking on our needs and also even stopping by for a short chat.  I think that's pretty good for having a party of 6 and being at the diner during dinner rush.  

FOOD: the food was awesome! Had the New York Steak Sandwich and it was beyond great.  Had some of my daughter's chicken strips as well and I consider myself a chicken strip connoisseur...and well, her strips was great.  They batter their own cut of chicken.   You can tell the food is all made from scratch.  

Overall: *2 thumbs up*-I would definitely recommend and I would definitely return.
author: Love M.

description:
Before I went to watch Wicked, I came here for a brief dinner and ordered a French Dip.  I didn't really mind the wait since the place was nearly full and there wasn't a lot of waitresses to help offset the load.  For the price though, the proportions of food weren't all that great.  However, it was definitely better than paying $5 for Skittles and a bottle of water inside the Orpheum.

Definitely a decent place to eat if fast food isn't a choice in this area.
author: Ren L.

description: If the food wasn't good enough, the service makes it even better. Never been there before in my life and they made me feel like family.  Love these people.
author: Mike H.

description:
I was walking down Market w/ a friend after a job fair and we saw Sam's Diner.  This is a Korean diner, not Greek diner like on the east coast. We grabbed a seat at the counter and received service and drinks promptly.

I ordered fries and an iced tea while my friend 2 eggs OE. 20-25 mins. later (a bit long, even if it is lunchtime) they arrived.   

The fries were fine and his eggs looked good, but his toast wasn't very toasted and his hash browns were not very browned.  I'm sure he would have to just ask, as they were very nice and accommodating.
author: Heather S.

description: We were looking for a good breakfast place with reasonable prices and hopefully good service. Those rarely all pay off as a package - especially for a diner by the civic center and facing right onto Market. Sam's really paid off though. The ladies hosting and serving were well choreographed and very friendly even though it was busy. We were in and out in under 45 minutes. The food was good and the bill surprisingly light. I'm sure they occasionally get slammed like anybody else but they've got it down from our take.
author: David M.

description: Very disappointing, Terrible service, super long wait for dry eggs and burnt ground beef in my Joe's Special.  So much wanted to like this place, but can't say I'd go back.
author: Lorraine Crespo P.

description: Have only had breakfast at Sam's, but LOVE IT! We try to eat there any time we are visiting SF. The new interior decor was a nice surprise this time. The decor is now is as good as the food. Service is excellent. Even when understaffed, they worked hard to try to attend to everyone's needs and thanked us for our patience. Highly recommend!
author: Rich M.

description: Have to drop them from 5 starts to 2.  Lately they seem too busy chatting among themselves to take care of service.  If you order a burger and fries, shouldn't they know to cook the fries and burger so it's ready together?  Instead, the burger is ready and then (oops) they didn't lower the basket of potatoes into the oil.  That's basic cooking 101.  something changed here - used to be great service.  Now a lot of workers, but not very efficient..  Then something weird going on with the cash.  They never seem to be able to just ring you up and take money.  They go asking other staff to make change which they often do from the pockets in their aprons...  wonder if the boss knows.
author: Em J.

description: I was just in SF for the first time this past weekend. The doorman at our hotel told us to be sure and check this place out, gee thanks guy! This was not a good place to eat. On the plus side, our server was nice. But bad food is bad food and no amount of personality can change that.
author: Bridget V.

description: It was a Sunday, yes, but the experience was very underwhelming. Very disorganized, and we didn't even get to eat, because even after an hour, the food was not ready. All I ordered was scrambled eggs and bacon, and as we all know, that takes little to no time at all. Very disappointing, and messed up my day, oddly enough. :-/
author: Anne W.

description: This place is fine in my book.  Nothing too exciting, but food is good, service is friendly, it's reasonably quick.  A classic, unassuming diner.
author: Samuel F.

description: This has got to be one of the best diner's ever ! Great service and the best food! Everything is homemade and prepped the same day! Burgers, Korean fish Tacos, meat loaf, gravy, broccoli soup etc. can't go wrong with any of it! Will be back next trip!
author: Mary B.

description: This place is perfect! I know, I know, you will see that this is my first review ... but I've never wanted to craft a review before. Until now!!! You have to check out this little jewel, and (although not on the menu) you MUST order the Cherry Pie Milkshake (boy was I lucky to have already heard about that chunky drink al-l'amore)! OMG, is that shake like drinking a little bit of heaven through a straw right here on earth! Sorry Presbyterians for being sacrilegious, but the Cherry Pie Milkshake is truly angelic!!!
author: Big Red E.

description:
I was staying at the Hotel Whitcomb and, spoiled by the bounty of the Alemany Farmer's Market, thought I'd get breakfast at the Civic Center Farmer's Market.  Alas, the waffle truck was nowhere to be found, and the market was one of those fruit and veggie only ones.  And I was HONGRY!

So I sighed and went into Sam's.  Which was fine.  The host/manager/waiter was very friendly and nice, and the food was decent diner food.  It was a wee bit pricey for the location and ambiance, but as he was the only one nearby serving breakfast, I guess he can do as he likes.

I wouldn't go out of my way to go back to Sam's, but if you're at the Whitcomb and don't want to go far, it's an OK option.
author: Andi T.

description:
I work between 10th & 11th on Mission, so when I crave cheap burgers, fries (and sweet & sour pork), I head to Betty's Cafeteria ($3.99 cheesburger, fries, and soda).

But, my work wife thinks they're disgusting, so we went to Sam's Diner up around 8th & Market.

Sam's is pretty good; good selection of tidily made foodstuffs, unnervingly cute waitresses who were very friendly, and the food was tasty enough.  And they had Tobasco sauce.

My medium-rare burger came out pink and juicy (horrifying my work wife), but pleasing me immensely.

They come up short on the coffee (*horrible*) and the absence of waffles to accompany their fried chicken.  But they're a great choice for American diner grub around Civic Center which is a little Chinese/Vietnamese heavy these days..,.
author: Martin W.

description: This is one of our regular stops in SF. This morning, the sandwich I had was not the usual quality I expect here. I didn't plan on saying anything, but a guy who I think is the owner noticed I hadn't eaten much. He coaxed the problem with the sandwich out of me & insisted that it be taken off the bill. Who offers customer service like that? The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't the way theirs usually is. He actually thanked ME for bringing it to his attention! I love this place!
author: Julie D.

description: This place is awesome and the staff is the best. I've eating a few things here and have never been disappointed. It's a total diner, but the staff is incredible!!!! Can't wait to go back.
author: Troy H.

description: Good diner food. Fast service. The house burger was huge and tasty. Everything you would want in diner type food.
author: Steve K.

description: I was visiting San Francisco on a business trip.  My hotel was across the street so I looked Sam's Diner up on Yelp!!!  Reviews were good so I ordered take-out.  I ordered the Mac & Cheese dinner......very good!!! The space is small but, cozy.  FYI - this part of town isn't the greatest, but you'll be OK.
author: Cindy R.

description: I am now a regular at Sam's Diner, At first when I met my friends there I was skeptical.  The area is not the hottest, and the outside appearance of the diner itself wasn't much to look at. However we continued on because my friend who is Sort-of-a foodie assured me the food was awesome, and he was right.. well give it a shot.. I've never seen a more welcoming group of waiters and waitresses than this place has. They treated us like we were the only customers and they had all the time in the world to treat us amazing and get our order right. It was like you're about to sit down at grandmas house and eat. and service was quick and the food was really really good!! I don't know If I was hungry but the breakfast I devoured was probably one of the best breakfasts I've ever tasted..  It was a really good experience and the reason I keep coming back week after week after week is mostly because the wait staff are so amazing and they had a way of making you feel  like you are the most important person in the diner!!  If you haven't tried it yet, I encourage you to check this place out because you will be surprised and impressed.
author: Jason E.

description:
Overall a decent place to eat. 

I was with a friend to watch Wicked at the nearby Orpheum Theater and we wanted to grab a bite before the show. We decided to give this place a shot since it didn't look too grungy or too expensive. 

Walking in, you notice the bright artwork adorning the walls and the small booths for eating. There were only two women waiting tables and taking turns as the cashier, but the wait to sit or to get our order taken was not a problem. 

I decided to get the "Wicked special", which consisted of an avocado cheeseburger, fries, soda, and ice cream for $9.95.  I actually did not finish the fries and the burger, nor did I get to the ice cream (choice of vanilla, strawberry, or chocolate), but I was satisfied.

On a side note, one waitress said "wow you look full" when I was a little more than halfway through my meal. I wasnt sure how I was supposed to take that comment, but it did not take away from my experience.
author: Joseph A.

description: My wife and I ate here three times during our stay in San Francisco. For lunch I had their fried chicken plate and the crust on the chicken had sugar as an ingredient so that the crust was super crunchy and slightly sweet. My wife had one of their sandwiches with au jus on the side and she loved it. Then we had breakfast twice (once because another place we were wanting to go was closed due to relocation). Their breakfast plates were big and affordable and gave us enough fuel to keep us going until lunch while we ran around the city sightseeing. This is a little hole in the wall place but feels like a country diner.
author: Steve M.

description:
Sam's has brought it's A-game lately. The food is so comforting, and I'll admit, I'm a regular again. I'm getting over a cold currently, and they waiters were really nice, prompt, and welcoming today. Yes it's diner food, but that's what they excel at, I don't see why anyone would expect anything else.

Side story: Last weekend my roommate and I sat at Sam's, horrified, as some snooty theatre-goer asked for some red wine and a glass of ice. She proceeded to spoon the ice into her wine. Now that's just red wine sacrilege!
author: Mel M.

description:
Stopped by for a late Sunday brunch. Surprisingly, the place was busy but there were rooms for a couple more. 
I chose the short stack pancakes with 2 eggs, bacon, and bananas. Yum.
Boyfriend got the chicken fried steak with potatoes. Yummy!

They have art works on the wall, so it's nice and colorful to check em out (not to mention it's a diner) so it's cool.

Soon we got to be happy and full, so can't ask for much more. After all it's just a diner with regular diner menu and regular diner price. Price and portions are just right in my opinion.
author: Gabriele A.

description: Been coming to Sam's for years when we visit San Francisco.  Awesome breakfast, burgers, fried chicken, club sandwich, chicken teriyaki, and, more recently, the Korean tacos!   So glad that they now open for dinner...also excellent draft beer selection : )  Friendly staff despite chaos during peak breakfast and lunch times.  With their updated remodel, it's truly an OASIS within the City Hall / Public Library / Theater district of San Francisco!!
author: CW L.

description: My husband I came here last night before The Book of Mormon, and were a bit concerned by the line, and the amount of tables still without food. We put our name on the list and hoped for the best. The host was very nice and apologized several times for the wait. We did manage to get a table, and the rest went very smoothly as far as ordering and getting our food. I had the the Truffle Chicken sandwich and my husband had the Blue Cheese burger. Both dishes came out piping hot. Mine was a bit over cooked, but I was able to get past that. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Had lunch here on Sunday before going to the matinee of Mamma Mia. The place was packed full of patrons. We had to wait a long time for a booth for the 3 of us. My advise to everyone if you have to be somewhere at a certain time get in here really early to give you enough time to enjoy your meal. Our meals were fantastic but we had to wait a long time for our food so we had to eat really fast in order to get to the theater in time. We know better next time to get there in plenty of time. You'll love the food, give it a try.
author: gloria g.

description:
I just moved to SF and I always try to find unique, quality restaurants to try out. I have worked in the restaurant service industry for ten years.  My bartender's name was Jacob, and I felt compelled to give him a shout out for his exceptional service and his contagious positive attitude. It is easy to find a restaurant with great food (I had the Korean tacos and they were amazing), however, GREAT employees are hard to come by and even harder to keep around. This guy, Jacob, was an example of the ladder! He recommended a local OBC IPA and the Korean Tacos. Both were delicious. He was also very personable and was easy to talk with. Very genuine. He even remembered my name (which is not a typical name). He went above and beyond to make sure I enjoyed my visit.  This post will likely not get him a raise, but it is in his bosses best interest to give him one, because this guy has the right attitude to get a job at any high-end restaurant in the city. I will definitely return to this restaurant for dinner sometime as well as recommend it to my friends. Thanks again, Jacob.
-JD
author: J. Michael D.

description:
Walk of shame
Hangover
Scrambled eggs 
Empty pocket 
no wallet
no card
horrified
info exchanged
pay ya later
out with a smile...

Steven's Cafe-adequate food.  Awesome people.
author: R M.

description:
Aw, my poor neighborhood diner is getting no love.  All I can say is that when it's a weekend morning and I'm too hung over to leave my immediate zip code, they're right across the street and they pack up my greasy American breakfast to go.

Nobody else can do that because they're not brave enough to set up shop in the economic wasteland I live in.
author: Cassio P.

description:
I've been coming to Sam's for a couple of years now, it's one of those places where you can get a great meal but don't need reservations, don't feel like dressing up is necessary, very casual, next to the Civic Center BART station and the food is just consistently great! 
The owner is wonderful, always says hi, the wait staff are exceptional and treat you with respect, always a good mix of folks from Euro tourists staying across the street at the local hotel and locals looking for good food that won't break the piggy bank.
This evening I brought my out of town friend to Sam's for dinner, we both loved the Chicken and Beef Teriyaki with steamed rice and veggies, salad came with it for all of $10 and some change. 
If you want a good value meal and are in the civic center area, Sam's is the place to go.
author: David P.

description:
The BEST place to have breakfast in SF! We were recommended this place by James the doorman at Hotel Whitcomb. So glad he did.

The food was great, just like home cooking. Portions were great and everything was made to order. The service was a little slow but we were not in any hurry. 

The prices were EXCELLENT, a family of four could all have a very nice breakfast for about $40!
author: Sisn W.

description:
Ahhh Steven's.... 

So we are now under new management!  We've gotten a paint job and some new decor.  The wait staff is different.  But...

The food's the same.  As others have said, not for the foodie food critic in you.  But, if you want a decent Turkey Burger and some Fries - Steven's is the place.

I think they changed their name to Sam's Diner.....
author: Jim S.

description: I'm embarrassed to say that I've lived 2 blocks from Sam's Diner for nearly 20 years, and just started going a couple of years ago. I assumed everything on that block of Market with disgusting and grimy.  Lo and behold, it's a most delish standard fare diner.  Classic extensive all-American menu, complete with real ice cream shakes for the kiddo.  Service can be a little slow, but they're super nice peeps, and that's worth a star for me.
author: Jen L.

description: Great place for a reasonably priced meal.  We live on the Peninsula and go to Sam's when we are in the Civic Center area.  Only problem is that at peak times they are really crowded and there is not a big dining area.  So if you are going to a play or concert, just give yourself plenty of time.  Last time my wife had the great Korean Fish Taco's and I had the Fish and Chips.  Other times I have the chicken which is also very good.  Extensive menu.  Once seated service is fast, food is quite good.
author: Dave K.

description: GREAT burgers. Love SLIDERS. Love MORE--Sam's Diner Burgers!! Big, hand made from FRESH hamburger, grilled to perfection, JUICEY!!! This comes on a large bun. I have to think the buns are custom made. So, if you're not really hungry, don't get the fries w/ it!! The fries are plentiful and CRISPY!! For 2 people-- 2 cheeseburgers, 2 fries, 2 coffees--$26 w/ tax!! Why not?? Ya-- the area is poopy. 1 Star gone for that. BUT-- we are used to this, aren't we? Nobody bothers you!! It's just not too pretty. SO WHAT!! It's 8th.&Market Sts., for crying out loud!! PERFECT for pre-show (Orpheum theatre) eats, Starbucks right across the street!!
author: Sabrina R.

description: The cheese in the ham and cheese omelet is super cheesy. I don't know how that do it, but it is awesome. The tab was a little high at $15 with tax for breakfast, but it's probably because it's San Francisco (seemed like $2 was added to the counterpart items from Austin). I guess this is why people here at my equivalent industry are making $20k more a year, lol... A little philosophical here. The place is small and doesn't have too big of a crowd. The area could be nicer and it's a bit odd that it is in this area.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
easy, friendly service. good fries. i had the hot mama's burger (with jalapeño, pepper jack and avocado). delicious and filling. total cost $9.77.

they have happy hour daily from 4 to 7pm, where all drinks are $3. drinks include red and white wine, anchor steam, blue moon, pbr, hmmm i forget the rest.

it looks like there's a very similar restaurant a few store fronts down called Munch Haven. i chose Sam's because they have booth seating.
author: Jason C.

description: Loved this spot til they raised the prices on pretty much everything on the menu by $2. Charge what you can and still keep the place full, but tacky. Good selection of beers for a diner.
author: Raina M.

description: Stopped on my way to Book of Mormon.  I had the chicken wings and an IPA and got out for 12 bucks.  The owner and her partner were very nice and clearly care about customer service.  I can't believe I've been in the hood for 5 years and never eaten here.  Looking forward to having breakfast.  Thanks for the beer tasting.
author: Joe D.

description:
This was the first diner I ate at when I moved here and I've been back a few times. 

Overall it's a nice place. The corned beef hash is very nice but the hash browns are excellent. Hash browns are one of those things you think you should be able to do perfectly well yourself but mine never taste as good as this.

Service is a bit rushed but efficient, they only made a slight mistake of one order (cranberry rather than grapefruit juice) so a solid four 1/2 stars.
author: Iain T.

description:
We looked for a place to eat after going to the Orpheum. Saw this on yelp but were not so sure about eating at a "diner". We explored other places by walking around the neighborhood (not such a wonderful area) but ended back at Sam's. SO GLAD WE DID! 
There were 3 - 4 wait staff - each and everyone was friendly, and as each of them cruised by our table, each was attentive to our needs when they passed by. It appeared that every one of them was intent on making sure we had what we needed. 
The quality of the food was exceptionally good - exceeded our expectations because of it being called a "diner." 
The onion rings were excellent as our appetizer; their "house" wine (their only wine offerings) were very good!
He ordered crab/avocado sandwich with french fries. Excellent sandwich; lots of crab and avocado. The french fries were crisp, tasty, not greasy (as good as, or even better than McDonalds - if you think MickeyD's hold the standard for ff's).
She ordered Korean Tacos - OMG - loved them! Ordered the spicy pork. He was warned by the waiter that these were very spicy - found them to be just perfect! 
Came with rice with cilantro - wow - what a great combination! Will have to do that at home!
The food and service were excellent. When we were leaving, a couple who was waiting for a table, asked us on the sly what we thought of the food. We never hesitated to tell them it was excellent, and she recommended the Korean Tacos.
If we go the Orpheum again, we will certainly return.
(FYI - check for specials associated with this restaurant if you attend a performance at the Orpheum. We didn't - we learned of this special perc afterward).
author: carl s.

description: $3 drafts 3-6pm.  friendly barstaff.  cozy oasis from Market st. riff raff.  wifi. $5 min on cards.  didn't try the grub, but it looked like perfectly decent diner fare.  maybe next time.
author: Danny N.

description: My current roommates and I are new to the Bay Area, so when we stumbled upon this place at night when everything else was closed, we were already salivating. The diner itself is situated next to a bar accessible through the entrance, and the walls are decorated with some fairly interesting paintings. Service was great and the atmosphere was appropriate. My Hot Mama! burger (I recall there was bacon and avocado in it) was delicious, though it was a bit on the pricey side (check came out to be around ~$12).
