Overall, I would recommend this little diner.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Sam's serves a bad ass breakfast. I had hashbrowns, two eggs, chicken apple sausage and sourdough toast. The hash browns nearly covered the entire plate. The eggs were huge the sausage was bigger than average and quite tasty. Yes, I know, it is quite Freudian to be delighted to have large eggs and a bigger than average sausage. The toast was also a bigger than average slice. It was all really good, as was the service and the prices.
The menu features all kinds of items, from diner staples like burgers, hot dogs, chili, to international items like teriyaki chicken. It would be hard to go wrong here or not find something, there is vegetarian and healthy options as well as the great comfort food you would expect from a diner.
author: Tim J.

description: Awful service. We had just come back from the Nike Marathon and were looking for a quick bite to eat. We were seated immediately but had to wait a good 5 minutes to even get water in a nearly empty restaurant. The server never returned to the table except to take our order and deliver our food. When one person asked for water he rolled his eyes and walked away. After finally getting our check (another very long wait) we placed two cards down to split the bill. The server came back (insert another long wait) and informed us that he was "far too busy to split our bill." Mind you, we simply asked to equally divide our $90 bill for four people between two credit cards. Slightly confused I asked one more time thinking I had misheard the server and was told that "I could obviously see he had a very busy section and he didn't want to mess with splitting a check." I was floored!! I could not believe that I was being told he was too busy to do his JOB. I've waited tables for years, splitting a check is one of the easiest things you can possibly do. It actually took longer for him to argue with us over not splitting the check than it would have taken to just split the check. I might be able to understand if there had been a lot of people, complicated orders, and multiple split tabs, but seriously? You can't split a bill for four people two ways? I still just don't get it...
author: Conrad G.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and if I need to put some kind of quick filler into my stomach, I usually go to Munch Haven (see my review) but I have been to Sam's a few times.

The food is not bad, but the service, while friendly, is pretty slow and disorganized.

Last time I stopped in, the place wasn't very crowded, and I sat at the counter with the intention of just getting a burger and reading the paper.   Thing is, I sat ignored for about 10 minutes (except for being told someone would be "right with me") while a couple of the servers literally RAN around the dining room getting salads, drinks and stuff.  

Since I was there for lunch and not the SF Waitress Track Team workout, after 10 minutes I gave up and took off for greener Munch Haven pastures.  

Sorry to say I haven't been back since, but I'm sure I'll venture over again one of these days.  Stay tuned for an update.  Perhaps someone will break the 5 minute salad-carrying mile!
author: King O.

description:
SASSY WAITRESSES 

Automatic 10 billion stars. It's not often you find those sassy waitresses anymore, let alone Asian ones. The food was awesome. Got the chicken teriyaki melt which sounds weird, but it is SO FUCKING GOOD. I WANT MOAR. 

And it's pretty well priced and they have lots of other foods. The fries were good too. Speedy. And then there was much rejoicing
author: Dustin H.

description: Cold diner food at best. Eggs Benedict looked great as we were seated, but they were served cold and congealed. Should have sent them back but was too hungry. The Korean tacos that my partner ordered were mediocre. Such a shame that Sam's isn't better, they have a great location on market... Maybe that's why they don't have to serve higher quality food.
author: P S.

description: Great place to eat breakfast. Service is a little slow because they're always busy , but the food is very tasty and the service very helpful.
author: Eileen C.

description: How did we not know about this place? Been to the Orpheum mucho times but never walked the area.  Great service, saw our Billy Elliot for tonight's show finishing his dinner.  Food was good.  Convenient, good food, great service.  We'll be back.
author: Dianne W.

description:
Perfectly acceptable food.  If you're good with standard diners, you'll like this place.  If not, avoid it.

But what makes this place amazing is the service.  The people here are the friendliest servers I know of.  ALL OF THEM.  ALL THE TIME.  I have a feeling that if the previous patron had critized their food, peed on the wall, and then held them up at gunpoint, they'd still say, "Hi!  How are you?"  with eye contact, sounding like they meant it, ten minutes later.

They're really nice people, and they make a solid lunch.  Eat at Sam's.
author: Alex C.

description: Went in to grab a quick bite before going to see the Book of Mormon.  The staff was very kind.  The foot was delicious.  I had the Cheese Stuffed Risotto Ball - DELICIOUS!  Others in my group had the cobb salad which I was told was good, and apparently a wonderful blue cheese burger.  The only issue was that it took a little bit to get our order taken, but it was busy before the show.  Understandable.  I will definitely return and bring others.  Thanks guys.  Oh yea, and they need more to go menus!  lol
author: Katey M.

description:
Have been here a few times after a night of clubbing and their food really hits the spot. Also, they have great service, the waitresses go out of their way to accommodate our silly requests.

UPDATE:
Got the salmon benedict and fruit plate. Ate most of my fruit when i saw that two of the blackberries had fungus growing out of them. Felt gross and left the rest of my food untouched. Also, I was told that my Salmon benedict would come with smoked salmon and it did not (it was fillets of salmon). Complained about it, and they didnt charge me the extra $1.5 for the fruit.
author: Maria K.

description:
This is the best place!!!!
My first time in San Fran and mind you everyday I tried something different.
But I walked past this place and at first I slightly questioned it and just went in to buy a milk jug.  Then the sweet lady offered a breakfast sandwich.  Mind you, amazing.  The best breakfast I've had throughout the whole trip.  I did a lot of walking around the town so breakfast and a late dinner is what I only ate.  And everyday since the end of my vackay I stopped there.  This is the same place not to far from the holiday inn.  Very good breakfast place, they just need to make it less whole in the wall.  Thats a place to check out.
author: Layla J.

description: This place is great & has yummy food. Last week I stopped in a few times. Twice for dinner and once for breakfast. Their Mac & cheese is so good. At first sight of the bowl it doesn't look like it will be filling but it was well more than enough. For breakfast they serve you a huge helping of hash browns  that could feed an army. Needless to say I will definitely be stopping in again next week when I'm in the city.
author: Antoinette C.

description: This was the first meal my wife and I ate when we got to SF last summer. The place was pretty hopping, and our server Kevin was handling it better than most could do. Service is friendly, the food is delicious. Hours are great. What's not to like about a city diner?
author: I W.

description: It was great food. Pancake full stack with bananas and a side of bacon. Coffee was a bit watery, but service friendly and clean environment. Would return.
author: Ash H.

description:
I have eaten here twice. The first time was breakfast with a prospective employer and I don't remember exactly what i had because i was too focused on how much i hate mixing business and food. FINISH YOUR BUSINESS AND THEN ENJOY FOOD!!!!!   I do remember the coffee and toast being basic as coffee and toast are.
The second time was about a week ago for lunch. I ordered chicken fried steak. It satisfied my hunger but wasn't amazing.  

Bottom line, friendly staff, the menu is typical diner food. and they close early at 3.
author: Don I.

description:
wandered in here one windy afternoon. not a bad place. they keep the front doors open though which makes it feel even colder. food was ok. i had a ham sammich, fries and potato salad. the salad tasted..dry..
service was good. i was here in the afternoon so the place wasn't packed but i'm sure it does around dinner time, weekends and when sport events are happening. but i'm a chick, what do i know about sports. lol!
author: Dwigt S.

description:
I've been to Sam's twice, once for Les Miserables and the other for The Book of Mormon (yes, I equate this place to plays I've seen at The Orpheum).

The first time (2012) was such a great experience.  It was an hour before the play and  my friend and I were a little stressed.  Our server was very reassuring that he'll have us out of there well in time for the play.  I even had the audacity to get the filet of sole (which I enjoyed) and not a quick sandwich.  My friend even insisted I get a dessert to celebrate my birthday.  Our server was flirty but not annoying.  The food and service were fantastic!

The second time (just last Saturday) was a different experience.  My husband and I got there around 7:00, and there were 2 parties ahead of us.  By 7:10 and we were the next up, we asked the friendly Asian hostess if we can still make it in time for our 8 pm show.  She said definitely, they'll make sure of it, as long as we already have our tickets.  By 7:15, it was clear that most of the diners have finished their meals but just killing time to leave just in time for the play (shame on you diners!) and I can tell the hostess was also getting stressed out and giving instructions to servers (to possibly encourage diners to leave?).  By 7:20, nobody has left and I told my husband there's no way we'll make it so we split (sorry!).  I realize we're at fault for not arriving earlier, that's why I'm still giving them the highest rating.

After the play, around 10:30, we decided on a whim to go back there to have some dessert (maybe for closure?).  We were seated by a very nice and charming gentleman who seemed to take care of the whole place that late in the evening.  Once we got our lava cake and coffees, my husband (again on a whim) asked if it was possible to still order food.  I nervously asked what time they close and he said in about 10 minutes but it's no problem at all.  My husband ordered the crab melt which he had been eyeing since earlier in the evening.  The gentleman (sorry I didn't catch your name!) never rushed us or made us feel uncomfortable, even refilling our coffees when needed.  I did notice that there were about 3 more parties dining so we never felt pressured.  It was such a nice ending after a distressing start.  The food is good (too bad I didn't read the Yelp raves on the Korean tacos before I went there) and the service outstanding.
author: Vangie F.

description:
Got eggs?

We went in to have breakfast here Wednesday morning (Sep 22). We were dubious first since the outside fascia wasn't very inviting but we needed to eat. The staff were ok. Greeted us cordially and asked that we pick any seat. We waited a bit and our drink orders were taken. Then our breakfast order was taken: Omlette for my friend and eggs and short-stack pancakes for me. We waited and waited and waited and while waiting I overheard our waitress telling a couple at another table nearby that the joint ran out of eggs. I was hoping that they hadn't run out for our order. This hope was further fueled by the fact that she walked passed our table a couple of times and didn't alert us they had ran out of eggs. So we waited another 5 minutes (total now: 35). I finally got her attention and asked when will we get our breakfast and she said: 'let me check'. Came back a minute later and told us (you guessed it): 'we ran out eggs'. When I asked when she found out, she told me she found out a minute ago. WOW! Why the (f)h(u)eck didn't she tell us when she told the other table 6 minutes ago???  And you wonder why some restaurants go out of business. Idiots.
author: Gevik N.

description:
Maybe it was the anticipation I had for seeing The Book Of Mormon at the Orpheum, but if anything, that should have set the bar high.  Sam's diner not only fit the bill, they exceeded my expectations with perfect timing, perfect food, contributing to the perfect night!
It started with the wait, with 80 minutes until show time, and 5 parties in front of us, we were not entirely confident the restaurant could not only seat, but finish our dinner service in time.  The host was polite, kept his cool, and ensured everybody spaces would be available very soon as he apologized for the wait (as if it was his fault!). He was exactly right.  We were seated with 60 minutes to spare.  Those 20 minutes waiting weren't wasted, allowing us to spy the food as it was being served to the other guests which, to my eyes, looked perfectly cooked in every case, further whetting my appetite.
The drink order was taken immediately, followed by the food order about 5 minutes later.  Perfect timing.
I ordered the blue-ribbon burger (with sautéed onions), cooked medium.  My wife had the chicken sandwich.
In line with the perfect night, my burger was cooked perfectly.  Thinking my fries were a bit underdone (served too hot for me to actually eat), a minute later they were perfect as well.
My wife thought her chicken was a little dry, but this is my review, not her's ;-)
We were done with 25 minutes to spare before show time.
These guys are lucky to be right next to the Orpheum theater, and they know it by paying attention to all the details that make theatre-goers' experience what it needs to be to be the exceptional night they're hoping for.
Oh! And the host made to give us his 'free' Orpheum advice... Pre order your drinks at the bar before the show so you don't have to be stuck in line during the intermission.  It's the little things that bump a place over the top!
We'll definitely see them next time!
author: Charles B.

description:
This was my first time trying this place today with my boyfriend. The food was great, especially the teriyaki combo! Yummy! My boyfriend ordered something with mash potatoes with gravy and corn. The gravy wasn't all that great...no FLAVOR. My order was DELICIOUS except they ran out of the potstickers! Boo!!! But it didn't matter what matter was the main course. hahaha

Here's the not so bad part of my experience: the waiter forgot to bring our salad until I had to remind him. Although he was busy and he had other people to wait on...it's understandable. I might go for a second trip when I get the chance...until then...a second review will have to wait!
author: Lily T.

description: I only had breakfast a few times here.  They have great (counter) service and good food at low prices.  The diner feels and smells a bit 'grungy' so if you don't mind that, then you'll like it here.
author: Nick H.

description:
I eat here every weekend. The waitstaff is very nice and helpful. They have a good sized menu with lots of options and the price is pretty fair. I do have to say that my favorite dinner there is their Teriyaki Chicken dinner. They say that the sauce is home made. 

Also, it is great that it is so close to the Orpheum so you can go there before or after a show.
author: Tyler D.

description:
MEH! 

("MEH!" is something akin to: Picture someone holding their head up high in a "holier than thou" pose, eyes closed with one arm outstretched, hand making that "flicking" gesture as if there is a peasant in their way and they need them removed from their sight...)

My experience here was just that... "MEH!"

We were staying in the Hotel Whitcomb for a bachelorette party fromthe night before (yes, I was at a bachelorette party...) :)  We were looking for someplace to graba quick bite the next morning before leaving the City and heading back to San Jose when we saw Sam's Diner.  I have a quaint little place that I enjoy over on Church Street off of Market, which shall remain nameless for now in this review, that I was planning on having everyone go to, but with the time we had left and parking in the CIty being what it is, we opted to run across the street to Sam's since it was close by and we saw it from our window.

The restaurant was a dirty little diner that gave us great hopes for something totally good.  You know, that "hole in the wall" kind of good...  However, all 12 of us were utterly disappointed with the experience and the food...

To sum it up quickly:

1.  The waitress was dismal
2.  My food was burned (they BURNED my Linguica) and I had to send it back (after reporting the burned linguica, the waitress came back WITH the cook  and had him look at my food as if to "confirm" that it was burned...  This was both odd and disconcerting to all of us...
3.  Half of the food orders were wrong or incomplete
4.  The food itself was just plain old "PLAIN", nothing that really stood up and out to make me want to come back and try more of their dishes
5.  The service WAS fairly fast though!

I don't expect TOO much from Diner's wherever I happen to come across a new one, but this one fell far below my already lowered expectations...

All in all, In a pinch they are "OK" but I would definitely stick with your usual favorite place(s).
author: Monty H.

description: 3.5 stars is right on. Friendly staff. Good coffee, pancakes and french toast, but not extraordinaire. I'll go again, but not before I try some other breakfast spots in the area. They don't take American Express, but that's not a big deal--just a bit of inconvenience for an out-of-towner trying to keep business expenses consolidated to a single card.
author: Marc S.

description:
After my quick visit to city hall, I asked the clerk for a recommendation for lunch.  She told us about this hole-in-the-wall spot.  So we found it & it really did look shabby from the outside.  I don't mind eating at hole in the walls since they usually have great food.  

The inside looks like a typical diner and very clean!  Even the menu was new & clean.  I had the philly cheesesteak w/ caesar salad.  The salad was a big side order, but the cheesesteak was a little bland.  There weren't any peppers & it tasted dry.  I've definitely had better.  

But their breakfast definitely looked appetizing.  The service was okay & the price is right.  I'm probably coming back here.
author: Jo B.

description: It ain't much to look at, but damn the Chicken Fried steak is good good good.  They do typical diner fare, nothing fancy, just good hearty food at a fare price.  I really like it.  I give them four stars for just being honest food.
author: Troy C.

description: We didn't expect this wonderful food in the seedy neighborhood but were pleasantly surprised. Lunch was great - beet salad was amazing and Korean tacos were delicious. The following morning we ate breakfast there and were also very pleased. The staff is welcoming - in fact, remembered us from the previous day - and we look forward to returning to Sam's the next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Toni B.

description:
I'm a regular and have never had a bad meal.  Clean, friendly and they provide a valuable service to the community.  Not too many other places around here to go that are nice.  

Keep up the good work!
author: D D.

description:
we had 1.5 hrs to spare before our time to watch wicked. we decided to walk down market to see if there's anything edible and lo and behold we found sam's diner. quickly saw the window menu and stepped in.  i'm awful with names....seriously. but our waiter, tall, blond, ponty tail guy was really nice and welcoming. i ate a huge pizza lunch so i decided on california salad and the bf got tuna melt w/ avocado.

omg the tuna melt was to die for, they made it extremely well. not greasy or too much mayo on the tuna. i was pretty jealous of his meal and kep telling him to eat salad so i can take bites our of his sandwich. hahaha. 

we both ordered blue moon and would've been nice to have the orange in it, but no biggie. 

after watching wicked i'm a big fan of musicals and will come back to sam's diner for dinner next time.
author: Katie C.

description: bi bim bob... Oh how I misss thee.... Enough food for three. You make my heart tingle.. with your sweet sesame, thinly sliced veggies, marinated bul go gi beef and fried egg over top. heaven in a bowl bigger than my head.
author: Tea F.

description: Walked down on market cause I was too early for work, so I decided to check out different place for breakfast.  I saw Sam's Diner and saw the menu out side.  First thing I saw was the super breakfast burrito ($7.61).  I always love breakfast burrito and not alot of places have them.  The place is a mom and pops restaurant dinner and it gives you that homey feel.  I got the breakfast burrito to go and eating it now.  The first bite was so tasty.  The salsa just hit my tongue and the burrito is fill with sour cream and avocado with sausage and egg.  Does taste too fatting and not that oily but I think it's still high on calories.   I think I found a new place for my breakfast burrito other then what's up dog on howard.  Next time I'll try the chicken fry steak and eggs.
author: Anthony H.

description: So far we haven't had our food yet, but I still have the need to review this place because I overheard my waiter arguing with the customer behind us about the difference between a hamburger and a cheeseburger. After the patron decided to leave, the waiter topped it off by calling a guy a "f****** idiot" right after he walked out. There is a sign warning you that if you are irritable there is a $10 charge for putting up with you. If we hadn't already put in our order we would leave, beware.
author: Christy H.

description: My fiance and I had breakfast here after an overnight stay at the Hotel Whitcomb.  The servers were friendly but very slow (could have been the kitchen staff but in any event we waited a long time to order, get our food and drink refills).  However the food was very tasty and the prices were reasonable.  I had the chicken apple sausage breakfast special.  The sausage, scrambled eggs and red potatoes were cooked to perfection.  I recommend this place if you're not in a hurry and don't want anything fancy.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: been to SF 5 years in a row. and sams diner has never let me down.. good food, service and value.. the place gets better every year.
author: W S.

description: First time eating here. Ordered a Philly cheese steak with fries, Definitely delicious, and I will be eating here again
author: Zavien F.

description: The boyfriend really likes it. Of course, the boyfriend really likes any place that has fried mozzarella sticks. Seriously, though, the food is fine. It's a place where we end up by default, and I enjoy the breakfast dishes, which are served all day. The only problem is that it's a little pricey, and the food is just okay, so it doesn't really justify that extra $2 more than my favorite places. I mean, some of my favorite diners are actually those in the Sunset (Irving Street Cafe, Howard's, etc.) so Sam's kind of pales in comparison. Still, if you're looking for a quick meal before classes, or before/after a musical or opera, hit up Sam's.
author: Kristina L.

description: Not a bad diner, actually.  This place was recommended to us by the concierge across the street at the Hotel Whitcomb.  Hubby and I went there for breakfast on our last day in SF and it was typical diner fare.  I had the chicken fried steak and it was pretty good.  Friendly staff and a clean restaurant.
author: Linda B.

description: At the peak of lunch hour, Sam's can get pretty hectic. Otherwise, you can count on friendly service and good food. I am a regular and they always remember my order. The veggie burger is the best one of it's kind in the neighborhood, I love it.
author: Laura C.

description: This place was such an incredible relief from the mess that are most restaurants along the Market Street corridor.  The service was incredible and attentive.  Food came out fast, and was incredibly good.  I got the Korean Tacos (which were amazing), and chicken strips (which were lightly breaded and not at all oily).  The prices are also great.  Highly recommend this place!
author: Kevin O.

description: We ordered lunch - I got the spinach salad which was pretty good and I'd eaten half of it when a cockroach joined our table inches from my plate.  I jumped up and the waitress came over and squished it with a napkin but didn't come back to wipe or disinfect the table.  I couldn't eat another bite since I could only wonder whether the roaches roam freely in the kitchen.  Then a deranged woman came in from the street and leaned over our table with her breasts hanging inches from my face as she reached for the ketchup.  I leaned back aghast and finally someone came over and pulled the woman away.  Is this a typical lunchtime experience?  I don't know but we got the full bill of $28 for our lunch and then the owner came and took it away and brought back a revised bill with $2 taken off! This shows no care or respect for the customer experience so I just wanted to share this for others considering Sam's Diner..  We paid the bill and left never to return.
author: christine b.

description: Wow, great burgers! We ordered a mushroom burger, avo burger and a bacon burger. They came out quick and piping hot!!! Friendly service too, would come again, nice diner.
author: Stacia S.

description: The ONLY thing I didn't care for was the slow service. Everything was so good and I fully intend on going back! Oh man, my next problem is deciding wheather I want the pancakes again, or their righteous french toast... The atmosphere was hip, the food was great, and it's RIGHT next to the BART station. You have no excuse: GO!
author: Richie B.

description: Good, two-star greasy spoon American fare.  Tender roast turkey chunks with mashed potatoes covered in salty dark brown gravy with corn and iceberg lettuce salad.  You know, that kind of place.  Extra star for booths, fast service and iced tea refills, being so unhip that it's hip, and owner 'thank you' as you leave.
author: Esther R.

description: I had lunch at Sam's Diner today with my friend Michael. YAY! The food was great. I ordered the club sandwich. It was super busy and there was a minor service lag time because of it. But I can't wait to go back and try out a few more of their menu items. YUM. It was Cheap too!
author: Aimee G.

description: I came here last night before the Wicked show at The Orpheum. Sam's Diner has a huge menu and a wonderful selection/variety of food including Grilled Cheese!!!! which is always a plus :) Classic comfort food. And they also have happy hour and are open late. I will be back again!!
author: Angela N.

description:
Yeah, I am not a fan...My Thursday lunch ladies suggested that we try this place because they had had a great experience there at some point, but I guess when we went there (about a month ago) they had new management, and everything was different...

We went to lunch, and I ordered an omelette and my friends ordered some sandwiches. Twenty five minutes later, the waitress brings us one plate of chicken, mashed potatoes and corn...It's like they thought we would share a plate that none of us ordered.  We explained to the manager what we ordered and how long we have been waiting, and it turns out our waitress messed up and didn't put in our orders. Which would be forgivable,as we all make mistakes and they gave us a slight discount, but for the small matter of the food not being good. And one of my friends had some left over mashed potatoes on her plate.
author: Masha B.

description:
Three stars is about right. For some reason, I've always been intimidated away from trying it. I don't know why. Maybe because it has two doors. Or because looks really small from the outside.

I considered getting a burger from Market Street Grill, but one look at the price made me realize that I should definitely eat elsewhere. I trooped over and decided to feed my burger kick that I've been on lately. It comes with fries, although it has no onions. It's cheaper and the milkshake was less expensive, but less chocolately. 

However the burger wasn't dry and the veggies were fresh. I had forgotten to ask for onions. The burger was filling though. I didn't care for the cheese, and the fries were okay. The ketchup packets squirted a sort of ketchup juice, which makes me think they were old packets.

From what I saw though, the interior was clean and there were definitely people who came in. They didn't have a takeout menu from what I saw, but they're pretty quick when ordering, so I don't think I'll mind walking here to order and wait.

HINT: If you're going to order the special, do it early, ie around 12. I came in at almost 1 a few weeks ago and they told me they were out of the special. I tried again today at 12 and the waitress said that their specials run out by 12:30.

EDIT: Well, I had a bad experience today. I've gone here a few times since I wrote this review--always friendly service with a smile. Today when I ordered takeout, I decided to order a milkshake on a whim. "Uuuuuh, I don't have ice cream to make a milkshake today." Well, uuuuuh, okay. I went to pickup my order and the waitress (my gut tells me she took my order), handed me the order sheet she took it on and continued to do her thing. She also placed my order on the table I decided to sit in without any sort of acknowledgment. I haven't seen her before and noticed it didn't seem like the regular wait staff there. Hopefully it's just a fluke but it put a damper on my excitement for my food.
author: AccioSoyMilk ..

description:
Had a decent bite last weekend, it's right across from the Whitcomb so it's easy & good.  Sat at the counter & I could see how small the cook's area is - he's definitely a short-order wiz & knows how to work orders when its slamming.

Have to deduct a star, though.  Ordered hash browns & bacon to be well-done crispy, and as I saw - hash browns cook on a limited space & it's probably hard to 'scatter' & cook them all.  But then I saw my bacon pulled from a tray of pre-cooked & onto my plate.  Chef saw my reaction & offered to re-grill but I declined.  Toast was absent but I mentioned and had before long (& finally got something well-done, okay, burned but I insisted they not waste it).

Service was good at the counter, several servers kept my coffee hot.
author: Miguel S.

description: I do not like this place.  I have been here twice and had to wait forever for everything!!  To be seated, to have our order taken, and most importantly we waited way too long to get our food.  This happened both times I have been.  The food is not anything to write home about and the portions could be bigger.  During the 30 minutes I was waiting for my food I looked around and noticed no one had any food on the side of the restaurant we were on.  They also have those horrible menus with pictures of the food all over it.  The pics never make the food look good.  All in all the service is slow and inattentive and the food is ok.
author: JOHN G.

description: Hot place, greasy food, slow service. But good location, I guess.
author: Pablo D.

description: Yes, it's pretty much in the Ghetto, but dude, it's Sf we are talking about. We are bound to get mugged and harassed for a burger or some spare change. Did you know that these bums accepts credit card as well? Dang, bums in Sf are doing it large. haha Anyways... we were seated in ten minutes. Button and I were hungry. It's been a long walk. So we decided to try this place, which was across from our hotel. I ordered the Korean taco, yes... this American place serves Korean food. After all I believe the owner was Korean. Any who Button ordered the spicy pork sandwich... that was a fail attempt. The meat was tough, and hard to chew... the flavor was lacking. Now, mine in the other hand was yummy. My meat was pretty tender and you get all of the Asian flavor in one taco. My plate came with three good sized tacos. You can taste the ginger from the taco. I can almost compare my dish to a sesame salad. Yup that's what it taste like. The diner was packed after we were helped, so our server became a ghost. Yup... I had to wave different people down for some service. So uh.. if you are hungry and have all the time in the world, why not come here? Cheap and pretty decent.
author: Vanna Y.

description: The food here is phenomenal! My french toast was great. However, my husband's corned beef eggs benedict was AMAZING. Who would have thought that corned beef and hollandaise sauce went well together? But it does. It so very much does.
author: Dianne L.

description: I thought the hash browns were fantastic and so were the chicken apple sausages.  Fairly decent low priced place.  The highlight was definitely the hashies.
author: Chaz N.

description: Typical breakfast joint. Nothing too special. Nothing extraordinary on the menu. Very basic breakfast items. Have had the eggs and toast. Friendly service. Good for a simple breakfast or lunch. Convenient b/c it's about a block from my work.
author: Veronica H.

description:
Nice place to eat and pretty good food.  I was really pleased when the new owners decided to say open until 10 in the evening.   But....  If they ever learn to keep reliable hours, it would be worth another star.  But when I go our to eat in the evening, the number one thing I want is a place that will be open when it claims to be.  It's understandable when they close fifteen minutes early if there's a small crowd, or even thirty minutes.  But so on, my luck has been about 50-50 in finding them open even an hour before they claim to be.  

So two stars for you, Sam's.
author: Everett L.

description: We stopped here after walking around S.F. all morning for some lunch and were pleasantly surprised.  The food was excellent as well as the ice cold beer.  Our server was super friendly and funny too, she had no problem dealing with our group of 9 loud and rowdy people.
author: Lorna C.

description:
Went here for a late dinner.  Most of the menu was breakfast items, so I got my mind set on breakfast.  I had just driven from Los Angeles to San Francisco, I was hungry, and I had not had a proper breakfast in the morning.  I asked the waitress if they still served breakfast.  She said that grills had already been shut down and cleaned, so I would not be able to order breakfast.  No problem, I'll order the Chicken Avocado Sandwich with french fries.  One other member of my group ordered Fish and Chips.
5 minutes later, the waitress comes back and very apologetically informs us that something is wrong with the fryer and the fish came out ok, but the french fries did not and we had some choices for substitutions.  No problem.
The food was very greasy, nothing special.  My Chicken Avocado sandwich was pretty good, but too greasy.  I would compare this place to a poor-man's Denny's.  The place is a greasy diner type restaurant with some unusual paintings on the wall.  Almost like it is a gallery for a painter, but I'm not sure.
As we get our check and get ready to pay, we notice two police officers sitting at the counter.  What are they eating? Breakfast.  WTF?
Left a minimal tip for the waitress and left.  I won't be eating here ever again.
author: S. M.

description: Seriously good diner breakfast, sub-par coffee.  Service is personably and efficient.  There are cheaper diners though, a few blocks off Market...but the presence of San Francisco's finest taking their breaks here definitely give this place a leg up in the neighborhood-spot atmosphere department.
author: Francesca R.

description: We went to Sam's tonight before Wicked, I chose it for it's location and the reviews I read.  It did not disappoint!  We arrived at 6, were seated quickly and our order was taken quickly too.  We had simple fare; BLT with super yummy bacon, my 11 year old had the hot dog and said it was great! and our third diner had the tuna melt, that she loved.  The wait staff of two, were friendly and swift.  This will become my GO TO spot for any event in the Civic Center Area.  The local art was also very cool!
author: Melissa K.

description:
Staying at the Whitcomb hotel doesn't leave many other options for breakfast other than Sam's Diner.   

This place has the WORST service ever.  I ordered a bagel and fruit for breakfast... my fiance ordered pancakes, sausage and scrambled eggs.  It took about 10 minutes to get my bagel and fruit - that's fine, it was really busy.  I started nibbling on my fruit, trying to wait for fiance's food... didn't want to be rude and eat without him.  5 minutes passed by, and my bagel started getting cold - so I put a dab of cream cheese on it and started nibbling on that too... 10 minutes went by, and still no sight of the pancakes - good luck trying to get someone's attention to ask them where the H your food is.  Finally what looked like the owner came over to our table and asked us if we were finished.  FINISHED?  UH... yeah, he never got his food (I said pointing to fiance).  So the guy went to check on it - 5 more minutes go by and they bring out some food for him, but instead of sausage they bring him bacon and the waitress has the nerve to tell us - It's been done, we just forgot to bring it to you.  Yeah that was obvious with the freezing cold eggs and bacon.  She dropped the plate and ran off before we had a chance to tell her the order was wrong, so I had to get up from the table to track her down and tell her the order was wrong.  5 minutes later we get the sausage and hot eggs.  GRRRRR!!!!  The only saving grace - the reason for the two stars instead of 1 was that the food was actually really tasty.  

Stick with starbucks - avoid sams.
author: Mariah C.

description: Hey, it's a greasy spoon, and you get what you pay for. If you're looking for haute cuisine, then you're probably going to have to pay more than $5 for your meal. If you're looking for a cheap breakfast with no frills, then Steven's is a decent option.
author: Ziad E.

description: Close to home, cheap, a little skeezy.  Everything's edible, although their hours aren't great.  Tennessee Grill is just a notch better.
author: Frankie D.

description: Decent, cheap - because of the service, but good comfort food .  Don't go  on the weekends though.  One short order cook, one wait staff, and one cashier/server = slow service.
author: Tiberius A.

description: I popped in here after a flight into town.  I was staying at the Hotel Whitcomb across the street.  I ordered the burger and fries with an iced tea and enjoyed my experience and food.  It was a friendly atmosphere highlighted by my waiter Kevin.  He was excellent.  I recommend coming in here if you want a good, affordable meal.  The milk shakes looked good too!
author: Mark S.

description: Small place with big taste. Went for breakfast twice, both times the food was good and the staff was very friendly. The chicken fried steak was amazing... especially the gravy. Reasonably priced, would definately go back.
author: Tamika K.

description: Service was on the slow side. We had a late breakfast (points cause they serve breakfast all day, that's awesome). This place is mediocre, not much going on................um they serve beer...sierra nevada to be exact. we ate here cause it was close to the hotel....not bad though...
author: Len C.

description: This place is just ok. The food is ok, the service is ok, the ambience is slightly sub-ok, and the prices are ok. Nothing really stood out about it--maybe I have yet to have this place's specialty, but I'm not terribly inclined to go back.
author: Adam E.

description: Today my girlfriend and I decided to check this place out since its so close to my home. I ordered the short stack with strawberry's, eggs, and bacon and boy was it yummy. They cook there bacon perfectly (to my standards at least) and the the serves was great. The host Jason was extremely polite and our waitress Tiffany was just as sweet. They have very strong customer service and the food was good, the price even better=) will definitely go back
author: Krysteena W.

description: We were in SF for a week from 7/22 to 7/28 and ate here for breakfast twice and lunch once.  It was always packed at breakfast.  I would agree that service is slow...they do NOT have enough staff working the floor.  The cook, at least at breakfast, worked his butt off.  We sat along the "bar" and were able to watch him...could not believe the food he turned around.  We didn't have any complaints about the quality of the food we had for breakfast or lunch and for breakfast it was the best food we had the entire trip.  If you are looking for a fast turn around on your food this isn't the place to go but otherwise give it a try.
author: Jeff M.

description: a tourist trap diner on market, but not terribly so... just not worth going to, really. the service was uninspired, the food was basic and meh, and it was clearly for the out of towners. nothing worth bothering about.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: this place is a bit of an oasis in an "interesting" part of market street - straightforward food and drink with extremely friendly upbeat staff
author: Nancy M.

description: I had a hour before the show started at the Orphean theater and with two kids it isn't easy to pull that off when I don't know where to go. I walked across the street to the hotel to find $25 a plate and I was ready to do it being I was out of time. But I figured I would take the family across the street and check out Sams. It looked a little funky from the outside and let's face it, there is some seriously funky stuff around there, not the "theater district", not nice at all. I took the chance and went into Sams and was VERY happy I did! The menu was huge, the lady who owned the place (I think she did) came by the table a number of times with friendly conversation. The food was great, we ate it all, paid the check and was gone in plenty of time to see "Wicked". I go to the city often and this place has been added to my list of "safe places" to go for meals. I found it to be as comfortable as my local favorite here in my home town of Fremont.
author: Brian M.

description: had only an hour before wicked so ate here. salad was okay. onion rings were fine. ny steak was horrible. very bad quality meat. worst steak i've ever had. mashed potatoes were fine. dessert was good..had strawberry cheesecake..but have to give 2 stars due to horrible steak.
author: dylan d.
